title: Marketing & Growth Lead
description:
About Access Plus Health

Access Plus Health is a physician-led, multi-state compliance infrastructure company supporting healthcare operators across the United States. We provide:

Medical directorship services

Supervisory and collaborative agreements

Corporate Practice of Medicine (CPOM) structuring

State-by-state compliance frameworks

Ongoing audit-ready oversight

Founded by a Harvard-trained, board-certified physician, APH is not a commodity compliance shop. We operate at the intersection of healthcare regulation, legal structure, and operational execution.

We are entering a strategic growth phase and are hiring a Marketing & Growth Lead to build and own the entire top-of-funnel engine.

This is a leadership-level role, not a junior content position.



Core Responsibilities

What this person does: They own the entire top-of-funnel — both the marketing execution and the content creation. Their job is to write SEO-optimized articles, manage social media, run
 campaigns and paid ads, and generate a consistent stream of inbound leads. With AI writing tools, a strong offshore marketer can handle both the content production and the campaign management that would previously have required two separate hires. The founder provides clinical and regulatory knowledge; this person turns it into content and leads. They are NOT responsible for closing deals.

Core responsibilities: Write 2–3 long-form SEO articles per week (1,200–2,500 words) on healthcare compliance topics using AI tools for research acceleration and the founder's input for clinical accuracy. Manage LinkedIn content (ghostwriting for the founder, 3–5 posts/week). Run paid social ad campaigns 
, Instagram, LinkedIn) targeting NPs, PAs, and medspa owners. Plan and execute webinars (logistics, promotion, registration, follow-up). Manage
 marketing and nurture sequences. Manage and grow the referral partner program. Track and report on lead generation metrics (website traffic,
 signups, webinar registrations, inbound inquiries, cost per lead).



Key Responsibilities



1. SEO & Authority Content Engine

You will build APH into the most authoritative compliance resource online.

Responsibilities:

Publish 2–3 long-form articles per week (1,500–3,000 words)

Create state-by-state compliance guides

Build structured content clusters:

CPOM laws by state

Med spa legal requirements

NP supervision laws

Telehealth regulatory frameworks

Optimize for high-intent keywords

Build backlink strategy

Conduct quarterly SEO audits

Deliverables:

Editorial calendar

Keyword research framework

Monthly organic growth reports



2. Founder Thought Leadership (LinkedIn Authority Strategy)

You will position the founder as a national compliance voice.

Responsibilities:

Write 3–5 LinkedIn posts per week

Turn regulatory updates into educational threads

Publish 2 long-form LinkedIn articles monthly

Create case study breakdowns (without violating confidentiality)

Monitor engagement and refine messaging



Goal:

Build trust with healthcare entrepreneurs

Establish APH as premium authority, not discount provider



3.
 Marketing & Nurture Systems

You will build lifecycle marketing automation.

Responsibilities:

Develop 5–7
 nurture sequences:

Med spa

Telehealth

NP practice

Cold leads

Webinar registrants

Create monthly regulatory update newsletter

Optimize open rates and CTR

Segment list by vertical and state

KPIs:

30%+ open rate

5–10% CTR on educational
s



4. Webinar & Educational Funnel Development

We will educate the market.

Responsibilities:

Plan and execute monthly webinars

Develop landing pages

Coordinate promotion strategy

Build follow-up automation

Track webinar-to-client conversion rates

Goal:

Turn regulatory confusion into booked discovery calls.



5. Paid Acquisition Strategy

You will design and optimize paid campaigns.

Channels:

/Instagram (med spa owners)

LinkedIn Ads (healthcare founders)

Google Search (high-intent compliance searches)

Responsibilities:

Build funnel tracking

A/B test landing pages

Monitor cost per qualified lead

Scale profitable campaigns



6. Brand Positioning & Messaging

This role includes shaping how APH is perceived.

You will:

Refine core messaging

Ensure premium positioning

Avoid discount-service framing

Create clarity around compliance-first value

Align brand voice across website, ads, content

7. Analytics & Reporting

You must be metrics-driven.

You will track:

Cost per qualified lead

Conversion rate to booked call

Conversion rate to client

Customer acquisition cost

Traffic growth

Content ROI

Monthly executive-level reporting required.



Required Qualifications

3+ years of digital marketing experience with a strong content writing focus

Excellent written English — this is the most important qualification, as this person will be writing thousands of words per week

Proficiency with AI writing tools (ChatGPT, Claude, etc.) for research and drafting. 

Experience with SEO, HubSpot (or similar CRM/marketing platform), and paid social. 

Comfortable with data and reporting. Does NOT need to be a closer or salesperson.

Strong analytical mindset

High ownership mentality



Preferred:

Healthcare or regulatory experience

Experience marketing to med spas or telehealth

Understanding of U.S. compliance landscape



Who Should Not Apply

Designers without growth strategy background

Social media managers without SEO experience

Entry-level marketers

Candidates uncomfortable with metrics

title: STR Property Manager
description:
Reports to: Operations Director

Location: Remote (Must have stable, high-speed internet)

Type: Full Time (High availability required, including weekends/off-hours as dictated by business needs)

Salary: Negotiable



Who We Are

Five Oak is a boutique property management company that owns and manages a curated collection of luxury homes across the United States. We are not a massive, faceless corporation; we are a dedicated team that takes immense pride in the assets we own and the experiences we create. We focus on creating smooth operations behind the scenes, partnering with trusted local vendors, and maintaining strong communication to deliver a consistent and elevated service.

We are building a team that thinks like owners. We value radical accountability, proactive decision-making, and the ability to solve complex problems without hand-holding. At Five Oak, every detail matters, and "good enough" is not in our vocabulary.



The Mission: Why We Need You

Let’s be clear: We need an operator, not just a coordinator.

We are looking for someone to take full ownership of our property portfolio from Point A to Point B. We have a suite of advanced tools (including AI support) to help you, but tools don't solve problems—people do.

You will be the "CEO" of your assigned properties. You are responsible for auditing current processes, managing vendor relationships, driving revenue through smart pricing audits, and ensuring that if a guest has a problem, it is solved before they even hang up the phone.



Key Responsibilities



1. End-to-End Property Ownership

Full Accountability: Take total responsibility for the health and performance of the homes. If a toilet runs, a guest complains, or a calendar is blocked incorrectly, you own the resolution. This includes proactive property and regular maintenance.

Proactive Auditing: Regularly audit property listings (photos, descriptions, communication language), pricing strategies, and operational workflows. Don't wait for something to break; fix it before it becomes an issue.

Creative Problem Solving: Use creativity to handle complex guest scenarios or logistical nightmares. We want solutions, not just reports on what went wrong.

Intense attention to detail: ensure all details for all properties are updated. Assign and monitor tasks, identify issues, find solutions, and ensure visibility to the remainder of team. Thoroughly draft, create, audit, and follow operational checklists.

Review optimization: ensure sentiment is good for guests to proactively prevent bad reviews and ensure good ones.



2. KPI Management & Process Optimization

Build & Track KPIs: Develop and maintain Key Performance Indicators (Response Time, Review Scores, Vendor Cost/Performance, Occupancy Rates). You must be comfortable looking at data and explaining why the numbers are moving.

Process Improvement: Constantly review our SOPs. If a process is slow or expensive, rewrite it. If a price looks too low, flag it and adjust it. If we’re paying too much for a vendor, fix it. Don’t just pay the $500 invoice, ask why it was $500.

Tech Utilization: Leverage our AI tools and CRM to automate the mundane, allowing you to focus on high-level hospitality and strategy.

Reporting: Prepare shift or daily reports for internal communication.



3. Guest Experience & Radical Responsiveness

High-Touch Communication: Handle guest complaints with empathy, speed, and authority. Turn a frustrated guest into a 5-star review through quick thinking.

Availability: Hospitality happens 24/7. You must be extremely responsive to urgent issues. A break in communication can ruin a trip; you ensure that never happens.

Quality Control: Monitor guest sentiment and reviews to ensure every stay meets the Five Oak luxury standard.



4. Vendor Management & Logistics

Command the Supply Chain: You don’t just "schedule" cleaners; you manage them. Negotiate rates, audit their work via photos/video, and hold them accountable to our standards. Turnovers must be completed on time, and properties ready for check-in.

Maintenance Coordination: Oversee repairs from the initial work order to final payment. Ensure vendors are paid correctly and jobs are done right the first time.

Inventory & Assets: Track inventory and supplies proactively to prevent shortages, work with vendors on this.



Who You Are

You act like an owner: You treat our money and our homes as if they were your own.

You are data-driven: You understand that feelings don’t scale—metrics do. You are comfortable building scorecards and tracking performance.

You are unshakeable: When a pipe bursts at 2 AM or a guest is unhappy, you don't panic. You execute.

You are tech-forward: You are comfortable with PM software (Guesty, Breezeway, etc.), Slack, SuiteOps, OTAs and AI tools.

You are hospitality focused: These guests are creating memories and can be stressed. You have to treat them as such.

You are articulate: Your written and verbal English is impeccable. You can negotiate with a contractor and soothe an angry VIP guest with equal ease.



Qualifications

Experience: 3+ years in property management, luxury hospitality, or high-level operations.

Skillset: Strong background in creating SOPs, managing vendors, and analyzing pricing/market trends.

Tech: Proficiency in Property Management Software (PMS), OTA platforms (Airbnb, VRBO), and dynamic pricing tools.

Availability: Must be willing to work flexible hours. This is not a strict 9-5; this is a results-based role. Ability to respond off hours when urgent issues arise. Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.



Ready to apply?

Fill this form: 
tion.site/2b2e953de1a8804a9382de9f90225fa4?pvs=105



We look forward to your application!

Skillset: Strong background in creating SOPs, managing vendors, and analyzing pricing/market trends.

Tech: Proficiency in Property Management Software (PMS), OTA platforms (Airbnb, VRBO), and dynamic pricing tools.

title: E-commerce Operations & Supplier Manager (Shopify – Dropshipping)
description:
Position: Part-Time ? Growth to Full-Time

Starting Rate: $3.50/hour (growth to $6/hour based on performance)



About the Role:



We are looking for a proactive E-commerce Operations Manager to oversee daily order flow, supplier communication, COG monitoring, and operational efficiency for a UK-focused fashion brand.



This role is not about waiting for instructions, we want someone who takes initiative and improves systems.



Responsibilities:



- Monitoring daily orders in Shopify

- Ensuring all orders are fulfilled and shipped correctly

- Communicating with suppliers

- Checking product quality issues

- Sourcing better factories if needed

- Monitoring COG (Cost of Goods)

- Negotiating supplier pricing if COG becomes too high

- Flagging risky orders or operational issues

- Maintaining tracking spreadsheets

- Identifying inefficiencies and suggesting improvements



Requirements:



- Experience working with Shopify stores

- Dropshipping experience preferred

- Strong English communication skills

- Experience communicating with suppliers

- Basic understanding of profit margins & COG

- Experience with Google Sheets / Excel

- Proactive mindset



Bonus



- Experience with Chinese suppliers (1688 / Alibaba / agents)

- Understanding of UK market

- Experience improving delivery times or reducing refund rates

- Important



You must:



- Explain previous experience managing orders

- Provide examples of supplier negotiation

- Complete a short practical task before hiring

- We are looking for someone reliable, long-term, and growth-focused.



Working Hours & Structure



This is a flexible part-time role in the beginning.



As we are a growing brand, workload may vary depending on dispute volume. Some days may require approximately 2 hours of work, while busier periods may require up to 5 hours per day.



The ideal candidate:



- Is comfortable with flexible daily hours

- Can adjust based on workload

- Is available to increase hours as the business grows



There is strong potential for this role to grow into a consistent long-term position.





This is a flexible part-time position during the initial phase.



As we are scaling, daily workload may fluctuate. Some days may require around 2 hours, while others may require up to 5 hours depending on order volume and operational needs.



We are looking for someone who:



- Is comfortable with variable hours

- Can respond when workload increases

- Is interested in long-term growth into a more stable full-time role



This position is ideal for someone who wants to grow with an expanding e-commerce brand.

title: Recruitment Operations Manager
description:
Job Overview

WithPort is seeking a Recruitment Operations Manager to oversee workforce operations in the Philippines. This role is responsible for managing recruitment processes, employee administration, payroll coordination, and client staffing support to ensure smooth and efficient operations.



The successful candidate will serve as a key liaison between internal teams, employees, and clients, ensuring workforce delivery, compliance, and operational excellence.



Primary Responsibilities

Recruitment & Talent Acquisition

Manage end-to-end recruitment processes for internal and client-facing roles

Coordinate sourcing, screening, interviews, and hiring workflows

Maintain candidate pipelines and improve time-to-fill metrics

Ensure a professional and consistent candidate experience

Support onboarding coordination and documentation



Workforce & Employee Operations

Oversee employee records, documentation, and HR files

Manage onboarding and offboarding procedures

Track attendance, schedules, and workforce data

Address employee concerns and coordinate resolutions

Promote professional standards and accountability across teams



Payroll & Administrative Coordination

Prepare payroll data including hours, rates, incentives, and adjustments

Ensure accurate and timely payroll submission

Maintain compensation records and documentation

Support compliance with internal policies and employment standards



Client Staffing & Communication

Coordinate staffing allocations based on client needs

Communicate staffing updates and operational matters with clients

Support service delivery by ensuring workforce readiness

Assist in resolving staffing-related issues promptly



Operations & Process Management

Monitor internal workflows and operational performance

Maintain reports, trackers, and dashboards

Identify process gaps and recommend operational improvements

Support leadership with operational insights and workforce data



Qualifications

Minimum 5 years of experience in recruitment, HR operations, or workforce management

Strong organizational and project coordination skills

Experience managing remote or distributed teams preferred

Familiarity with payroll coordination processes

Excellent written and verbal English communication

Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple priorities

title: FP&A Analyst / Finance Analyst
description:
This role is FULL-TIME and requires prior FP&A or financial analysis experience. DO NOT APPLPY IF YOU DO NOT HAVE EXPERIENCE IN FP&A, FINANCIAL ANALYSIS, OR SIMILAR ROLES.



That said, candidates do not need to meet every listed qualification. If you have a strong technical foundation in FP&A particularly in financial modeling, budgeting, forecasting, and data analysis, we encourage you to apply.



Core Responsibilities



1. Financial Modeling

- Build and maintain complex, driver-based financial models (3-statement, SaaS, subscription, marketplace, services models)

- Develop rolling forecasts and dynamic scenario planning frameworks

- Construct headcount models, revenue models (MRR/ARR, churn, cohort), and unit economics analysis

- Design board-ready forecast models with sensitivity and downside planning

- Stress-test assumptions and validate model integrity



2. Budgeting & Forecast Infrastructure

- Own end-to-end annual budgeting and quarterly reforecast processes

- Implement structured forecasting cadences with KPI-based drivers

- Translate operational metrics into financial projections

- Improve forecast accuracy through variance tracking and driver refinement



3. Data Architecture & Systems Integration

- Design automated reporting workflows across ERP, CRM, billing, and FP&A platforms

- Integrate NetSuite, QuickBooks, Jirav, Adaptive, or similar tools into reporting frameworks

- Build data pipelines from accounting systems into reporting dashboards

- Query and manipulate financial datasets using SQL

- Partner with clients to structure chart of accounts for analytical clarity

- Improve data integrity, validation controls, and reconciliation frameworks



4. Executive Reporting & Analytics

- Build executive dashboards in Power BI, Tableau, or similar tools

- Deliver KPI frameworks tied to growth, profitability, and capital efficiency

- Perform deep variance analysis (budget vs. actual vs. forecast)

- Analyze margin drivers, CAC/LTV, burn rate, runway, working capital, and capital deployment

- Support investor reporting and fundraising financial models



5. Operational & Strategic Analysis

- Conduct pricing analysis and margin modeling

- Perform scenario modeling for capital raises, debt facilities, and equity dilution

- Build pro forma financials for M&A or expansion initiatives

- Analyze cost structures and operational leverage



Experience:

- 5+ years in FP&A, corporate finance, investment analysis, or financial modeling

- Experience building complex financial models from scratch (not template-based only)

- Experience in high-growth, SaaS, or technology-driven companies strongly preferred

- Experience working with multiple business models (subscription, usage-based, services, marketplace)

- Exposure to multi-entity, multi-currency environments is a plus



Technical Skills:

- Experience with Syft and Fathom is a plus

- Advanced Excel / Google Sheets (dynamic models, scenario toggles, macros, array formulas)

- Financial modeling best practices (model architecture, documentation, version control)

- Experience with FP&A platforms (Jirav, Adaptive Insights, NetSuite Planning, Anaplan, etc.)

- Strong ERP knowledge (QuickBooks, NetSuite preferred)

- SQL proficiency

- Data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, Looker, etc.)

- Understanding of SaaS metrics (MRR, ARR, churn, LTV/CAC, NRR, burn multiple, rule of 40)

- Familiarity with automation tools (Zapier, APIs, reporting connectors) preferred



Education & Certifications

- Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, Engineering, Data Analytics, or related field

- CPA, CFA, or FP&A certification preferred



What We Offer

• Competitive salary

• HMO coverage

• 13th month pay

• Paid holidays

• Paid time off (PTO)

• Remote setup



How to Apply

Please write a short cover letter and share a Google Drive link to your resume. Ensure the link is accessible to anyone with the link.

title: Full-time Salesforce Marketing Cloud Developer, Manila
description:
Full-time Salesforce Marketing Cloud Developer, Manila



Who is Comet CX?

Comet CX is a young and digitally focused customer experience consultancy. After launching at the beginning of 2021, we’ve seen early success and are now looking to grow our team to continue supporting our existing clients and meet high demand for project work. As a Salesforce Partner, a key part of our offering is the implementation of Salesforce CRM and Marketing Cloud, with a special focus on Marketing Cloud Personalisation (formerly Interaction Studio). 



What is this role?

As a Salesforce Marketing Cloud Developer at Comet CX, you will work closely with our Architects and CX Consultants across our Australian and Manila teams to help design, build, and maintain Marketing Cloud solutions for our clients. This is a great opportunity for someone looking to grow their SFMC skills in a supportive, collaborative environment while contributing to real client outcomes. Your responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:



1. Solution Development & Customisation — Contribute to the development of tailored solutions across the Salesforce Marketing Stack, including personalised customer experiences using Salesforce Personalisation.

2. Campaign Design & Management — Assist in designing, implementing, and managing multi-channel marketing campaigns spanning
, SMS, and push notifications, leveraging Journey Builder to build automated customer journeys.

3. Data Configuration & Management — Support data configuration, segmentation, and integrity within Marketing Cloud, including managing data flows and synchronisation between Salesforce Data Cloud and Marketing Cloud.

4. System Integration — Assist in integrating Marketing Cloud with CRM, ERP, and third-party platforms, ensuring seamless data connectivity and enriched customer insights via Salesforce Data Cloud.

- Automation & Scripting — Build and maintain automation workflows using Journey Builder and Automation Studio, and support the implementation of real-time engagement solutions using Marketing Cloud Engagement.

5. Performance Optimisation & Analytics — Support campaign performance through A/B testing, analytics, and data-led recommendations that improve client outcomes and ROI.

6. Reporting & Insights — Generate and interpret campaign performance reports, monitor key metrics, and surface actionable insights using Marketing Cloud's native reporting tools.

7. Technical Issue Resolution — Help identify and resolve technical issues in Marketing Cloud, including troubleshooting integration and data-sync problems across connected systems.

8. Client Collaboration & Training — Work alongside senior tea
mbers to support client engagements, understand marketing objectives, and contribute to training and enablement sessions.

9. Documentation & Compliance — Contribute to technical documentation for solutions and integrations, ensuring adherence to data protection regulations and industry best practices.

10. Continuous Learning — Actively grow your knowledge of Salesforce products — including Marketing Cloud Engagement, Account Engagement, Personalisation, and Data Cloud — and take ownership of your professional development.



Who are we looking for?

We're looking for a junior to mid-level Salesforce Marketing Cloud Developer who is eager to learn, grow, and make a real impact in a collaborative, client-facing environment. At Comet CX, you'll be mentored by experienced Architects and Consultants while building your skills across a diverse range of clients and projects.



We're looking for a candidate who brings the following to the table:

1. 1–3 years of experience working with Salesforce Marketing Cloud, whether in an implementation, consulting, or in-house marketing capacity

2. A solid foundational understanding of the Salesforce Marketing Cloud platform, with some exposure to related Salesforce solutions such as Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, or Communities

3. Good communication skills, attention to detail, and a proactive, can-do approach to problem-solving

4. At least one relevant Salesforce Marketing Cloud certification (Marketing Cloud Consultant or Marketing Cloud Developer) is preferred, though a genuine drive to certify will also be considered



The following would make a candidate stand out, though they're not essential:

1. Some exposure to Marketing Cloud Personalization

2. Some exposure to Snowflake Data Cloud

3. Familiarity with Sales Cloud or Service Cloud

4. Prior experience in a consulting, managed services, or CX-focused organisation

5. Understanding of how to get the best value from AI tools, including prompt engineering and context engineering



What can Comet CX offer? 

As a young, growing business, you will be exposed to a wide variety of customers and technical challenges. No two days will be the same. We are offering a generous salary and bonus structure for this role, based on your level of experience.



Is this role right for you?

We’d love to hear from you. Please send through your resume and optional cover letter to

title: Social Media & Automation Manager (GoHighLevel + AI Workflows)
description:
We are a growing mortgage company looking for a high-level executor who can own both our social media presence and our automation systems.



This role is for someone who understands branding and engagement, but also knows how to build the backend systems that turn attention into leads, and leads into closed deals.



You will work directly with leadership to grow visibility, improve efficiency, and help scale the business through content, automation, and data.



This is not a strategy-only position. We need someone who builds, executes, tracks, and improves.

title: Virtual Assistant | Appointment Setter (Part-time)
description:
Title: Virtual Assistant | Appointment Setter (Part-Time, potential to become full-time)

Job Pay: $50/week ($200/month) – paid weekly

Company: Season’s Cleanings



About the Role: Season’s Cleanings is a fast-growing residential cleaning company, and we’re looking for ONE dependable, detail-loving STAR Virtual Assistant to join our core team for part-time support.



What does it mean to be a STAR Virtual Assistant?

S – Serve – Act in the best interest of the client.

T – Teammate – Act in the best interest of your teammates.

A – Accountable – Take responsibility for your actions.

R – Reliable – Follow through on your commitments.



Pay: $50/week with potential raises as the company grows!



Schedule:

Monday to Friday8am-9am CST and 4pm-7pm CST (split shift) Approximately 20 hours per week



If you enjoy working with leads, learning scripts, and supporting sales operations, this role is for you. You’ll play a key part in helping us book more appointments and grow the business.



Key Responsibilities:

Setting calls for inbound LSA (Local Service Ads)Handling outbound calls (hot
 leads)

Hopping on the phone with LSA messages to set up appointments for sales calls

Learning the setting script and becoming comfortable with it

Handling 3 lead sources and getting the sales calls booked in GHL (GoHighLevel) calendar

Ensuring the office is properly set up for the day without being reactive with sales calls or messages that come in from 8-9am

Ensuring calls are answered promptly







Requirements:

Proven experience as a Virtual Assistant or in a phone/sales support role

Strong phone communication skills and comfortable making outbound calls

Excellent spoken English communication

Comfortable learning scripts and following processes

Able to work independently and stay focused during shift hours

Proficient in basic tools like calendars and CRM systems (GoHighLevel experience is a plus)

Reliable computer and strong, stable internet connectionA positive, proactive, “figure it out” attitude



Strict Requirements:

Be able to commit long-term (at least 9 months) and grow with the company

Be able to commit to our NO RTO (Request for Time Off Policy) for the first 30 days of employment

Must be available during the specified hours: 8am-9am CST and 4pm-7pm CST, Monday-Friday

We’re looking for someone who can take ownership of their work, learns quickly, and is excited to be part of a supportive, growing team—not just “another gig.”



Benefits:

Comprehensive Paid Training – We’ll walk you through our scripts, systems, and expectations step by step

Paid Time Off (after initial period)

PH Holiday Pay (for applicable holidays you work)

Revenue-Based Salary Increases & Incentives – As the company grows, your earning potential grows too



If you’re comfortable on the phone, love supporting sales operations, and want a stable part-time role with room to grow, we’d love to hear from you!

title: WordPress & Shopify Store Developer
description:
Arispheris is looking for a highly skilled Website Developer to join our team for a 3-month full-time project term, with potential for extension. This is a remote position, but we require a designer who can work independently, take initiative, and bring fresh, original creativity to the table—no AI-generated websites will be accepted.



If you thrive in an environment that values creative autonomy, attention to detail, and hands-on design skills, we’d love to hear from you.



Company Overview

Arispheris is a staffing firm that provides authentic and connective staffing solutions for small business owners. We take pride in our in-depth recruiting process, ensuring that every professional we bring on board has the skills and drive to succeed.



We are actively expanding our design team and are looking for a Website Developer who excels at crafting fast and SEO ready websites to support clients in reaching their target audiences to increase revenue and website traffic. If you want to be part of a team that values true creative expertise, this is the perfect opportunity for you!



Requirements & Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Web development or related field, or relevant experience.

Minimum of 2 years of professional experience in website design and coding.

Website and software application designing, building, or maintaining, without AI.

Using scripting or authoring languages, management tools, content creation tools, applications, and digital media.

Conferring with teams to resolve conflicts, prioritize needs, develop content criteria, or choose solutions.

Directing or performing Website updates.

Developing or validating test routines and schedules to ensure that test cases mimic external interfaces and address all browser and device types.

Editing, writing, or designing Website content, and directing tea
mbers who produce content.

Maintaining an understanding of the latest Web applications and programming practices through education, study, and training. 

Back up files from Web sites to local directories for recovery.

Create daily logs of tasks completed for company and client reference.

Identifying problems uncovered by customer feedback and testing, and correcting or referring problems to appropriate personnel for correction.

Evaluating code to ensure it meets industry standards, is valid, is properly structured, and is compatible with browsers, devices, or operating systems.

Determining user needs by analyzing technical requirements.

Must be highly proficient in both WordPress, their respective plugins, & Shopify—you will be tested during the interview.

Strong sense of design composition.

Ability to create websites quickly and efficiently while maintaining a high standard of design quality.

Excellent communication skills and ability to work collaboratively with clients and teams.

Detail-oriented and capable of handling multiple projects at once while meeting deadlines.

Familiarity with tools like Google Workspace, Slack, and Asana is a plus.

Absolutely no AI-generated designs, portfolios, and websites will be considered.



Software & Platform Requirements:

Expertise in WordPress, Shopify and Elementor

Solid understanding of UX/UI principles

Proficiency in HTML and Python coding

Experience with affiliate marketing strategies

Proficiency with Shopify e-commerce platforms



Compensation & Benefits

Full-time remote position (3-month term, potential for extension based on performance)

Competitive compensation based on experience and skills

Bi-monthly pay via money transfer

Paid career training relevant to the role (should you be hired for longer than nine months) 

Performance-based bonuses (available for long-term staff)

Work-life balance and flexible hours



As part of our team, you'll interact closely with clients, forming strong partnerships. You'll use your excellent communication skills to understand, negotiate, and ultimately create tailored solutions that exceed expectations. Does the idea of such meaningful client engagement unnerve you? If not, then you're ready to contribute to our shared vision. Here are the next steps to move forward.



***Very Important***

How to Apply

We will be holding interviews on Wednesday, Friday, and Saturday this week for immediate hiring contingent on your skills, your interview task performance and company fit.



To Apply, Follow These Steps:

Reply with your Name and Position in the subject line. Example: "John Doe – WordPress & Shopify Store Developer"

Define a "backend developer staging area" in WordPress/ CPanel (this is part of your application process).



Submit the following in your response
:

Your resume (CV)

Portfolio links showcasing your original design work (Absolutely NO AI-generated websites. Wordpress & Shopify Shops ONLY)

List links to Wordpress & Shopify Sites you have designed.

One employer reference



Candidates that do not submit the requested items will not be considered. 



Once we receive your application, we will send you a scheduler to book your interview slot. During your interview, you will be required to demonstrate proficiency in Wordpress, Developer Backend, and Shopify Shop Setup.



If you’re ready to bring your creativity to a team that values real site developer expertise, we look forward to your application!

title: SEO & AI Search Specialist (GEO/AEO)
description:
HOW TO APPLY

If this role feels like the perfect fit and you meet the qualifications, we invite you to learn more about our team in the Philippines and submit your application here: 
/appzq4iqeIREQRVyo/pagyn70NlQQGtKUtK/form



Note: Only applications submitted via the above link will be considered.



---

We’re hiring an SEO & AI Search Specialist to grow organic visibility and revenue across traditional search and AI-driven answer engines. You’ll own strategy and execution for our Shopify stores—
 and 
—covering technical SEO, content, entity/structured data, link acquisition, and Generative Engine Optimization (GEO)—earning inclusion and citations in Google AI Overviews, Bing Copilot, Perplexity, and ChatGPT/Gemini.



You’re excited because you will...



Strategy & Ownership

- Build and execute an integrated SEO + GEO roadmap tied to revenue for priority categories (sheet sets, duvet covers, quilts, decorative pillows).

- Define and track a query set for SERPs and AI answers; report share-of-voice and citation/inclusion rate in AI Overviews/answer engines.



On-Site & Technical

- Audit and improve site architecture, internal linking, faceted navigation, canonicals, and crawl budget for Shopify.

- Elevate Core Web Vitals and image optimization for PDPs/PLPs.

- Implement and maintain JSON-LD schema (Product, Offer, Review, Breadcrumb, Organization, FAQ, ImageObject) to strengthen entity understanding.



Content & Entity Building

- Create entity-first, evidence-backed content answer engines trust: buyer’s guides, comparisons, FAQs, care/how-to, sizing explainers, collection hubs.

- Ensure product attribute completeness (materials, thread count, fill, sizes, care, style) so AI systems can recommend or cite our pages.

- Collaborate with brand/editorial to publish on-brand copy optimized for humans and LLMs.



GEO-Specific Initiatives

- Test AI Overview/answer inclusion tactics (structured data, Q&A blocks, citations, author/entity pages, first-party images).

- Monitor and improve brand citation rate in answers for commercial and informational intents.

- Manage AI crawler permissions and robots directives (GPTBot, Perplexity, CommonCrawl) with Engineering/IT.



Off-Site & Authority

- Build a white-hat digital PR/backlink program with home & design publications, blogs, and partner sites.

- Strengthen E-E-A-T signals (author bios, brand story, policies, reviews/UGC, press mentions).



Analytics & Experimentation

- Run experiments; measure impact in GA4 & GSC with dashboards (Looker Studio).

- Prepare periodic reports and present insights and next steps to stakeholders.



90-Day Success

- Baseline audits completed (technical, content, entities, AI answer presence) and a prioritized 6-month roadmap delivered.

- Quick wins shipped: schema fixes, internal linking improvements, attribute completeness for top SKUs/collections, and one entity-driven content hub launched.

- GEO scorecard established (priority queries, inclusion/citation rate, answer snippets captured, supporting pages).



6–12 Month Outcomes

- Material growth in non-brand organic revenue and category rankings.

- Sustained inclusion/citation in AI answers for target queries across core categories.

- Repeatable GEO playbook embedded in content and merchandising workflows.



Job Requirements

- Proven SEO chops in eCommerce (preferably Shopify) with measurable revenue impact.

- Hands-on GEO experience (or a strong POV) optimizing for AI Overviews and answer engines: structuring content for direct answers, citations, and entity confidence.

- Proficiency with Ahrefs/Similar, Google Search Console, GA4, and Shopify; comfort with HTML/Liquid basics and JSON-LD.

- Ability to plan and execute on-brand digital PR/backlink programs.

- Strong analytical skills; can turn data into decisions and roadmaps.

- Excellent English writing/editing skills (you can own outreach and on-site copy).

- High ownership, bias to action, and communication via
, Slack, Zoom, and phone.

- Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent experience).

- Belief in our company mission and embodiment of our values.



Nice to have

- Experience with product feeds (Google Merchant Center), reviews/UGC integration, and PDP/PLP template optimization.

- Familiarity with log-file analysis, bot identification, and AI crawler management.

- Comfort building dashboards in Looker Studio or similar.



ABOUT HIEND ACCENTS

HiEnd Accents designs and creates everyday luxury bedding, linens, sheeting, decorative pillows, and other home textiles. Founded in 2005 and based in Dallas, Texas, our mission is to elevate customers' lives through beautifully designed home textiles that deliver quality and value.



As a family-owned business, we are committed to personal service and long-term relationships. Through our four brands, we offer unique designs across a spectrum of styles and price points, all united by exceptional value. Combined with our customer-first approach, prompt shipping, and low order minimums, we have become the preferred bedding supplier for thousands of top department stores, furniture retailers, interior designers, and boutique hotels nationwide. Recognized on the 2024 INC 5000 list as one of the fastest-growing businesses in the US, we continue to innovate and expand our reach in the home textiles market.



More about us and our brands: 

Learn about our Philippines team: 
/hea-ph-team



WHY HIEND ACCENTS?



At HiEnd Accents, we are a close-knit team driven by entrepreneurial spirit, a growth mindset, and a commitment to excellence. Our collaborative approach has propelled us to new heights. Recognition on the 2024 INC 5000 list as one of the fastest-growing small companies in the US reflects our team's dedication and the exciting opportunities ahead. If you thrive in a vibrant, high-paced culture where your contributions matter, we want to hear from you.



Working at HiEnd Accents means you can expect:

- Competitive Compensation - We offer a competitive compensation package, including 13th Month Pay

- Professional Growth - We invest in our people to ensure opportunities to learn, grow, and develop careers

- Great Team of Like-Minded Professionals - We hire based on culture and values, so you work with a team that is fun, talented, and committed

title: Conference & Events Coordinator
description:
Role Overview



The Conference & Events Coordinator provides operational and administrative support for Fortra Conferences and related events. This role is responsible for maintaining conference systems, supporting attendee and sponsor coordination, assisting with marketing workflows, and helping ensure event information is accurate and up to date across platforms.

 

This position works closely with the Marketing, Events, and Graphics teams and supports senior conference leadership with execution and coordination.



________________________________________

Key Responsibilities

Conference Systems & Data Management

• Maintain and update Airtable, Wrike, and Cvent for all conferences

• Add and update attendee, sponsor, and speaker records across systems

• Regularly audit attendee and sponsorship tabs to ensure accuracy and consistency

• Upload attendee lists to Wrike and shared drives; assist with internal and partner distribution

• Update Airtable following mail merges and registration updates

________________________________________

Sponsor & Attendee Coordination

• Register confirmed sponsors in Airtable, Wrike, and Cvent

• Assist with tracking sponsorships, registrations, and deliverables

• Support attendee communications and internal reporting needs

________________________________________

Marketing & Website Support

• Maintain and update conference websites with current information

• Coordinate with the graphics team on:

 o Conference graphics

 o Sponsor materials

 o Speaker bios and headshots

 o Swag and signage requests

• Submit graphic request forms for approved, straightforward items

________________________________________

Project & Administrative Support

• Create Wrike projects for confirmed conferences

• Update marketing agendas, Wrike tasks, Excel sheets, and conference agendas based on meeting notes and leadership direction

• Create calendar invites for new conferences, meetings, and events

________________________________________

Travel & Event Logistics Support

• Assist with coordinating travel and hotel logistics with partners’ assistants once conference attendance is confirmed

• Book travel for the marketing team when applicable

________________________________________

Ideal Candidate

• Highly organized and detail-oriented

• Comfortable working across multiple systems and tools

• Strong follow-through and ability to take direction

• Clear written and verbal communicator

• Interest in conferences, events, and marketing operations

________________________________________

Specific Requirements:



(a) Proficiency in the English language

(b) Must have reliable power and internet connection

(d) Work Pacific Time (Main Office is located in California)

(e) Must own a personal laptop (Windows or Mac) with a valid, fully licensed operating system. Minimum specifications: Windows 10 or macOS 12, Intel Core i5-1235U 1.30 GHz processor (or Apple M1/M2 equivalent), and at least 16GB of RAM.

(f) Must complete a speed test, meet system specification requirements, and meet laptop specification requirements.



Hours: 8:30 am—5:00 pm, PT, Monday through Friday

Salary: $800-$1000 a month plus $75 supplemental pay to use toward health insurance

________________________________________

Next Steps: 

Send us a link to a PDF of your resume and include a brief explanation of why you think you're the best fit for this position.



We look forward to seeing your application!

title: Compliance Management Analyst
description:
First things first…

This is a 100% remote position (candidate must be based in the Philippines or Colombia). 





What You’ll Do

The Compliance Management Analyst serves as a key resource within MQMR’s Compliance Management department, providing oversight, expertise, and client-facing support across a broad range of compliance functions. This role is primarily responsible for reviewing and validating the accuracy of data, analyses, and reports related to Fair Lending, and compliance with laws and regulations that include, but are not limited to, the following:



- Equal Credit Opportunity Act (ECOA) and Regulation B

- Home Mortgage Disclosure Act (HMDA) and Regulation C

- Fair Housing Act 

- State Fair Lending Laws, as applicable

- GSE/Agency Requirements, as applicable 



The Compliance Analyst will audit loan files, run data analysis reports through a third-party software system, and ensure that findings are accurate and recommendations are practical and aligned with client expectations. Additionally, the Compliance Analyst will collaborate directly with clients by participating in kick-off calls, reviewing results, answering questions, and providing actionable recommendations to strengthen compliance programs and mitigate risk.





Key Responsibilities

- Supports the Fair Lending and HMDA Support product, which includes assistance with the following tasks and projects:

          - HMDA Data Integrity Reviews

          - Fair Lending Data Analyses

          - Policy, Procedure, Documentation and Report Reviews

          - Determining findings and observations for Clients

          - Recommending Action Steps to Mitigate or Eliminate Risk

          - Develop and write comprehensive Fair Lending Analysis Reports for MQMR's Clients

- Reviews Results of Fair Lending Data Analysis

          - Ensures accuracy and completion

          - Ensures analyses performed align with contract and client expectations

          - Reviews and opines on recommendations for solutions for clients to implement

- Reviews Results of HMDA Data Integrity Reviews

          - Ensures accuracy of results and completion

          - Reviews and opines on root cause analysis for errors and recommendations for solutions

- Assist Clients with the identification of errors with their HMDA Loan Application Register (LAR), and identify solutions to correct data fields





What Will Make You Successful

- 1-3 years of experience in the origination industry required, preferably related to HMDA Loan Application Register (LAR) submissions and Fair Lending Data Analysis.

- 1-3 years of experience auditing mortgage loans to ensure regulatory compliance, including guidelines and pricing exceptions.

- A love for writing and the ability to adapt to writing in a business format to communicate clearly.

- Proficient project planning skills, including the ability to organize, prioritize and control job responsibilities.

- Strong analytical and critical-thinking skills with the ability to solve complex problems and easily communicate findings.

- Ability to work independently and collaboratively with a team.

- Proficiency with Microsoft Office.

- Confidentiality: Must be able to safeguard sensitive information.

- Bachelor’s degree strongly preferred; however, will consider candidates with equivalent experience.





What We Do At MQMR

MQMR is a progressive leader in mortgage compliance, bringing a nimble approach to an antiquated, highly regulated industry that requires us to be the best of the best. We don’t just do audits; we bridge the gap between risk and compliance to give mortgage leaders the "peace of mind" they need to sleep at night. 



Our culture is fast-paced and driven by transparency—this isn't a place for those who just want to clock in. We’re often told that one year at MQMR is the equivalent of 3–5 years of learning elsewhere, so if you’re ready to solve complex problems and truly "Climb Higher," you’ve found your home.





Why Join the MQMR Team?

Are you a critical thinker who’s ready to move our compliance function beyond 'check-the-box' auditing to solve complex problems and bridge the gap between regulatory requirements and client-facing excellence?



If so, join us! Working at MQMR means living and breathing our core values: Commit to Quality, Create Solutions, Collaborate as One, Cultivate Raving Fans, and Climb Higher. Here, you’ll do more than just “work a job”—you’ll solve complex, meaningful problems, stretch your skills, and make a tangible impact on our clients’ peace of mind.



We are more than just a firm; we are a community that has mastered virtual culture. We’ve been 100% remote since 2020, maintaining a 70+ Employee Net Promoter Score. We host monthly virtual activities and wellness challenges. We offer a holistic environment with flexible PTO where we don't count days, annual performance bonuses, and comprehensive health and wellness plans.



We’re looking for people who are hungry to build and learn—not just clock in and out. If you share our values and are excited by the challenge of bridging the gap between risk and compliance, we’d love to hear from you.



If you are interested, please apply directly through our job posting:

title: Carrier Invoice Specialist
description:
About Us

GH Logistics is a growing freight brokerage and asset-based logistics company specializing in dry van and refrigerated freight, built on disciplined systems, documented SOPs, and financial accuracy at every stage. As we scale nationally, we are hiring a Carrier Invoice Specialist to serve as the control point between carrier billing, factoring, and Finance, ensuring invoices are accurate, fully documented, and submission-ready. This is a financial control role, not administrative support, designed for someone structured, detail driven, and comfortable enforcing standards without shortcuts.



Role Overview

The role is the financial control owner of every carrier invoice before it reaches finance or factoring. This role ensures that all invoices are accurate, fully documented, audit-ready, and compliant with internal SOPs and factoring company requirements. No invoice moves forward incomplete, unsupported, or financially misaligned.



What You’ll Be Doing

• Upload carrier invoices into LoadStop accurately and timely

• Verify invoice amounts against rate confirmations and approved charges

• Confirm all required documents are attached (POD, BOL, lumper, detention, etc.)

• Request and follow up on missing or incomplete invoices

• Coordinate with carriers and factoring companies to secure outstanding documents

• Identify discrepancies and escalate with proper documentation support

• Submit validated loads to factoring company in accordance with requirements

• Resolve Held, Rejected, and Denied loads within factoring company

• Maintain structured, audit-ready notes in the TMS

• Prevent incomplete or unsupported invoices from moving to Finance



What Success Looks Like

• 100% invoice uploads completed accurately

• Zero missing supporting documents at Finance review

• Timely follow up on all outstanding invoices

• Minimal invoice disputes due to documentation errors

• Clean, structured notes on every invoice record

• No preventable carrier payment delays



Required Skills & Qualifications

• Experience in US freight brokerage, carrier billing, accounts payable, or logistics operations

• Familiarity with TMS platforms

• Understanding of rate confirmations, accessorial billing, and carrier documentation requirements

• Experience working with factoring companies (preferred)

• Strong documentation discipline

• High attention to detail

• Strong written and verbal English communication

• Minimum 45 - 50 WPM typing speed

• Comfortable working in structured and SOP driven environment

• Ability to manage follow ups and invoice tracking independently



Work Setup & Schedule

• Full Time | 7:00 AM – 5:00 PM CST (San Antonio time)

• Must work U.S. business hours

• Collaborative Zoom based work environment (open camera & unmute mic)

• Time tracking tools used to support accountability



Why Join GH Logistics?

• Defined SOP driven systems

• Clear accountability structure

• Financial risk control role with direct impact

• Performance based growth opportunities

• Structured training and certification path



If you take pride in closing loops, enforcing standards, and protecting revenue accuracy, we’d like to hear from you.



Apply Here: 



Visit us:

title: Remote Joinery Estimator (EN Standards)
description:
Connaught Joinery – Ireland

Full-Time | Remote (Philippines) | Long-Term Position



Connaught Joinery is an Irish manufacturing company specialising in premium prehung doorsets, fire doors, and bespoke joinery.

We are seeking an experienced Joinery Estimator to prepare detailed tenders, quotations, and schedules of works for our Irish and European projects - fully remotely from the Philippines.



-



Role Overview



You will be responsible for preparing accurate cost estimates and schedules for joinery and doorset projects.

This includes interpreting architectural drawings, door schedules, and ironmongery specifications, ensuring all outputs meet European (EN) standards for fire and acoustic performance.



You’ll work closely with our Irish estimating and production teams to deliver precise, compliant, and professional tenders.



-



Key Responsibilities

 • Review architectural drawings, door schedules, and specifications

 • Prepare tender quotations, BOQs, and Schedules of Works

 • Apply and understand EN fire door standards (FD30, FD60, etc.)

 • Compile ironmongery sets and confirm compliance with EN-rated hardware

 • Support pricing through templates or exports from Intact IQ ERP

 • Collaborate via Microsoft Teams and shared folders with our Irish team

 • Maintain consistency, accuracy, and attention to detail in all outputs



-



Required Skills & Experience

 • Minimum 3 years’ experience in joinery, fit-out, or doorset estimating

 • Strong knowledge of:

 • EN-standard fire doors and acoustic doorsets

 • Ironmongery schedules and hardware coordination

 • Prehung and bespoke joinery systems

 • Proficient in Excel, PDF markup, and AutoCAD or Bluebeam for take-offs

 • Excellent English communication and strong technical understanding

 • Highly organised, self-motivated, and able to meet tender deadlines



-



Preferred (Not Required)

 • Familiarity with Intact IQ ERP or similar systems

 • Experience with PlanSwift, Bluebeam, or take-off software

 • Prior exposure to Irish or European joinery standards



-



Compensation & Benefits

 • p46,000 – p70,000 per month (USD $800 – $1,200 equivalent)

 • Performance bonus based on project accuracy and turnaround

 • Long-term contract with career growth opportunities

 • Monday–Friday, 4 PM – 12 AM PH time (to align with Ireland)

 • Fully remote with video check-ins and digital workflow



-



About Connaught Joinery



Connaught Joinery is part of The Connaught Door Centre Group, based in Galway, Ireland.

We design and manufacture premium prehung door systems, EN fire doors, and bespoke joinery for residential and commercial projects nationwide.

Our operations are built on precision CNC manufacturing, ERP-driven workflows, and a culture of excellence.



-



How to Apply



Please submit:

 1. Your CV / résumé

 2. An example of a tender, take-off, or quotation you’ve produced

 3. A short note on your experience with EN-standard fire doors or joinery projects



Please send the above to :

title: High-Ticket Sales Closer – E-commerce Marketing Agency
description:

About Us

• Google Ads

• Meta Ads

• Conversion optimization

• CRM & lead nurturing systems

• Marketplace & B2B expansion strategies

Your Role



• Take 45 to 60 minute discovery / strategy calls

• Diagnose the store’s bottlenecks

• Present our offer clearly and confidently

• Handle objections naturally

• Close on the call

• Follow up with warm leads who didn’t close immediately

What We Expect



• Native or near-native English

• Proven experience closing high-ticket offers

• Comfortable closing $2K to $5K+ monthly retainers

• Understand e-commerce and marketing basics

• Confident but not arrogant

• Strong follow-up discipline



You must be hungry.



We are not looking for “order takers”.

We want someone who sees objections as opportunities.



Compensation: $2000-$5000/month

To Apply, Send:



- A short Loom introducing yourself

- Your past closing results (numbers matter)

- Why you think you’re a killer closer



We move fast. If you know you can close, apply now.

title: Negotiations Specialist | Medical Biller (Full-Time, Remote)
description:
Shift: Monday – Friday, 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM Pacific Time (West U.S. time)

Background checks will be conducted

Location: Work from Home; Client is based in California

HIPAA Certification is required and will be provided to you through training.

Use of a Virtual Desktop space is required for HIPAA compliance. Virtual Desktop space is provided.



Role Overview:



The Negotiations Specialist Virtual Assistant is responsible for managing and optimizing reimbursement outcomes for U.S.-based medical facilities by conducting payer and third-party negotiations, appeals, and reconsiderations. This role requires strong knowledge of payer contracts, third-party pricing methodologies, and negotiation strategies to achieve the most favorable reimbursement rates for each facility.



Key Responsibilities:

- Manage all payer portal and external negotiations, ensuring timely submission, follow-up, and resolution of negotiation requests.

- Maintain extensive knowledge of each facility’s established rates with third-party pricing vendors (including GCS, Viant, DIS, and others).

- Apply deep understanding of third-party pricer methodologies to strategically negotiate and secure optimal reimbursement rates across various payers.

- Submit and manage direct reconsideration requests with insurance payers to challenge underpaid or denied claims.

- Perform negotiation appeals, including documentation review, appeal drafting, submission, and ongoing follow-up until resolution.

- Conduct quarterly negotiation cycles with designated third-party pricers (GCS, Viant, DIS), ensuring alignment with facility goals and reimbursement benchmarks.

- Track and monitor negotiation trends, payer behavior changes, and reimbursement patterns to identify opportunities for improved outcomes.

- Maintain accurate records of signed agreements, negotiation outcomes, and rate changes for auditing and reporting purposes.

- Prepare and deliver quarterly facility reports detailing total negotiated amounts, savings achieved, and performance metrics.

- Collaborate with internal billing and operations teams to ensure negotiated rates are correctly applied and reflected in claim processing.

- Train and onboard new Negotiations Specialists, providing guidance on negotiation processes, tools, payer requirements, and best practices.



Required Skills & Knowledge:

• Strong understanding of U.S. medical billing, payer negotiations, and reimbursement processes

• Experience working with third-party pricers and payer portals

• High attention to detail and strong documentation skills

• Ability to analyze trends and negotiate strategically

• Excellent written communication for payer correspondence and appeals

• Comfortable working independently in a virtual/remote environment



*Once your application is received, the recruitment team may request you to submit a short video introduction. Applicants who are requested to submit and complete the video will be prioritized in the review process.

description:
About the Role



We’re building a state-of-the-art AI-powered BI and querying platform, and we’re looking for a Senior Data Analyst to play a critical role at the intersection of customers, data, and product.



This role owns the data funnel end-to-end — from building datasets and dashboards, to analyzing usage and results, to ensuring data quality for both customer-facing analytics and internal decision-making.



You’ll be the only dedicated data specialist on a 10-person team primarily based in the Philippines, supporting existing customers while also helping shape net-new platform functionality as we evolve our AI BI product.



This is a hands-on role for someone who enjoys both:



Supporting real customers with real data needs

Building modern analytics systems that scale and improve over time



What You’ll Do

Customer & platform analytics

Build and maintain datasets that power customer dashboards and analytics

Create dashboards and analyses used by customers and internal teams

Investigate data questions, edge cases, and inconsistencies from customer use cases



Data funnel ownership

Own the full data lifecycle: ingestion ? transformation ? modeling ? reporting

Ensure data quality, accuracy, and consistency across sources

Define and maintain metric definitions and business logic



Analysis & insights

Analyze customer behavior, platform usage, and performance trends

Identify insights that inform product decisions and prioritization

Communicate findings clearly to technical and non-technical stakeholders



Product & tooling collaboration

Partner with engineering and product to support new AI BI functionality

Help shape how datasets, metrics, and querying work in the platform

Improve analytics workflows using modern tooling and automation



AI-assisted workflows

Use AI tools (e.g., GitHub Copilot and similar) to accelerate querying, modeling, and documentation

Apply judgment to validate outputs and ensure correctness in customer-facing data



What We’re Looking For



Core experience

5+ years of experience in data analytics, BI, or a closely related role

Strong experience building datasets and data models, not just consuming reports

Deep SQL experience and comfort working with cloud data warehouses

Proven ability to independently create dashboards, analyses, and insights

Experience being a primary or sole owner of analytics in a small team



AI & modern tooling (key requirement)

Strong experience using AI-assisted coding and analytics tools such as:

GitHub Copilot

Cloud-based code assistants

AI-driven query or exploration tools

Ability to use AI tools responsibly in production and customer-facing contexts



Nice to have

Experience with modern transformation tools (e.g., dbt or similar)

Experience with BI tools (Looker, Tableau, Power BI, Superset, etc.)

Exposure to analytics for SaaS products or customer-facing platforms

Familiarity with data quality checks, testing, or monitoring



Interest in AI-enabled analytics and next-generation BI products



What Success Looks Like

Customers trust and rely on analytics produced by the platform

Datasets and metrics are well-defined, documented, and reusable

Data issues are proactively identified and resolved

Insights meaningfully influence product and business decisions

Analytics keeps pace with rapid product development



Why This Role



High ownership and visibility across customers and product teams

Opportunity to shape analytics for a modern AI BI platform

Direct impact on customer experience and product direction

Work with cutting-edge AI-assisted analytics workflows

title: Google VEO 3 Specialist
description:
We’re Hiring: Google Veo 3 Specialist



Our fast-growing e-commerce brand is scaling toward 8-figures and beyond, and we’re ready to level up our creative production with the power of Google Veo 3. We’re looking for a Google Veo 3 Specialist to help us manage, refine, and execute AI-generated video ads that support our marketing goals.



To show you’ve carefully read this post, please start your response with the word peach before introducing yourself. Below, you’ll find the key responsibilities, requirements, and a few quick questions so we can get to know your experience.



Key Responsibilities:

- Prompt Creation & Optimization: Write, test, and refine prompts to generate high-quality video ads using Google Veo 3.

- Workflow Coordination: Manage the full AI production pipeline—concept to final output—ensuring deadlines are met.

- Creative Alignment: Collaborate with our marketing and UGC teams to blend AI-generated content with human-made assets.

- Quality Review: Ensure all outputs are polished, on-brand, and ready for launch.

- Innovation & Mastery: Stay up to date with Google Veo 3 features, updates, and best practices to keep us ahead of the curve.

- Documentation: Maintain a clear system for tracking prompts, revisions, and final deliverables.



Requirements:

- Hands-on experience with Google Veo 3 and AI video generation.

- Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.

- Ability to manage multiple creative projects at once.

- Good communication skills for working with both AI and human creators.

- Comfortable using project management tools like Google Sheets, Notion, or similar.

- Consistent availability for 4-8 hours daily, 6 days per week.

- Bonus: Background in marketing, video production, or AI prompt engineering.



Questions for You:

- Have you worked directly with Google Veo 3 before? If so, tell us about your projects.

- How do you approach prompt testing and refining to get the best results?

- What’s your system for keeping multiple AI video projects organized?

- Are you comfortable balancing both creative expectations and technical workflows?

- Can you commit to 4-8 hours per day, 6 days per week, for this role?



If you’re passionate about AI-powered creativity and love working with cutting-edge tools like Google Veo 3, we’d love to hear from you!

title: Virtual Operations Assistant (Creator Management & CRM)

title: VA Backend Systems & Marketing Automation Specialist (GoHighLevel)
description:
OVERVIEW

I am a transformational life, relationship, and divorce coach running a growing coaching and content-based business. I am looking for a highly skilled backend systems specialist who can architect and manage scalable automations inside GoHighLevel (GHL).

This is not a basic VA role.

 I am looking for someone who can think in workflows, pipelines, segmentation, and revenue optimization.

My goal is to build a clean, scalable backend that supports:

 • Client onboarding and tracking

 • Revenue-generating follow-up systems

 • Monthly activations (2 per month minimum)

 • Newsletter, podcast, and social distribution

 • KPI tracking and reporting

The right person is proactive, detail-oriented, highly organized, and confident building advanced automations in GHL.



CORE RESPONSIBILITIES

Client Onboarding & Tracking Automation





• Build and maintain automated onboarding workflows after purchase

 • Implement session tracking (e.g., 12-session package countdowns)

 • Trigger automated scheduling and renewal reminders

 • Create client pipelines inside GHL

 • Set internal milestone alerts

 • Eliminate all manual session tracking



Sales & Lead Follow-Up Automation





• Design and implement lead capture workflows

 • Build branching workflows based on engagement

 • Create automated follow-up sequences for prospects

 • Build re-engagement campaigns

 • Set up internal reminders for follow-up

 • Optimize segmentation and tagging



Monthly Activations (2 per month minimum)





For each activation:

 • Registration funnel setup

 • Reminder sequences

 • Attendance tagging

 • No-show automation

 • Replay distribution

 • Offer follow-up workflows

 • Segmentation based on behavior

 • Conversion tracking and reporting



Social Media Execution & Automation





I will create all written content.

You will:

 • Design posts using Canva templates aligned with brand standards

 • Assemble content into clean, professional graphics

 • Schedule posts inside GoHighLevel

 • Manage content calendar

 • Set up comment-trigger automations (e.g., keyword triggers like “Direction”)

 • Ensure automated delivery of freebies via DM or

 • Tag and route contacts into correct pipelines

Experience building social-trigger automations inside GHL is required.



Weekly Newsletter & Blog Distribution





I will provide the written content.

You will:

 • Assemble weekly newsletter using established template

 • Format blog post for website

 • Schedule and distribute newsletter

 • Automate link tracking for free offers

 • Tag and segment subscribers appropriately

 • Trigger related funnels when applicable

You must have strong communication skills to keep me accountable for providing content on time.



Podcast Integration

• Ensure podcast episodes are embedded automatically on website

 • Trigger newsletter announcement when new episode drops

 • Create workflow for repurposing podcast into social posts



Calendar & Scheduling Automation

• Ensure Zoom links populate correctly

 • Create confirmation + reminder sequences 
 + SMS)

 • Build internal task reminders

 • Automate follow-up
s post-session



Metrics & KPI Reporting

• Build dashboard tracking key metrics:

Lead sources

Webinar conversion rates

Sales close rates

Revenue by offer



 open & click rates

 • Provide weekly summary report

 • Provide monthly performance analysis



SOP Documentation

• Document all recurring workflows

 • Create SOPs for automations, publishing, onboarding, and reporting

 • Maintain organized systems documentation



QUALIFICATIONS

• Advanced experience building workflows in GoHighLevel

 • Strong understanding of pipeline architecture and segmentation

 • Experience with Canva for social media, landing pages, & other marketing materials design

 • Excellent communication skills

 • Proactive project management ability

 • Ability to think strategically, not just execute tasks

 • Experience documenting SOPs

 • Comfortable working independently and offering system improvement suggestions

Bonus: Experience with coaches, consultants, or info-based businesses.



WHAT SUCCESS LOOKS LIKE

• Client tracking is fully automated

 • Monthly activations run smoothly without rebuilding systems

 • Follow-ups are consistent and revenue-driven

 • Social content flows seamlessly

 • Metrics are visible and reviewed monthly

 • Backend infrastructure supports growth without manual overwhelm

- Weekly communication and check ins

title: Wanted: "A-Player" Video Editor to Conquer the Internet
description:
???? Wanted: "A-Player" Video Editor to Conquer the Internet

We are looking for "A Players" and killers on a mission to conquer the internet. Our mission is to produce clean, precise, and exceptional content that reinforces message and brand. We are in this game to be the best, we are here to change people's lives, and we want to make Eric globally famous.



If you are a dedicated editor who thrives in a brutally competitive landscape, this is your opportunity. Laziness and underperformance will result in immediate removal from the team. Slacking is a sin.



The Role & Daily Expectations

You will be the creative force behind main social media pages. Your goal is to maximize the potential of every video and serve the core message.



Daily Output: You must deliver a minimum of 1 exceptional video per day.

Speed & Efficiency: Videos should not take more than 2 hours to create; if they do, you must optimize your workflow.

Content Pillars: You will craft videos centered around topics like Business/entrepreneurship, Sobriety, Real Estate, Mindset, and Mental toughness.



Accountability: You must submit an End of Day (EOD) report daily detailing what you accomplished, what you struggled with, what you succeeded at, and a track of your time.



Strict Editing Standards

There is zero tolerance for spelling or sync errors. All editorial decisions must maintain brand consistency.



Visuals: Position head 1/3 above the middle of the screen and ensure every video uses face tracking to hold attention.



The Hook: The first 3 seconds are the most important part; you must select the best 3 seconds of the clip to create curiosity and frame the video.



B-Roll: Sync B-rolls to the beat for a cleaner feel and ensure B-roll footage showcases aspirational lifestyle.



Audio: Music must align with  brand, featuring a Hip-hop, edgy, or "Gangster" vibe.



Subtitles: Subtitles must be placed just under chin, formatted as one-liners with no more than 3 words at a time, and accurately synced to his lips.





Compensation & Bonus Structure

We want to reward your exceptionalism, precision, and speed. You are competing not just against the internet, but internally to secure the most money weekly and monthly.



Base Pay: $500 for at least 1 exceptional short a day.

title: Creative Producer (Ads + Short-Form Video + Branding) – Part-Time 20–30 hrs/week
description:
We are a fast-growing U.S.-based marketing and consulting company that supports multiple brands across healthcare, compliance and third-party testing, medical record services, software, and local service industries.



In addition to managing client brands, we are building our own consulting brand, Stacks Sales & Consulting, and need consistent, high-quality content to support growth and sales.



We are looking for a skilled Creative Producer who can create professional ad creatives, short-form videos, and branded marketing content across multiple companies.



This is not a basic social media posting job.



We need someone who understands how to create content that performs — strong hooks, clean design, clear call-to-action, and organized delivery.



If you enjoy creating ads, editing short-form video, and using AI tools to increase output and quality, this is a long-term opportunity.





Role Overview



Will Start Part-time: 20–30 hours per week

Long-term opportunity with performance increases



You will be responsible for producing marketing creatives for multiple brands, including Stacks Sales & Consulting.





Core Responsibilities



• Create static ad creatives (Meta, Instagram, LinkedIn, etc.)

• Edit short-form vertical videos (Reels, Shorts, TikTok)

• Turn raw photos and videos into polished marketing content

• Create AI-assisted video content when needed

• Maintain brand consistency across different companies

• Organize files properly in Google Drive

• Deliver work consistently and on time



You must be comfortable switching between brands while staying organized and detail-oriented.





Weekly Production Expectations



You should be comfortable producing:



• 8–15 static creatives per week

• 4–8 short-form videos per week

• Story variations and resized formats

• Editable Canva templates for ongoing use



Both quality and efficiency matter.







Required Skills



• Strong Canva experience (non-negotiable)

• CapCut, Premiere, or similar video editing software

• Experience creating ad creatives (not just aesthetic posts)

• Understanding of hooks, headlines, and call-to-action

• Comfortable using AI tools (ChatGPT, AI voice tools, AI video tools, etc.)

• Organized file management and structured delivery





Bonus Skills (Additional Compensation Potential)



Candidates with the following skills may qualify for expanded responsibilities and increased pay:



• WordPress experience

• Elementor page building

• Landing page edits or light website builds

• Basic branding systems or style guide development

• Google Ads experience

• SEO knowledge (on-page optimization, keyword research, content optimization)



These skills are not required, BUT HIGHLY VALUABLE







Compensation



$6–$8 per hour depending on experience and skill level

Performance increases available after 30 days



Additional compensation available for WordPress, SEO, or Google Ads capabilities.



Long-term opportunity for the right candidate.





Important – Read Carefully



To apply:



Put "STACKS CREATIVE" in your subject line

Send 2–3 portfolio examples (ads and video preferred)

Record a 60–90 second Loom explaining:

   Your workflow for producing weekly content

   What tools you use for video and AI

   How you stay organized across multiple brands

If you have the bonus skills PLEASE MENTION THEM



Applications without these steps will not be reviewed.



Finalists will complete a small paid creative test before hiring.
