title: Xactimate Specialist – Insurance Claims Supplements
description:
We’re looking for an experienced Xactimate Specialist to handle insurance claim supplements and estimates. This role is critical to keeping our claims process accurate, efficient, and profitable. You’ll be working closely with adjusters, contractors, and clients to review, write, and negotiate supplements using Xactimate.



What you’ll do

 • Review property damage claims and identify supplement opportunities

 • Create detailed estimates in Xactimate

 • Submit and negotiate supplements with insurance carriers

 • Communicate with adjusters, contractors, and clients to resolve scope issues

 • Track claim progress, updates, and approvals

 • Maintain organized claim documentation and records



What we’re looking for

 • Strong knowledge of Xactimate (required)

 • Experience in insurance claims, property damage, or restoration industry

 • Familiarity with construction materials, methods, and pricing

 • Strong attention to detail and accuracy in estimates

 • Ability to communicate and negotiate effectively

 • Organized, self-motivated, and able to manage multiple claims at once



Details

 • Remote or office-based depending on location

 • Full-time position with immediate start

 • Competitive pay based on experience and skills

 • Training provided on our processes if needed

title: Virtual Creative Director – AI Influencer Agency
description:
Virtual Creative Director – AI Influencer Agency



We’re looking for a Virtual Creative Director to lead creative strategy for our AI-powered influencer agency. This role is all about vision, execution, and innovation. You’ll manage content across all social media platforms, oversee video and post production, and drive the creative direction that keeps our AI influencers ahead of the curve.



Because this is a heavily AI-driven position, you need to be fluent with AI tools for content creation, editing, and strategy. We want someone who’s not just using these tools, but pushing them to create fresh ideas that stand out.



What you’ll do

 • Develop and oversee creative strategy for all AI influencer content

 • Manage social media content calendars across multiple platforms

 • Direct video production, editing, and post design with AI-powered tools

 • Brainstorm and execute innovative campaigns that grow engagement and reach

 • Stay current on social media trends and emerging AI tools

 • Guide a team of editors, designers, and VAs as needed

 • Ensure consistent branding and voice across all platforms



What we’re looking for

 • Strong background in creative direction, content strategy, or social media management

 • Hands-on experience with AI tools for video, design, and writing (e.g. MidJourney, Runway, ChatGPT, etc.)

 • Deep understanding of TikTok, Instagram, YouTube, and emerging platforms

 • Ability to turn ideas into polished campaigns with measurable results

 • Strong leadership and communication skills

 • A forward-thinker who’s excited to experiment with new tools and trends



Details

 • Remote / Virtual role

 • Full-time or part-time, depending on fit

 • Competitive pay based on experience and results

 • Opportunity to lead and shape the future of an AI-focused creative agency

 • Looking to hire immediately

title: Virtual Assistant
description:
> Company Description



Sofia Health is a technology platform that powers booking, payments, scheduling, and operational infrastructure for independent health and wellness professionals. Our work is systems-driven, detail-heavy, and requires precision across data, reporting, and written materials.



We’re hiring a highly detail-oriented Virtual Assistant to support internal operations, reporting, and editorial quality control—not just admin tasks.







> This Role Is a Strong Fit If You:

- Are meticulous with data, documents, and formatting

- Instinctively catch errors, inconsistencies, and missing details

- Can read critically and edit for clarity without changing intent

- Are comfortable switching between spreadsheets, reports, and written content

- Take pride in clean, accurate, professional output





** This is not a social media, inbox-only, or calendar-focused VA role.



> Core Responsibilities:



Data & Reporting

- Organize, clean, and maintain structured data in spreadsheets and internal systems

- Build, update, and format reports (tables, summaries, exports)

- Work extensively with Microsoft Office, including:

- Excel (formulas, filters, sorting, validation)

- Access (tables, queries, data management, exports)

- Word & PowerPoint (consistent formatting and layout)

- Use Google Workspace (Sheets, Docs, Drive) for collaboration

- Verify data accuracy before internal or external use



Reading, Editing & Quality Control

- Review documents, reports,
s, and internal materials

- Correct grammar, spelling, formatting, and clarity issues

- Ensure consistency in terminology, structure, and presentation

- Identify errors, omissions, and inconsistencies before delivery

- Follow style and formatting guidelines precisely



Operational Support

- Maintain organized file structures and naming conventions

- Follow SOPs closely and flag issues proactively

- Support detail-heavy operational tasks across teams





> Required Skills & Experience

- Experience in a data-heavy administrative, operations, automations, or QA role

- Strong Excel skills (required)

- Experience with Microsoft Access or similar database tools

- Excellent written English and strong editing instincts

- High attention to detail and formatting standards

- Comfortable managing multiple tasks without sacrificing accuracy





> Nice-to-Have

- Experience supporting SaaS or platform-based companies

- Background in reporting, auditing, or editorial review

- Familiarity with structured operational data





> What Success Looks Like

- Data is clean, accurate, and reliable

- Documents are polished, consistent, and error-free

- Issues are caught early and communicated clearly

- Systems stay organized without constant oversight

title: Property Manager Assistant / Executive Assistant (Real Estate)
description:
I’m hiring a highly organized, detail-oriented Virtual Assistant to serve as my Property Manager Assistant and help manage the administrative operations of my real estate business. This role is designed to free up my time by taking ownership of recurring admin, bookkeeping coordination, inbox management, compliance tracking, vendor payments, broker coordination, and marketing support.



This is a long-term role, not a beginner position. You will be handling multiple entities, properties, financial records, and sensitive information. The right candidate is proactive, systems-driven, and comfortable working independently with daily check-ins.



Responsibilities include organizing and maintaining all files in Google Drive (entities, properties, expenses, invoices, taxes), managing and cleaning inboxes daily, paying invoices and setting up autopays, processing invoices and reimbursements in QuickBooks, organizing expenses by entity and property, assisting with tax prep and annual LLC filings, coordinating with property managers and brokers, conducting daily property searches, scheduling meetings, managing calendars and travel, and supporting website updates, marketing, social media, and internal systems documentation.



Part-time to start with opportunity to grow. Daily check-in required.



To apply: include a brief description of your QuickBooks experience (years, versions, and tasks handled, if any) and make sure the subject line of your application reads: “Property Manager Assistant – LFO.” Applications without this subject line will not be reviewed.



Required: QuickBooks experience, excellent organization and attention to detail, clear written communication, and the ability to manage multiple workflows without constant direction.



Preferred: real estate or property management experience, website or social media support, basic HTML/PHP.

title: Lead Generation Specialist
description:
We are hiring a Lead Generation Specialist to manually source 200–250 qualified fitness leads per day for a UK-based activewear brand. Your role is to find athletes/affiliates on Instagram and TikTok who meet all of the following criteria: based in the UK, in the fitness niche (gym, bodybuilding, hybrid training, running, etc.), have 1,000+ followers on either platform, are posting consistently, and have posted within the last 30 days (including stories). If a profile fits all criteria, you will log their Instagram handle and required details accurately into an Excel spreadsheet. No duplicates, no unqualified leads.



This role is 100% manual research. You may NOT use AI tools, bots, scraping software, or automation to find leads. Every profile must be manually checked to ensure quality and brand alignment. You must be fast, detail-oriented, and able to handle repetitive, high-volume work while maintaining accuracy. Strong knowledge of Instagram and TikTok search features, hashtags, suggested accounts, and general platform navigation is required.



We are looking for someone reliable, consistent, and able to work independently without supervision. You must be comfortable hitting daily targets and working in a fast-paced environment. If you cut corners, miss details, or rely on shortcuts, this role is not for you. Include your experience with Instagram/TikTok research, any lead generation experience, your daily availability, and how you would manually reach 200–250 UK fitness leads per day

title: Operations Coordinator / Customer Success
description:
POSITION OVERVIEW

The Operations Coordinator owns the daily operational rhythm of REVAMP Visuals. Acting as the central hub between field teams, editors, customer service, and leadership, this role ensures every project is executed efficiently, communicated clearly, and delivered to brand standards.



This position requires decisive coordination, proactive problem-solving, and systems thinking. The Operations Coordinator not only manages logistics but continuously improves workflows, strengthens accountability, and safeguards the client experience as the company scales.



Working hours are 9:00am - 5:00pm Eastern Time with a 1 hour lunch break.



Summary

The Operations Coordinator will play a pivotal role in the day-to-day operations of our organization. This individual will support the smooth execution of our production projects and daily operations, ensuring everything runs seamlessly from pre-production to post-production. This role is ideal for someone passionate about media and production, with strong organizational and communication skills, and a proactive approach. The ideal candidate will possess strong leadership capabilities, a strong customer service background, and a track record of achieving operational excellence.



CORE RESPONSIBILITIES



Daily

Manage and oversee internal scheduling for Media Pros and editors

Coordinate and dispatch same-day or next-day urgent changes

Update project timelines and appointment calendars

Route client communication to appropriate tea
mbers and track resolution

Ensure client response times remain within 10–20 minutes during operating hours

Set clear next-day follow-ups when needed

Lead and manage client communications to ensure proactive updates

Oversee and adjust team schedules across departments (Field, Editing, Customer Service)

Support Quality Control workflows to uphold brand and delivery standards

Funnel important updates from field teams and clients into centralized systems

Provide consultative support on upgrades and service options



Weekly

Host weekly team sync meetings to review bottlenecks, timelines, and priorities

Lead weekly task check-ins and monitor internal accountability

Report on project statuses and departmental KPIs

Coordinate with cross-functional teams (Creative, Customer Service, Sales)

Analyze recurring project issues and propose system improvements

Support onboarding of new tea
mbers and freelancers

Contribute to lead generation or outreach initiatives as requested



Monthly

Compile and report on key performance metrics (revenue, retention, production success, workflow health)

Identify trends in client requests or operational inefficiencies

Implement system, communication, and quality improvements

Review and document SOP updates to maintain operational standards

Participate in monthly strategic planning and forecasting sessions

Support hiring, onboarding, and training initiatives



KEY PERFORMANCE INDICATORS (KPIs)

Client response time compliance

On-time project completion rate

Quality control pass rate

Schedule accuracy and resource allocation efficiency

Reduction in recurring workflow issues

Team accountability follow-through

Client satisfaction and retention



SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS

Strong operational and project coordination experience

Excellent written and verbal communication skills

High proficiency in CRM systems, Google Workspace, and scheduling tools

Ability to manage multiple workflows simultaneously

Experience leading cross-department collaboration

Strong organizational and time management skills

Proactive problem solver with systems-thinking mindset

Comfortable managing deadlines and high-volume production environments



To Apply

Please send us the following:

A 1–2 minute video introducing yourself — tell us where you’re from, what kind of work you’ve done before, and why you’re a great fit for this Operations Coordinator / Customer Success role.

Confirmation that you are available to work 9:00am–5:00pm Eastern Time, Monday through Friday.

A screenshot of your internet speed test and your OnlineJobs.ph DISC Profile.

One or two sentences answering: “What makes a great client experience?”



We’re excited to meet you — bonus points if your video shows energy, professionalism, and clear communication.

title: EXPERIENCED DM APPOINTMENT SETTER - FITNESS
description:

We have 500,000+ organic followers, consistent inbound demand, and a proven system.



We’re now looking to bring on one experienced appointment setter to support both inbound and outbound conversations as we scale.



This Role Is For You If:

- You have prior appointment-setting experience (fitness or high-ticket preferred)

- You’re confident handling inbound and outbound Instagram DMs

- You know how to qualify properly without being pushy

- You value systems, structure, and feedback

This is not a beginner role and not a closing position.



Responsibilities

- Handle inbound Instagram DMs

- Run structured outbound outreach

- Qualify leads using a proven framework

- Book qualified strategy calls

- Maintain clean tracking in ManyChat / CRM

- Follow up with warm leads



Compensation

- $2,000–$3,000 USD/month earning potential

Clear progression for strong performers



Trial

All applicants who move forward will complete a paud 7-day paid trial.



How to Apply

Send a short message including:

- Your name

- Your prior appointment-setting experience

We’ll review applications and potentially move you to Stage 2.



We’re building long-term, not cycling freelancers. If you care about quality, structure, and growth, this role is worth applying for.

title: Inside Sales Agent (ISA) – Real Estate
description:
We’re looking for a high-performance Inside Sales Agent (ISA) to join our real estate team. If you have previous experience working with licensed real estate agents and love converting leads into appointments, this role is for you.



The ISA is the heartbeat of our lead generation department. You’ll prospect daily, build strong relationships, nurture incoming and long-term leads, and set appointments that turn into closings.



What You’ll Do



Make daily outbound calls to Expireds, FSBOs, Buyer Leads, Past Clients, SOI, JL/JS leads, and Open House lists



Convert inquiries into qualified appointments for our listing and buyer specialists



Build rapport, ask purposeful questions, and uncover timing and motivation



Maintain and update all leads within our CRM



Follow up consistently to ensure no lead is left behind



Call past clients for reviews, referrals, and check-ins



Attend trainings, coaching sessions, and daily role-play



Track and report weekly goals, KPIs, and conversion ratios



Work 40–50 hours per week with full consistency



Requirements

Must-Haves



Previous real estate experience (ISA, client care specialist, or worked directly with licensed agents)



Strong communication skills and confidence on the phone



Proven ability to set appointments and convert leads



Comfortable using scripts and objection handlers



Excellent customer service and relationship-building skills



Highly organized, detail-oriented, and accountable



Tech savvy — CRM experience required



Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment



Preferred



Follow Up Boss (FUB) experience



Track record hitting or exceeding sales/appointment goals



Work Environment



Strong, reliable internet connection



Dedicated, quiet workspace free of background noise



Who Thrives in This Role



This position is ideal for someone who:



Loves talking to people



Is driven by goals and numbers



Enjoys a fast-paced, structured environment



Wants to grow within a high-performing real estate team

title: Google Ads Expert (Remote | Multi-Location Chiropractic Practice)
description:
Contract | Flat Fee: $250/month | Remote



Impact Chiropractic is a growing, multi-location family chiropractic practice with locations in Golden, Denver and Fort Collins, Colorado. We are seeking an experienced Google Ads expert to manage and optimize paid search performance across three clinic locations.



This is a remote, contract role ideal for someone who values clean systems, clear reporting, and measurable results.



Your Responsibilities

- Set up, manage, and optimize Google Ads (AdWords) campaigns for 3 locations

- Manage and optimize Google Local Services Ads (LSA)

- Configure and maintain Google Analytics and conversion tracking (calls, forms, bookings)

- Optimize ad budgets to improve lead quality and cost per lead

- Track and analyze performance metrics across all locations

- Provide monthly performance reports with insights and recommendations

- Manage and optimize Google My Business profiles for each clinic

- Implement local SEO best practices and provide website SEO recommendations

- Continuously test keywords, ads, audiences, and negative keywords



What We’re Looking For

- Minimum 5 years of hands-on experience with Google Ads

- Proven experience managing local, service-based businesses

- Strong understanding of:

-> Multi-location account structure

-> Conversion tracking & attribution

-> Budget optimization and scaling

-> Google Ads and LSA policy compliance

- Ability to work independently and remotely

- Clear, professional communication skills

- Ability to explain results in plain, non-technical language



Bonus Skills (Nice to Have)

- Experience with healthcare, chiropractic, or wellness businesses

- Advanced local SEO experience

- Call tracking tools (CallRail or similar)

- Experience managing multiple locations under one brand



What Success Looks Like

- Improved lead quality across all three locations

- Clean, well-structured ad accounts

- Consistent and transparent reporting

- Proactive optimization (not reactive management)

- Efficient use of ad spend aligned with business goals



Scope & Compensation

- Flat fee: $250/month

- Ad spend managed separately

- This role does not include: Website redesigns, Landing page builds, Copywriting beyond ads

 (Available separately if discussed)



Position Type

- Remote

- Contract

- Ongoing, month-to-month collaboration





How to Apply:

1. Submit your application including:

- Resume highlighting Google Ads experience

- Google Ads certification (screenshot or link)

- 2-3 case studies from local service businesses showing:

-> Business type

-> Monthly ad spend managed

-> Results achieved (cost per lead, conversions, ROI)

2. Complete the Culture Index Survey in your primary language: [
 ]

3. Send a cover letter or portfolio that includes:

- Your experience with Google Ads for healthcare or local service businesses

- Total ad budget you've managed monthly

- Screenshots or links to campaigns you've run (client names can be redacted)

- Your time zone and availability for US Mountain Time overlap

title: Accounts Payable Specialist (A/P Specialist)
description:
HOW TO APPLY

If this role feels like the perfect fit and you meet the qualifications, we invite you to learn more about our team in the Philippines and submit your application here:




/appzq4iqeIREQRVyo/pagRcEzAT2P39Rr13/form



Note: Only applications submitted via the above link will be considered.



JOB DESCRIPTION



We are looking for a detail-oriented and reliable Accounts Payable Specialist to join our close-knit accounting team. In this role, you will be in charge of making sure our company pays all of its bills on time and correctly, including vendors in the U.S. and overseas. If you are great with numbers, organized, and love making sure things are done right the first time, this job is for you.



WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING



- Take ownership of the full A/P process: receive and check invoices, enter them into our system, route them for approval, and make sure they get paid.

- Handle international vendor payments (payments to overseas factories). Carefully review each invoice for accuracy, match supporting documents (like shipping records and POs), and flag any inconsistencies before releasing payments.

- Double-check all invoices to ensure accuracy and compliance with company policies.

- Keep vendor contact info and payment details up to date in our system.

- Match vendor statements with our records and investigate any mismatches or errors.

- Ensure each expense is booked to the correct account, department, or project.

- Run weekly payment batches, including checks, ACH, credit card, and wire transfers.

- Respond to vendor
s and calls professionally and quickly.

- Work with other departments to solve payment issues and help prevent future ones.

- Support month-end close and annual audits by preparing A/P reports and documentation.

- Regularly create reports to help track payables and support financial decision-making.



WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR



- Bachelor's degree in Accounting or a related field

- 5 to 7 years of hands-on Accounts Payable experience

- Strong skills in Microsoft Excel (pivot tables, VLOOKUPs, etc.)

- Experience with accounting systems like SAP, NetSuite, or similar (a plus)

- Strong knowledge of A/P and general accounting principles

- Excellent attention to detail

- Good written and verbal English skills

- Self-motivated and able to manage deadlines independently

- Quiet home office setup with reliable internet and a dual-monitor setup (strongly preferred)

- Available to work full-time, 40 hours/week, from either 8:00 AM-5:00 PM or 9:00 AM-6:00 PM CST (Note: This is a night shift for PH-based tea
mbers)

- Alignment with our mission and values: 
/3Unr0ub



ABOUT HIEND ACCENTS



HiEnd Accents designs and creates everyday luxury bedding and linens, sheeting, decorative pillows, and other home textiles. Founded in 2005 and based in Dallas, Texas, our mission is to elevate our customers' lives via beautifully designed home textiles that deliver quality and value.



As a family-owned business, we are committed to personal service and long-term relationships. Through our four brands, we offer unique designs across a spectrum of styles and price points, all united by exceptional value. Combined with our customer-first approach, prompt shipping, and low order minimums, we have become the preferred bedding supplier for thousands of top department stores, furniture retailers, interior designers, and boutique hotels nationwide. Recently recognized on the 2024 INC 5000 list as one of the fastest-growing businesses in the US, we continue to innovate and expand our reach in the home textiles market.



Discover more about us and our brands at 
.



Want to get to know us better and learn what it is like to be part of our growing team in the Philippines? Learn more here: 
/hea-ph-team



WHY HIEND ACCENTS?



At HiEnd Accents, we are a close-knit team driven by entrepreneurial spirit, a growth mindset, and a shared commitment to excellence. Our collaborative approach has propelled us to new heights. We are proud to be recognized on the 2024 INC 5000 list as one of the fastest-growing small companies in the United States. This achievement is a testament to our team's dedication and the exciting opportunities ahead. If you thrive in a vibrant, high-paced culture where your contributions truly matter, we want to hear from you!



Working at HiEnd Accents means that you can expect the following:



- Competitive Compensation - We offer a highly competitive compensation package, including 13th Month Pay

- Professional Growth - We invest in our people and make sure they have the opportunity to continuously learn, grow, and develop their careers

- Great Team of Like-Minded Professionals - We prioritize hiring based on culture and values, so you are working with a team of folks who are as fun, talented, and committed as you are

title: Social Media Manager
description:
HOW TO APPLY

If this opportunity feels like the perfect fit for you and you meet the job qualifications, we invite you to learn more about our HiEnd Accents team in the Philippines and submit your application here: 
/appzq4iqeIREQRVyo/pagHKo8CnRtRpX585/form



Please note: Only applications submitted via this link will be considered.



Job Description



We are looking for an experienced, passionate, and creative Social Media Manager to join our team! As our Social Media Manager, you will be responsible for implementing our Social Media strategy in order to increase our online presence and strengthen our relationship with our customers and fans. You will be working closely with our Senior Social Media Manager and the remainder of our Marketing department. The platforms that you’ll primarily work on and be responsible for are (1) Instagram, (2)
, and (3) Pinterest. As our Social Media Manager, you will have a meaningful impact on our growth, bottom line, and brand identity in an exciting, design-driven company where being creative is just as important as being analytical.



The ideal candidate excels in building relationships, is passionate about social media and interior design, is a strong writer with a keen visual eye, and thrives on performance-driven teams.



We are looking for a long-term tea
mber who will stay and grow at our company. We offer competitive compensation, a good and stable work environment, and plenty of growth opportunities.



PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES



Content Development:



- In partnership with our Senior Social Media Manager and Marketing Team, create and maintain a social media content calendar that supports primary brand stories and goals while also tapping into seasonal 
nts and appropriate trends

- Create original, on-brand social media content that our followers will appreciate

- Content will be a mix of product-related content as well as product-adjacent content (e.g., top sleep tips!)

- Leveraging data, identify UGC and inspiration imagery to be considered for posting

- Write effective content. Work with copywriters and designers to ensure content is informative and appealing

- Keep up to date with current news, pausing content and escalating to leadership where appropriate

- Partner with Marketing and eComm tea
mbers to create shot lists for social media, as needed

- Develop Instagram Stories templates and stickers. Using those templates and Instagram platform elements, create our Instagram Stories



Posting:



- Schedule content for
, Instagram feed, Instagram Stories, and Pinterest, either within the app or by using tools such as Sprout Social or Later

- Post Instagram Stories directly from the Instagram app



Affiliate Marketing & Community Management



- Respond to all engagement and direct messages within 24 hours on weekdays

- Respond to all urgent engagement and direct messages within 24 hours on weekends

- Respond to engagement during normal US hours (range of acceptable times: 10 pm PH - 9 am PH)

- Author thoughtful, individualized comments and messages in the brand voice in response to comments on our pages, on images where we are tagged or where our product is depicted, and on images posted by brands and people we admire!

- Develop and maintain a live document with common questions and responses

- Adhere to rules and regulations - **no “black hat” social media techniques**! We want to build our brand presence organically



Asset Collection



- Request and gather UGC from our followers and fans in our Airtable database. Request content usage permission for all images that are within our brand guidelines. Follow up via
 or direct message as needed for any assets we are especially eager to share.

- Obtain or verify permissions for any images submitted via direct message,
, influencer collaborations or other means and upload to our visual curation tool, editing beforehand as needed.

- With brand priorities in mind, investigate content leads identified by social media, press, and other means to create a library of aspirational imagery featuring our products



Influencer Marketing



- Identify influencers who we can work with as part of our influencer marketing strategy

- Execute on influencer marketing strategy and management, including cultivating our network of valued influencer partners



Reporting & Strategy



- Assist in regular content performance and competitive reporting and analysis

- Provide ad hoc qualitative social analysis

- Be our in-house expert on social platform updates and trends in social media, interior design, home, and retail, presenting out to the team as needed

- Continuously seek ways to improve processes, recommending any tools or technology needed and subsequently serving as the primary point of contact for the relevant third parties

- Ideate new social activations, such as content series, engagement strategies, contests, and giveaways



About HiEnd Accents



HiEnd Accents designs and creates everyday luxury bedding and linens, sheeting, decorative pillows and other home textiles. Founded in 2005 and based in Dallas, Texas, our mission is to elevate our customers' lives via beautifully designed home textiles that deliver quality and value.



As a family-owned business, we’re committed to personal service and long-term relationships. Through our four brands, we offer unique designs across a spectrum of styles and price points, all united by exceptional value. Combined with our customer-first approach, prompt shipping and low order minimums, we’ve become the preferred bedding supplier for thousands of top department stores, furniture retailers, interior designers, and boutique hotels nationwide. Recently recognized on the 2024 INC 5000 list as one of the fastest-growing businesses in the US, we continue to innovate and expand our reach in the home textiles market.



Discover more about us and our brands at 



Why HiEnd Accents?



At HiEnd Accents, we're a close-knit team driven by entrepreneurial spirit, growth mindset, and a shared commitment to excellence. Our collaborative approach has propelled us to new heights – we're proud to be recognized on the 2024 INC 5000 list as one of the fastest-growing small companies in the United States. This achievement is a testament to our team's dedication and the exciting opportunities ahead. If you thrive in a vibrant, high-paced culture where your contributions truly matter, we want to hear from you!



Working at HiEnd Accents means that you can expect the following:



-Competitive Compensation - We offer a highly competitive compensation package, including 13th Month Pay

-Professional Growth - We invest in our people and make sure that they have the opportunity to learn, grow and develop their careers continuously

-Great Team of Like-Minded Professionals - We prioritize hiring based on culture and values, so you’re working with a team of folks who are as fun, talented, and committed as you are

mbers

title: Software Architect
description:
Software Architect (C#, ASP.NET, RESTful API, PostgreSQL)

Desired Experience

• 10+ years of hands-on experience in software development, with a strong focus on C# and ASP.NET for web-based applications.

• Proven experience as a software architect, technical lead, or equivalent senior engineering role in enterprise-scale systems.

• Strong proficiency in RESTful API design and implementation, microservices architecture, and integration design patterns.

• Deep understanding of software design principles (SOLID, DDD, and design patterns) and their practical application in large-scale projects.

• Extensive experience with PostgreSQL or equivalent relational databases, including schema design, query optimization, and performance tuning.

• Familiarity with cloud environments (Azure or AWS), containerization (Docker, Kubernetes), and CI/CD pipelines (Azure DevOps, GitHub Actions).

• Experience with front-end integration using modern frameworks (Next.js, React, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS) is a plus.

• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions.

• Excellent communication and leadership abilities, capable of guiding cross-functional teams and influencing architectural decisions.

Key Responsibilities

• Architect and design scalable, secure, and maintainable web-based systems using C#, ASP.NET, and PostgreSQL.

• Define and document system architecture, component interactions, and integration strategies.

• Establish and enforce best practices, coding standards, and design patterns across development teams.

• Mentoring engineers, reviewing designs and code, and ensuring technical excellence.

• Collaborate closely with product managers, UX/UI designers, and backend engineers to align architectural goals with business objectives.

• Drive API strategy, ensuring consistency, reliability, and high performance across services.

• Perform code and design reviews, ensuring adherence to architectural guidelines and high-quality delivery.

• Evaluate and recommend new technologies, frameworks, and tools to improve scalability and development efficiency.

• Lead technical discussions, system walkthroughs, and documentation for architecture decisions.

• Contribute to DevOps, CI/CD, and deployment automation efforts to streamline release processes.

Education Qualifications

• Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related technical field.

Job Location

• Full-time, remote position (Philippines).

• Must be able to collaborate effectively with distributed global teams.

About CareLytix LLC

CareLytix LLC is a healthcare data analytics company in Maryland USA focusing on big data solutions. CareLytix provides data-driven solutions to enable risk-bearing healthcare organizations to achieve their objectives on the path to value-based care.

CareLytix provides Data Analytics service, Data Management service, and Software Development service to healthcare providers, caregivers, payers and Healthcare vendors to reduce care cost and to improve care quality.

title: Klaviyo Technician (DTC / Email Marketing)
description:
Klaviyo Technician (Platinum Partner Level)

We are a fast-growing direct-to-consumer brand looking for a senior-level Klaviyo Technician who operates at Platinum Partner level. Someone we don’t need to explain Klaviyo to. You know the platform inside out, understand ecommerce deeply, and take full ownership of
 performance.



This role is not about following instructions. It’s about spotting what’s wrong before others see it, fixing it properly, and continuously improving results through smarter setups, cleaner logic, and best-in-class execution.

You are responsible for the entire technical
 infrastructure in Klaviyo and ensure everything runs flawlessly at scale.

What you’ll do

– Own the full technical setup of Klaviyo across flows and campaigns

– Build, maintain, and optimize advanced automated flows (welcome, abandoned browse/cart/checkout, post-purchase, winback, cross-sell, sunset, etc.)

– Set up flawless triggers, conditions, delays, exclusions, and dynamic logic

– Ensure segmentation is clean, scalable, and strategically sound

– Test everything thoroughly (logic, timing, personalization, edge cases)

– Proactively identify errors, inefficiencies, and missed opportunities and fix them

– Continuously optimize flows based on performance data (open rate, CTR, CVR, revenue)

– Safeguard deliverability and account health

– Work seamlessly with copywriters and designers to implement without friction

– Keep the Klaviyo account clean, structured, and future-proof

What we expect

– Proven senior experience with Klaviyo for DTC/ecommerce brands

– You operate at Platinum Partner level or equivalent expertise

– Deep understanding of flows, segments, event tracking, and ecommerce logic

– Extreme attention to detail – you catch what others miss

– Proactive, ownership-driven mindset

– You don’t wait for instructions; you see what needs to be done and do it

– Able to work independently and manage complex setups

– Fluent, clear communication in English

Big plus if you have

– Extensive experience with Shopify + Klaviyo integrations

– Strong knowledge of deliverability, sender reputation, and best practices

– Experience with A/B testing, analytics, and CRO-driven
 optimization

– Experience managing multiple brands or high-volume Klaviyo accounts



Important

We’re looking for someone who adds leverage, not workload.

If we have to explain how Klaviyo works, this is not the role for you.

s and social media reputation management)

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Administrative & Data Operations Assistant (Renewable Energy Projects)



Location: Remote

Employment Type: Full-Time

Schedule Requirement: Must be willing to work during U.S. Mountain Time (MT) business hours



Position Overview



We are seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented Administrative & Data Operations Assistant to support our renewable energy development team. This role is primarily administrative and operational, focused on coordinating data, preparing documentation, conducting research, and supporting internal workflows that help move projects forward.



This is a dynamic position where responsibilities may vary depending on project timelines and business demand. The selected candidate will also provide administrative support to specific projects and teams as needed.



Key Responsibilities



The role includes, but is not limited to, the following administrative and coordination tasks:



1. Land & Parcel Research Support



Collect and organize parcel information provided by outreach teams.

Research property details using tools such as Regrid, LandGlide, and County Assessor websites.

Verify ownership, acreage, and location information.

Maintain accurate records in internal databases (TerraVault and CRM platforms).

Coordinate GIS requests for mapping and site evaluation.



2. Data Management & System Updates



Upload, validate, and maintain project data across internal systems.

Clean and prepare datasets for bulk uploads.

Organize parcel groupings and ensure proper project classification.

Ensure records remain structured, accurate, and up to date.



3. Proposal & Documentation Coordination



Prepare proposal-related documentation based on project team instructions.

Update financial inputs and generate summaries for review.

Coordinate document workflows between internal systems and document platforms.

Assist with revisions and finalization of proposal packages.



4. Administrative Support for Landowner Engagement



Prepare digital and physical proposal packets.

Coordinate mailing requests and logistics when required.

Track consultation bookings and update internal records.

Ensure documents align with requested terms and project updates.



5. Market & Land Comparable Research



Conduct research using platforms such as Zillow, Redfin, Lands of America, Land and Farm, and AcreValue.

Compile comparison data and summarize findings for internal review.



6. Campaign & Project Data Uploading



Support outreach and mailing campaigns by reviewing and uploading datasets.

Validate data prior to import to maintain quality control.

Assist in onboarding new project targets into company systems.



7. Cross-Functional & Project-Based Administrative Support



Provide administrative assistance to internal teams for specific projects as needed.

Coordinate with GIS, Outreach, Projects, and Leadership teams to ensure workflow progress.



Track tasks, follow-ups, and documentation to help projects stay on schedule.





**Nature of the Role



This is not a routine clerical role. The position requires:

Managing structured processes while adapting to changing business needs.

Supporting multiple teams depending on active projects.

Handling a mix of research, coordination, documentation, and system updates.

Being flexible and responsive as priorities shift.



**Qualifications



At least 2 years of experience in an administrative, data support, operations, or similar role.

Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.

Ability to manage multiple tasks and shifting priorities.

Comfortable working with spreadsheets, databases, and online research tools.

Strong written communication and documentation abilities.

Self-directed and able to work remotely with minimal supervision.

Highly willing and able to work during U.S. Mountain Time hours (required).



**Preferred (but not required):



Experience in real estate, land research, GIS coordination, or renewable energy.

Familiarity with CRM or database systems.

Experience supporting project-based teams.



IMPORTANT:



Application Instructions (Important)

To apply, please complete the following steps:



1. Click the Google Form link provided in this job post and complete the application form.


/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScq1I6o7JPiy-ds_KtkbznAcTENzQd_XTHHQBUsmASrWD7qpA/viewform?usp=dialog



2. After submitting the form, send a message through this platform using the format below:



Format:

[Position Applying For] – [Full Name] – [Application Date]



Example:

Administrative Assistant – Steve Jone – February 18, 2026



**Applications that do not follow these instructions may not be reviewed.**



Please be adviced that only shortlisted will be contacted

title: Klaviyo Platinum Partner
description:
Klaviyo Technician (Platinum Partner Level)

We are a fast-growing direct-to-consumer brand looking for a senior-level Klaviyo Technician who operates at Platinum Partner level. Someone we don’t need to explain Klaviyo to. You know the platform inside out, understand ecommerce deeply, and take full ownership of
 performance.



This role is not about following instructions. It’s about spotting what’s wrong before others see it, fixing it properly, and continuously improving results through smarter setups, cleaner logic, and best-in-class execution.

You are responsible for the entire technical
 infrastructure in Klaviyo and ensure everything runs flawlessly at scale.

What you’ll do

– Own the full technical setup of Klaviyo across flows and campaigns

– Build, maintain, and optimize advanced automated flows (welcome, abandoned browse/cart/checkout, post-purchase, winback, cross-sell, sunset, etc.)

– Set up flawless triggers, conditions, delays, exclusions, and dynamic logic

– Ensure segmentation is clean, scalable, and strategically sound

– Test everything thoroughly (logic, timing, personalization, edge cases)

– Proactively identify errors, inefficiencies, and missed opportunities and fix them

– Continuously optimize flows based on performance data (open rate, CTR, CVR, revenue)

– Safeguard deliverability and account health

– Work seamlessly with copywriters and designers to implement without friction

– Keep the Klaviyo account clean, structured, and future-proof

What we expect

– Proven senior experience with Klaviyo for DTC/ecommerce brands

– You operate at Platinum Partner level or equivalent expertise

– Deep understanding of flows, segments, event tracking, and ecommerce logic

– Extreme attention to detail – you catch what others miss

– Proactive, ownership-driven mindset

– You don’t wait for instructions; you see what needs to be done and do it

– Able to work independently and manage complex setups

– Fluent, clear communication in English

Big plus if you have

– Extensive experience with Shopify + Klaviyo integrations

– Strong knowledge of deliverability, sender reputation, and best practices

– Experience with A/B testing, analytics, and CRO-driven
 optimization

– Experience managing multiple brands or high-volume Klaviyo accounts



Important

We’re looking for someone who adds leverage, not workload.

If we have to explain how Klaviyo works, this is not the role for you.

title: Ecommerce focused | Graphic Designer | Video Editor
description:
We are a fast-growing agency looking for a skilled and ambitious Graphic Designer & Video Editor who understands how to create visuals that convert. The ideal candidate has proven experience in the advertising / ecom industry and understands what makes an ad creative effective in terms of design, messaging and structure. You will be responsible for creating static and dynamic ad creatives for Meta 
 and Instagram), designing product images, website assets and marketing visuals, and editing high-performing video ads with a strong focus on direct-response design and marketing psychology.



You must be comfortable working with Figma and Canva for fast creative iteration and brand consistency. In addition, you should be experienced with Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator for product retouching and detailed visual work, and Adobe Premiere Pro or After Effects for editing video ads, including UGC style edits, fast cut formats and high-retention ad structures. Experience in creating visuals for e-commerce
 flows and campaigns inside Klaviyo is required. This includes designing
 banners, graphics and layouts that are optimized for conversions and mobile responsiveness.



You will work closely with our marketing team and will be expected to understand the principles of conversion-focused design, strong hooks, engaging visual pacing and modern advertising trends. 



Experience with motion graphics, ad formatting for Meta placements and understanding of creative best practices is highly valued.



To be successful in this role, you must be able to:

– Design and produce high-quality static ad creatives and product visuals.

– Edit video ads for Meta with strong hooks, fast pacing and a commercial focus.

– Work in Figma and Canva for layout and brand asset creation.

– Use Adobe software for advanced editing and graphic work.

– Design Figma
 graphics and layouts that fit e-commerce performance standards.

– Understand visual hierarchy, call-to-action placement and conversion design logic.

– Deliver work within deadlines and quickly iterate based on feedback.



We offer a remote position with consistent workflow, clear guidance and performance-based opportunities. Applicants must include a portfolio.



To apply, please include:

– A portfolio link with ad and or
 examples.

– A short overview of your experience with Figma, Klaviyo
 design and Adobe Suite.

title: Senior Python Developer
description:
Senior Python Automation Engineer

(Healthcare Compliance AI Systems – Long-Term Role)



About the Role

We are looking for a highly skilled Python Automation Engineer to manage and expand a proprietary automation system used for healthcare compliance auditing.



This is not a beginner role.

You will be working on a complex, production-grade automation system that:



- Scrapes dynamic healthcare portals

- Uses AI (Google Gemini API) for risk scoring

- Processes thousands of records

- Must run for hours without crashing



Stability and reliability are critical.



You will work directly with the system architect to improve performance, eliminate crashes, and expand functionality.



TECH STACK



Core

- Python 3.10+

- multiprocessing / threading

- pandas

- requests



Automation

- Selenium WebDriver (Chrome)

- Proxy rotation

- CAPTCHA solving (Recaptcha V2/Invisible)

- Session persistence

- Dynamic DOM handling



Backend & Dashboard

- Flask (API)

- Waitress (WSGI)

- HTML / JS (Frontend dashboard)

- Server-Sent Events (SSE)



AI / ML

- Google Gemini API (Vertex AI)

- Prompt engineering for risk analysis



Database

- SQLite (batch write optimization)



Infrastructure

- Windows Server

- Cloudflare Tunnels

- Google Workspace APIs (Chat, Drive, Gmail)



What You’ll Be Doing

1. Advanced Web Automation

- Maintain Selenium bots navigating dynamic portals

- Solve “Stale Element” and DOM mutation issues

- Manage iframe switching & shadow DOM

- Implement CAPTCHA bypass logic

- Improve anti-detection strategies



2. Concurrency & Stability

- Manage multiprocessing queues

- Prevent race conditions

- Implement crash recovery & self-healing logic

- Optimize CPU / RAM usage

- Improve long-run reliability



3. AI Workflow Refinement

- Improve prompt engineering

- Normalize scraped data before AI analysis

- Improve risk scoring accuracy



4. Dashboard & API Updates

- Maintain Flask backend

- Improve API endpoints

- Support real-time status streaming



Required Skills (Non-Negotiable)



You MUST:

- Be highly proficient in Python (5+ years)

- Have advanced Selenium experience (not basic automation)

- Understand concurrency deeply

- Be comfortable debugging production systems

- Write stable code that runs for hours unattended

- Be comfortable reading and improving legacy code



If you only built small scripts or basic scrapers, this role is not for you.



Bonus Experience

- Healthcare billing or CPT codes (97153, 97155)

- Google Cloud / Vertex AI

- Refactoring legacy systems

- OCR processing



Compensation

- $2,000 – $3,000/month depending on skill

- Full-time

- Long-term role

- Performance-based raises



Work Details

- Remote

- Full-time

-  Must overlap with US hours (specify your time zone)



To apply, include:

- Your years of Python experience

- A description of the most complex Selenium system you’ve built

- Your experience with multiprocessing

- A GitHub link (if available)

title: Virtual Assistant for Research Support (part-time)
description:
Mia is an AI agent transforming communication at car dealerships by acting as a super-employee — handling phone calls, texts,

What You’ll Do (20 hrs/week)

1) Competitive Analysis Reporting (Primary) 

- Conduct daily scans of competitor sources (social profiles, websites, press releases, announcements) and track specific data points across 13 companies. Baseline data will be provided. These findings will be logged in an existing tracker.



2) Executive + Admin Support

Support the executive team, through the EA, such as:

- Quick research requests

- Document prep/formatting

- Provide light operations support as needed

- Organize and label collected content for the EA’s daily review.



Contract Details

- Type: Independent Contractor

- Term: Part-time, 20 hours/week

- Schedule: Mon–Fri, 11:00 AM–3:00 PM CST (1:00 AM–5:00 AM PHT)

- Compensation: USD 400/month (Paid weekly on Fridays)



Requirements

- 1+ year experience as a VA, research assistant, or similar role

- Proficient in Google Workspace (Sheets, Docs, Drive) and Slack

- Strong English comprehension with clear, concise written updates

- Comfortable with independent web research, including LinkedIn, to track and monitor multiple companies simultaneously

- Must be online at 1:00 AM – 5:00 AM PHT (11:00 AM – 3:00 PM CT)



How to Apply

Use this subject line: [First Name + Last Name] - VA for Research

A) Describe your experience with research/tracking work (2–4 sentences)

About Us



Higher Results Education Inc. provides academic support to students in Canada. We are seeking reliable, proactive, and detail-oriented Online Class Assistants to attend live online classes on behalf of students, ensuring that all important information, instructions, and assignments are accurately captured and reported.



This is a great opportunity for someone self-motivated, tech-savvy, and comfortable in a virtual learning environment. High-performing assistants may be considered for team leader positions.

Actively engage in classes, monitor discussions, and follow instructions.



Complete student tasks, activities, assignments, quizzes, and exams as assigned.

Take detailed notes and summarize key points from each class.

Date and time (Vancouver time)



Student name



Subject/course title



Topics covered



Key instructions, deadlines, and announcements



Assignments, quizzes, and exams mentioned by the instructor



Communicate with professors and/or admin as needed for clarification or updates.



Ensure all assigned students’ classes are covered, and any conflicts or issues are promptly reported.



Requirements



Fluent in English (spoken and written)



Reliable, punctual, and proactive



Comfortable using Zoom, Google Meet, or similar platforms



Stable internet connection with a backup power source



Laptop, headset, and microphone for clear communication



Strong attention to detail and ability to follow instructions



Preferred Qualifications:



Experience in virtual assistance or online learning support



Strong multitasking and time management skills



Schedule



Depends on the students schedule



Flexible depending on student schedule, but attendance must be logged from 1:00 PM Vancouver time to ensure punctuality



Eligibility



Open to all genders



No age restrictions

title: YouTube Video Editing, Shorts & Graphic Design for Social
description:
We’re looking for an experienced and skilled video editor with graphic design training to join our team. This is a fast growing personal development brand at the intersection of healing and high performance. 



Duties include: 

- long form editing (hybrid podcast / talking head / vlog style),

- short form repurposing, and 

- graphic design for social media (carousels, quote posts and pins from templates).



You’ll be working in focus blocks with a small Philippines-based team in an online coworking space. 



Hours are 7am-noon Manila time with 50 min work, 10 min breaks each hour. You just be available to focus solely on this brand during these hours.



The editing style is restrained and elegant but retention focussed. Performance based editing is a must, but style is paramount. You must have skills with on screen text, simple animations, graphics on screen etc. and a good eye for style and detail.



This is a permanent position that starts at 36,000 PHP per month (or 8,000 per week). Wage increase (to 41,625 PHP per month - so 9,250 per week) and paid time off available after 3 months. Percentage based bonuses are given out yearly as are raises.



This is an excellent opportunity for someone who wishes to grow with the company as we are still small but growing fast. 



Please send a portfolio of work that demonstrates suitability for the role and a resume.



Applicants will be asked to do a short research question in lieu of interview.

title: Business Development Associate – Medical Education Platform
description:
Join a growing healthcare company advancing surgical education through a leading digital platform of peer-reviewed surgical videos used by medical professionals worldwide. We are seeking a Business Development Associate to support expansion of platfor
mbership through structured outreach, lead identification, and relationship development within academic and healthcare institutions.



This role focuses on identifying and engaging prospective institutional and professional members to increase adoption of our medical education platform. It is not an administrative or virtual assistant position. The ideal candidate has experience in business development, healthcare outreach, or professional education environments and is comfortable working independently in a growth-focused role.



Key Responsibilities



Lead Identification & Research – Identify academic departments, training programs, hospitals, and professional organizations that may benefit from platfor
mbership.



Strategic Outreach – Initiate and manage outreach to prospective members via
, LinkedIn, and other professional channels.



Pipeline Development – Qualify and organize leads to support structured membership expansion efforts.



CRM Management – Maintain accurate records of outreach, engagement activity, and pipeline status using CRM tools.



Market & Institutional Research – Analyze institutional structures, decision-makers, and educational needs to inform outreach strategy.



Collaboration with Leadership – Work closely with internal stakeholders to refine outreach messaging and growth strategy.



Required Qualifications



Demonstrated experience in business development, lead generation, institutional outreach, or related growth-focused roles.



Familiarity with healthcare, medical education, academic institutions, or digital education platforms strongly preferred.



Ability to independently research organizations and identify appropriate contacts and stakeholders.



Experience using CRM systems (e.g., HubSpot, Salesforce) to track outreach and engagement.



Strong professional written and verbal communication skills.



Self-directed, organized, and comfortable working in a structured, metrics-driven environment.



Role Details



Part-time (approximately 4 hours per day).



Flexible remote work structure.



Opportunity for role expansion based on performance and organizational growth.



Direct contribution to expanding access to peer-reviewed surgical education globally.



Application Instructions



To confirm that you have reviewed this posting in full, please begin your application message with the phrase: “Medical Education Growth.” Applications that do not include this phrase will not be considered.



Applicants must include a complete and accurate resume that reflects verifiable professional experience. Applications without a resume, or with incomplete or unverifiable information, will not be considered.



Applicants without prior experience in business development, institutional outreach, or relevant professional environments will not be considered.

title: (NZ) Lead Generation/Cold Caller
description:
CLICK TO APPLY: 



 

As our Lead Generator/Cold Caller you must have recruitment cold calling experience & would be an advantage to have jobadder or GHL experience, you will be responsible for identifying and generating new business opportunities by sourcing and qualifying potential leads. This role involves researching prospects, reaching out to potential clients moving them through the sales funnel. The Lead Generation Specialist works closely with the sales team to provide qualified leads, contributing to increased sales and business growth. 

 

Your Main Assignment Responsibilities Will Include:

Initial Contact: Reach out to leads via
, cold calling, and social media platforms to introduce company products/services and assess interest.

-Performance Reporting



Qualifications: 

Proven and strong years of experience in lead generation, sales development, or a related field  - Proficiency with lead generation platforms, CRM systems (e.g., Salesforce, HubSpot, GHL, Jobadder), and other
 marketing tools. 

- Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to initiate conversations and engage prospects. 

- Strong organizational skills, able to manage multiple leads, campaigns, and outreach activities simultaneously. 

- Ability to meet lead generation targets and KPIs, with a focus on quality over quantity. 

- Must be proactive, resourceful, detail oriented, communicative, disciplined and has great time management skill 



If this sounds like you then we need to hear from you immediately.

title: Full-Time Sales Assistant
description:
Company: Higher Results Education Inc.

Location: Remote (Philippines)

Work Schedule: Monday to Saturday, 3:00 AM – 1:00 PM (Philippine Time)



About Higher Results Education Inc.

Higher Results Education Inc. is a Canada-based education consulting company dedicated to connecting students with the right colleges and programs to help them achieve their academic and career goals. As we continue expanding our presence in the Philippines, we are seeking dedicated, reliable, and ambitious professionals to join our remote team on a long-term, full-time basis.

Our mission is to provide exceptional guidance and support to students while fostering strong relationships with our clients and partners. We are looking for individuals who thrive in fast-paced, results-driven environments and who are eager to make a meaningful impact in the world of education.



Position Overview

We are actively hiring Full-Time Sales Assistants to play a critical role in our student referral and outreach process. This position involves reaching out to existing clients, confirming potential referrals, and providing essential support to the sales team.

As a Sales Assistant, you will be a key driver of our growth in the Philippines. You will have the opportunity to develop your sales skills, gain experience with advanced CRM tools such as GoHighLevel (GHL), and contribute to a company that is making a real difference in education.



Key Responsibilities

As a Sales Assistant, your day-to-day duties will include:

Conducting outbound calls to clients using professionally prepared scripts

Engaging with clients to confirm whether they know individuals who could benefit from Higher Results Education

Identifying and qualifying potential referrals during conversations

Accurately recording all client interactions in GoHighLevel (GHL) and maintaining organized lead tracking

Ensuring timely follow-up on leads and referrals

Collaborating closely with the sales and management teams to optimize workflows and improve the efficiency of our lead tracking system

Maintaining a professional, friendly, and positive approach in every client interaction

Meeting or exceeding referral and performance targets



Performance & Growth Opportunities

At Higher Results Education, we value results, dedication, and growth. High-performing assistants may be considered for:

Additional responsibilities such as managing larger client accounts or mentoring new tea
mbers

Career advancement within the sales and operations departments

Performance-based incentives for consistently exceeding targets



Targets for this role:

Monthly KPI: 50–60 leads signed up with Higher Results Education

Daily Requirement: 3–4 closed leads



Qualifications & Requirements

To excel in this role, candidates should possess:

Proven sales experience (telemarketing, lead generation, or related roles preferred)

Hands-on experience with GoHighLevel (GHL) or similar CRM platforms

Strong English communication skills, both verbal and written

Ability to work independently, manage time effectively, and meet deadlines

High attention to detail, particularly in data entry and lead management

Self-motivated, proactive, and results-oriented mindset

Reliable internet connection and a quiet, professional workspace



Skills & Competencies

We are looking for individuals who demonstrate:

Excellent interpersonal and relationship-building skills

Comfort with CRM systems and the ability to follow structured workflows

Resilience and a positive attitude when handling rejection

Strong detail orientation with accurate tracking of leads and referrals

Ability to follow scripts while keeping conversations natural, engaging, and persuasive



Why Join Us?

Working with Higher Results Education offers more than just a job—it’s a chance to be part of something meaningful:

Fully remote work setup based in the Philippines

Opportunity to contribute to a company making a positive impact in education

Long-term career growth within a supportive and professional international team

A dynamic, results-driven environment that rewards dedication and achievement



How to Apply

If you are ready to join a fast-growing, impactful organization and meet the qualifications above, please
 the following to 

A brief summary of your sales experience

Details of your experience with GoHighLevel (GHL) or other CRM platforms

Your updated resume or CV

A short statement explaining your interest in the role and why you would be a strong fit



Note: This position is intended for candidates committed to long-term, full-time remote work who possess relevant sales and CRM experience. Only qualified applicants will be considered.

title: Quote Specialist
description:
G&G is shaking up the insurance world with exceptional representatives who wow clients at every turn through technology and best-in-class service. We are on a mission to save auto and homeowners time and money while finding and servicing the best insurance for their needs. We’re serious about providing an exceptional experience to every person we interact with and using technology to save our clients money, time, and the hassle of dealing with insurance companies. Voted as the ‘Best Agency to Work For’ year after year by the Insurance Journal, G&G not only seeks to bring an exceptional experience to our clients, but to our contractors as well. We’re just getting started with what we will accomplish! We’re looking for people who are just as passionate about helping make customers’ financial lives easier as we are.



We are looking for open-minded, highly motivated, and infectiously positive people to help us build an awesome new company for the insurance world. We are an open, diverse, and collaborative team working across multiple locations.



Your day will consist of providing exceptional experiences to internal tea
mbers as they relate to accurately and efficiently quoting insurance policies, data entry, and working on other ad-hoc projects.



Ultimately, you will help build and maintain our reputation as a company that offers top-notch client experiences during the insurance process.



What you’ll do…

-Assist Insurance Advisors and Customer Service Team in preparing insurance proposals for potential and current clients

-Update insurance proposals to send to business partners

-Review insurance policy documents

-Leverage technology to meet our client’s evolving needs

-Work through quote requests with quality and speed

-Work effectively in a collaborative team environment

-Other administrative projects as needed



Qualifications:

-Excellent English communication skills: written, verbal, and comprehension

-Insurance experience is not required, we will provide extensive training so you become an insurance expert!

-Relevant work experience preferred

-Ability to multitask, strong computer, analytical, decision-making, time management, and organizational skills

-Has good initiative and brings innovative ideas to help the company in achieving its goals

-Values integrity and dependability - this position requires full-time commitment. There is no leniency on job performance being impacted by other "side hustles" or jobs

-Windows Computer and webcam capability

-2 monitors

-Processor requirements: Intel Core i5 (10th gen or newer) or AMD Ryzen 5 (4000 series or newer)

-Backup Requirements:

     -25 mbps internet speed with instantly reloadable backup that is also 25 mbps (like Globe or Smart)

     -Alternative working location or generator/UPS for power outages



You’d be a great fit if you are…

-A fast-learner who is meticulous, diligent, and proud about your work

-Adaptable, positively embrace change, and have a growth mindset

-Open to two-way feedback and coaching, your success is our success!

-Interested in working in a fast-growing start-up environment

-Able to analyze a situation, prioritize, and execute tasks presented to you

-Highly-motivated, have an entrepreneurial spirit and a strong work ethic

*

s)

 Ads or

title: Virtual Assistant | Lead Generation, Research, Project Management & Admin
description:
VIRTUAL ASSISTANT — GENERAL OPERATIONS | APEX VELOCITY

Salary: Starting at $500/month with a structured review at 90 days. Strong performers move to $600–$800/month as scope and responsibility grow.

Schedule: Monday to Friday. Flexible hours — just make sure your tasks are completed each day.

Employment: Full-time

Reports To: Obaid John — Founder, Apex Velocity



WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING

This is a generalist role. The mix of tasks will change depending on what the business needs that week, but here's what you can expect to work on:

--> Lead Generation & Outreach: Researching founders and CEOs who'd benefit from executive support, building prospect lists, sending outreach messages via LinkedIn and
, and keeping the sales pipeline organised.

--> Research: Market research, competitor analysis, sourcing tools, and preparing briefs. When I need to make a decision, you're the person who gives me the information to make it.

--> Project Management: Organising tasks in Trello or Jira, tracking deadlines, and keeping things moving across multiple workstreams.

--> Social Media: Scheduling posts across LinkedIn, X, and Instagram. Helping with basic content creation in Canva.

-->
 & Calendar: Managing the founder's inbox, drafting responses, scheduling meetings.

--> General Admin: CRM updates (Pipedrive), document creation, file organisation, and whatever else comes up.

The balance between these will shift as the agency grows. You need to be comfortable with the priorities changing week to week — that's the nature of working in a startup agency.



WHO THIS IS FOR

--> You figure things out. When you get a task you've never done before, your first instinct is to Google it, watch a YouTube tutorial, or test it yourself — not message me asking what to do.

--> You're comfortable with variety. The same week might involve building a lead list, editing a Canva graphic, and reorganising a project board. That excites you, not stresses you.

--> You communicate clearly. If something is unclear, you ask early. If something is going to be late, you flag it before the deadline, not after.

--> You've worked as a VA, EA, or in a similar operations role for at least 2 years.

--> Your written English is strong — you'll be drafting outreach messages to founders and CEOs.

--> You're familiar with tools like Google Workspace, Canva, Slack/WhatsApp, CRMs, and project management software.



WHO THIS IS NOT FOR

--> If you need a detailed task list every morning to know what to do, this isn't the right fit.

--> If you prefer doing the same predictable tasks every day, you'll find this role frustrating.

--> If you're looking for a side gig alongside a full-time job, this won't work — we need your full focus.

--> If you're not comfortable being honest when something isn't working or when you've made a mistake, we're not the right team for you.



BONUS SKILLS (NOT REQUIRED)

--> Experience supporting a founder or working inside an agency

--> Familiarity with Pipedrive, Jira, or similar tools

--> Basic graphic design or video editing

--> Experience with LinkedIn outreach or cold
 campaigns

--> Knowledge of AI tools (ChatGPT, automation workflows, etc.)



ABOUT APEX VELOCITY

Apex Velocity is an executive support agency that partners with founders and CEOs to handle the operational workload that slows them down. We provide virtual assistants who act as strategic right-hands — covering lead generation, research, project management, social media, and admin so our clients can focus on what actually grows their business.

You'd be our first hire. That means there's no middle management, no red tape, and no waiting months for a decision. You work directly with the founder. But it also means we're building this together — the systems, the processes, the SOPs. We have a clear structure in place and know exactly how we want to operate. What we need is someone to help execute it and make it better.



WHAT YOU ACTUALLY GET

--> Salary review at 90 days — not a vague "maybe someday." Strong performers move to $600–$800/month as the role grows.

--> 13th month pay and birthday bonus after 6 months with the company.

--> 3 vacation leaves + 3 sick leaves after 6 months. We honour most Filipino holidays.

--> Paid on time, every time. No chasing invoices.

--> Direct access to the founder — your input shapes how the agency runs.

--> Job security — we're not looking for a short-term hire. We want someone to grow with us long-term.

--> Growth with the agency — as we scale and bring on clients, your role and compensation grow with it.

--> Training and investment in your skills — if a tool or course would make you better at your job, we'll invest in it.



HOW TO APPLY

Start your application with the phrase "Ready to build" so we know you've read the full description. Then tell us:

--> Who you are and where you're based

--> Your relevant experience — especially anything involving lead generation, research, or project management

--> What tools and software you use daily



We read every application. If you're the right fit, you'll hear from us within a few days.

APEX VELOCITY — PEAK PERFORMANCE. MAXIMUM SPEED.

title: Junior Graphic Designer
description:

We are hiring a junior designer who is creative, detail oriented, and fast.



This is a design role only. You will work in Figma. 



We care about strong layouts, clear hierarchy, clean spacing, and designs that convert.



Creativity matters here. 

So does precision. 

So does speed.



If you are artistic but ignore direction, this will not work.

If you are structured but not creative, this will not work. 

We need both.



What You Will Design:

- Logos and light branding

- Vector illustrations (mostly small graphics & recreated logos)

How We Work:

- You will receive clear direction, references, and feedback.

- Your job is to execute creatively within the framework.



What We Expect:

- You improve designs without overcomplicating them

- You complete small revisions quickly

- You communicate clearly

- You manage your time well

- Small edits should not take multiple days.

- Feedback should not need to be repeated.



Required Skills:

- Understanding of UI and UX principles

- Understanding clean typography and spacing

- Vector illustration basics

Mon - Fri

9am - 5pm ET

title: Commercial Multifamily Insurance Underwriter
description:

mber can step in if needed

title: Creative Photoshop / Media Specialist (Art Mockups)
description:
We are looking for an experienced Photoshop professional to create high-quality, realistic art mockups and prepare complete image sets for our e-commerce art products. This role is fully focused on visual quality, realism, and consistency, working within a clear SOP and fixed production standards.



You will be responsible for creating realistic interior mockups, white background images, stretched-out artwork images, and close-up detail shots. Each product requires a complete and correctly ordered image set that is ready for direct use in product creation and online sales.



A key part of this role is adding realistic frames to artworks when frame images are not provided. Frames must always match the actual options we offer. Guessing, inventing styles, sizes, or finishes is not acceptable. If something is unclear or missing, we expect you to flag it rather than make assumptions.



Strong attention to lighting, shadows, scale, color accuracy, and overall realism is essential. All mockups must visually match real-world proportions and product configurations. Images must be resized to 1200 × 1200 (1:1) and prepared according to our image standards.



This is not a graphic design or social media role. We are looking for someone with strong Photoshop compositing skills, experience with realistic interior and art mockups, and the ability to follow strict SOPs consistently. Precision, repeatability, and visual judgment matter more than speed.



Your work directly impacts product quality, brand perception, and conversion rates. If you enjoy creating clean, realistic, production-ready visuals and are comfortable working within structured workflows, we would love to hear from you.



Hiring Process:

Shortlisted candidates may be asked to complete a small paid evaluation task as part of the selection process.

title: Marketing & Automation Virtual Assistant
description:
Help us triple revenue and scale to $1M+ in sales.



We’ve completed over 9,900 appraisals worth more than $7.5 billion in value over the past 22 years. That track record gives us unmatched credibility in the Greater Boston real estate market. But we’re not coasting—we’re currently at about $300,000 in annual sales, and our next milestone is $1,000,000 in sales within a year.



To get there, we need a Marketing & Automation Virtual Assistant who can own the marketing engine, build scalable systems, and help us grow our databases and campaigns 6X over the next six months.



What You’ll Do

 lists from ~6,000 to 35,000 contacts (20,000 real estate agents, 10,000 estate planning attorneys, 5,000 divorce attorneys).

, LinkedIn, Instagram, and Google My Business.
