Report weekly KPIs in VA tea
etings and monthly in company-wide meetings.



What We’re Looking For



Must-haves



CRM experience (Go High Level preferred) or a concrete plan to master it in 30 days.



Proficiency in creating professional marketing assets (Canva or AI-driven tools).



Social media and
 marketing management experience.



Excellent English communication and ability to work independently.



Familiarity with automation platforms (
, Zapier) and comfort with AI platforms (ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini, etc.).



Big Plus



Familiarity with Airtable or similar database tools (our peers replaced ANOW with Airtable, and that cost-saving project will be part of your role).



Experience with analytics dashboards (Google Analytics, retargeting codes, Looker Studio).



Experience in real estate or legal marketing.



Our Tech Stack



CRM & Marketing: Go High Level, Framer (website), Next Level Pro (dashboards, tracking)



Automation: 
, Zapier



Project & Workflow: Trello, Slack, Google Workspace/Drive, ANOW (to be replaced), ACI appraisal software



Analytics: Google Analytics, Google retargeting codes, Looker Studio



AI & Transcription: Fireflies.ai, ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini, custom GPTs for internal and client use



Design: Canva and AI design prompt tools



Why Join Us



This isn’t a stepping-stone VA role. It’s a chance to own and build the marketing function of a company on track to triple revenue.



Growth path: potential to step into a Marketing Manager role.



Culture: fast, supportive, built on kindness, speed, and ownership.



Performance-based rewards: the more value you bring, the more you earn.



What We Offer



Starting salary: $800–$1,500/month USD, based on experience and skill.



Quarterly performance bonuses and annual salary reviews.



13th-month pay (based on your highest rate).



Paid healthcare reimbursement (up to $850/year).



5 paid personal days after six months.



Access to premium training, including Roy Meyer’s marketing and AI coaching program.



90 Day Success Benchmarks

By 30 days: Master Go High Level and launch your first campaign.



By 60 days: Grow database by 40% and launch 2 automations.



By 90 days: Deliver a campaign calendar and Airtable/ANOW replacement plan.

To Apply



Send us:



Your resume.



A link to your portfolio or work samples.



A short note on your CRM/automation experience and how you’d drive growth in your first 90 days.



Optional but encouraged: a one-minute Loom video introducing yourself.

title: Hiring Full-Time Remote US Tax Manager
description:
About Us



We are a fast-growing, strategy-focused accounting and tax firm serving entrepreneurs, real estate investors, and closely held businesses across the U.S. Our firm blends high-level tax planning with strong operational execution, leveraging technology and global teams to deliver exceptional results.



We are seeking a seasoned U.S. Tax Manager to lead tax compliance, oversee filings, manage staff, and support advanced tax planning initiatives.



Role Overview



The Tax Manager will be responsible for end-to-end tax oversight, including preparation, review, client advisory, and team management. This role requires strong technical tax knowledge, hands-on experience with UltraTax, and the ability to operate independently in a remote environment.



You will work closely with ownership, bookkeeping teams, and clients to ensure accurate filings, proactive planning, and timely delivery.



Key Responsibilities

Tax Compliance & Review



Prepare and review complex federal and state tax returns, including:



Individual (1040)



Partnerships (1065)



S Corporations (1120S)



C Corporations (1120)



Multi-state filings



Ensure compliance with current U.S. federal, state, and local tax laws



Manage tax deadlines and filing calendars to ensure on-time submissions



Handle IRS and state notices, audits, and correspondence as needed



Tax Planning & Advisory



Support and execute proactive tax strategies for business owners and real estate investors



Advise on entity structure, reasonable compensation, depreciation, cost segregation coordination, and other planning opportunities



Collaborate with leadership on advanced tax strategies and client-specific planning



Technology & Systems



Primary tax software: UltraTax CS



Work closely with QuickBooks Online to reconcile tax returns to books



Review bookkeeping accuracy prior to tax preparation



Maintain clean workpapers and documentation standards



Team Leadership



Review work prepared by junior tax staff and offshore tea
mbers



Provide feedback, training, and quality control



Assist in improving tax workflows, SOPs, and internal processes



Act as a technical resource for the tax and accounting teams



Client Communication



Serve as a point of contact for tax-related client questions



Explain tax outcomes and planning strategies clearly and confidently



Participate in client meetings and planning calls when needed



Required Qualifications



5+ years of U.S. tax experience in public accounting



Strong working knowledge of U.S. federal and state tax law



Hands-on experience with UltraTax CS (required)



Strong experience with QuickBooks Online



Experience reviewing complex business returns



Ability to work independently and manage multiple clients and deadlines



Excellent written and verbal communication skills



High attention to detail and strong organizational skills

title: Font Designer & UI/UX Expert (Typography + Figma)
description:
We are launching a next-generation Type Foundry that merges AI technology with high-end design. We are looking for a talented and meticulous Type Designer to join us in building a premium font collection from the ground up. If you have an obsession with letters and a "killer" eye for UI, we want to work with you.



Key Responsibilities:



Font Refinement & Engineering: Take AI-generated skeletons and transform them into professional-grade fonts. This includes cleaning vector paths, developing multiple weights (Bold, Regular, Light, etc.), and ensuring technical perfection.



Spacing & Kerning: Perform precise manual spacing and kerning to ensure flawless readability in both Hebrew and Latin (English) scripts.



Figma UI/UX Design: Design a high-end, minimalist website for the foundry in Figma. You will create the user interface and high-impact "Font Specimens" (marketing visuals) that showcase the fonts in real-world use cases.



Technical Quality: Ensure all font files are production-ready and meet industry standards.



Requirements:



Proven expertise in font design software (Glyphs App or FontLab).



Advanced proficiency in Figma (UI/UX and visual design).



Deep understanding of Hebrew and Latin typography (experience with Hebrew Niqqud/vowels is a major plus).



Surgical precision with Bezier curves and vector quality.



Ability to work independently and meet high aesthetic standards.



What We Offer:



A chance to be part of a disruptive project at the intersection of AI and Typography.



Flexible, remote freelance/project-based work.



Potential for long-term collaboration as we expand our library.



How to Apply:

Please send your portfolio with a focus on type design and typography-led UI projects. Applications without relevant font design examples will not be considered.

title: Procurement Manager & Executive Assistant (Food Marketing & Distribution)
description:
We are a growing food marketing and distribution company looking for a "Bulldozer" – a sharp, highly organized, and assertive individual to serve as a Procurement Manager and right-hand to the CEO. This is a dynamic role that combines strategic purchasing, negotiation, and high-level operational support.



Key Responsibilities:



Procurement & Negotiation: Manage relationships with food suppliers, importers, and manufacturers. You will be responsible for sourcing products, negotiating prices, and constantly improving commercial terms to maximize profitability.



Operations & Logistics: Coordinate with transportation companies, track inventory levels, ensure timely deliveries, and solve real-time logistical challenges ("firefighting").



Executive Support: Act as the CEO’s right hand – managing urgent tasks, following up on employee and vendor execution, and ensuring the business operates smoothly.



Financial Oversight: Review supplier invoices, conduct market price comparisons, and implement cost-cutting measures across operations.



Requirements:



Proven Negotiation Skills: You are someone who isn't afraid of "No," knows how to push for the best deal, and can handle tough conversations with vendors.



Assertiveness & Communication: Ability to communicate effectively with everyone – from marketing executives to truck drivers and warehouse managers.



High Energy & Availability: Thrives in a fast-paced environment and can handle pressure in the high-velocity food industry.



Tech-Savvy: Proficiency in Microsoft Office (specifically Excel) and business management software.



Background in Food/Retail: Previous experience in the food industry or retail sector is a significant advantage.



Why Join Us?



A key role with a direct impact on the company’s bottom line.



A fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment with room for professional growth.



Direct collaboration with the CEO.



If you are a results-oriented person who loves the art of the deal and thrives in a dynamic trade environment, we want to hear from you.

title: YouTube Editor
description:
Location: Remote

Type: Part-time contractor (with potential to grow)

Compensation: Competitive monthly retainer based on experience



About Me & The Business



I run a high-ticket coaching program that helps people dramatically reduce or eliminate daily anxiety and feel “calm and normal” again. We work mostly with people who’ve tried the usual advice and still wake up with a racing mind and tight chest.



I’m rebuilding the business around a simple, direct-response funnel:



Paid ads ? application ? booked call ? client



Content is a key part of that. I do weekly livestreams, client sessions, and trainings. I need someone who can turn that raw footage into clear, compelling assets that build trust and book more calls.



The Role



You’ll be my core video editor. Your job is NOT to make things “cinematic.” Your job is to:



Turn my raw content (livestreams + client calls + proof) into videos that keep attention and help lower CAC (cost to acquire a client).



Weekly, you will:



Take 1 long-form piece (usually a Thursday live or training)

Take selected client sessions / proof clips

Deliver a set of finished assets that can be used in:

YouTube / podcast

Social / ads

Lead nurture (texts/emails before calls)

Your Responsibilities



Every week you will:



Create 1 long-form video (8–15 minutes)



Teaching, breakdown, or case study.

Clean structure: hook, context, teaching, examples, CTA.

Create 2–3 short-form videos (30–90 seconds each)



At least one is a concrete client win / testimonial.

At least one is a “tiny win” or reframe that anxious people can use immediately.

Optionally one objection-buster (time, money, “I’ve tried everything,” etc.).

Edit for clarity and retention



Strong hooks in first 1–3 seconds.

Tight pacing, no fluff.

Simple captions, titles, and pattern interrupts that help understanding, not distract.

Be self-managing



Take a clear brief and turn it into finished assets with minimal back-and-forth.

Organize files and deliverables logically each week.

Hit deadlines consistently.

You Are a Fit If…



You have 2+ years editing long and short-form video for online creators, coaches, or info products.

You understand direct-response style content: hooks, offers, CTAs, proof.

You care more about watch time, clarity, and sales impact than fancy transitions.

You can work from a Loom brief or written notes without needing your hand held.

You can hit a weekly content pack on time, every time.

Big plus if:



You’ve edited content in the mental health / self-improvement / coaching space.

You can show before/after examples of how you improved pacing, hooks, or structure.

What Success Looks Like (First 90 Days)



Every week, I get:

1 long-form video and 2–3 shorts that I can post or use in ads with no major edits.

We start to see:

Better hooks and watch time on content,

Strong proof assets we can plug into landing pages and ads,

A growing library of usable clips from client wins.
salary: Competitive monthly retainer based on ex

title: Listing & Onboarding Associate
description:
About the Role



Minty Living is seeking a highly organized, detail focused, and proactive Listing and Onboarding Associate who knows Guesty and 
 inside and out. This role requires someone who can navigate complex system behavior, resolve listing issues quickly, and maintain complete accuracy across all platforms. You will manage digital onboarding, listing accuracy, platform troubleshooting, and daily audits.



Strong experience in property management is essential. Guesty has many connected fields, and 
 has strict rate plan structures, so you must already understand how these systems work and how to fix problems fast.



Key Responsibilities

• Manage digital onboarding from intake to live status across Airbnb, VRBO, Marriott Homes and Villas, Guesty, 
, Minty Living website, and other channels.

• Maintain complete accuracy in ClickUp and all property management databases.

• Perform daily, weekly, and quarterly audits to confirm that every detail matches across Guesty and all OTAs.

• Resolve technical issues in Guesty and 
, including:

      • Relisting properties that were removed or delisted

      • Identifying and correcting automated delisting triggers in connected systems

      • Fixing rate plan and pricing setup issues in 

      • Resolving sync failures and mismatches between Guesty and OTAs

      • Optimize listings with updated titles, descriptions, pricing details, and photo order to improve visibility and conversions.

• Coordinate with design and operations to gather final photos, floor plans, and marketing assets.

• Serve as the primary contact for OTA representatives for swift problem resolution.

• Track listing performance data and apply targeted adjustments.



Requirements

• Proven background in property management or short term rental operations.

• Strong and direct experience with Guesty is essential. You must know how to fix common issues, reconnect channels, understand field dependencies, and troubleshoot with accuracy.

• Strong experience with 
 rate plans, extranet behavior, and reactivation of removed or disconnected listings.

• Familiarity with Airbnb, VRBO, Marriott Homes and Villas, Pricelabs, Peerspace, and Giggster.

• Advanced ClickUp experience.

• Strong attention to detail. You will complete an attention to detail test before moving forward.

• Ability to identify small discrepancies in data, copy, and platform fields.

• Clear communication skills and comfort working across several teams.

• Proactive approach to problem solving and ability to handle multiple deadlines.



Success Metrics

• Accurate listings across all channels.

• Onboarding completed within the expected timeline.

• Fast resolution of Guesty and 
 issues, including relisting and rate plan fixes.

• Steady improvement in listing performance metrics.



How to Apply

To apply, please send:

• A brief explanation of why you believe you are a strong fit for this role

• Your updated CV

description:

We are a provider of advanced network communications and technology solutions for consumers, small businesses, enterprise organizations, and carrier partners across the U.S.



About the Role:

The Major Account Development Manager will focus on business development, by selling our full suite of strategic products and services to an assigned geographic base of customers. Our goal is to increase wallet share, increase customer satisfaction with us, reduce churn, and increase our customer base utilization of strategic next-gen services. The Major Account Development Manager will leverage a full support team consisting of an Sales Director and Project Management team



What You’ll Do:



Develop and maintain a comprehensive understanding of our sales process, products, and solutions to ensure customers are under contract with the most strategic product set.

Develop a deep understanding of a customer’s business, corporate priorities, and industry to effectively identify solutions that align with the customer’s strategy and needs.

Develop, own, and document the multi-faceted account plan and growth strategy for each customer;

manage priorities and eco-system partners to meet established milestones and achieve sales growth objectives. A

ct with a sense of urgency and work in close partnership with the Customer Success organization, to assure customer issues are resolved quickly.

Develop and implement plans to create additional opportunities to cross-sell and up-sell accounts and increase overall total customer spend.

Manage a pipeline of opportunities in Upgrade to see actual info including generation of accurate forecasts and attainment of assigned quotas.

Participate in, and successfully complete, all required training; participate in teaUpgrade to see actual infoetings and activities as required



Do You Have?

Verifiable record of success in enterprise-level sales, owning a customer base, and driving full life-cycle management of sales, conversions, and renewals.

Prior strategic account management and consultative sales experience selling multiple products and solutions to medium and large businesses.

Strong interpersonal skills, organization skills, time management skills, listening skills, presentation skills, verbal, and written communication skills.

Ability to confidently network, build rapport, and develop trusted relationships overtime to execute mid to long-term account plans.

Excellent presentation skills and ability to speak with business professionals at all levels in an organization and across multiple lines of business.

Strong problem-solving and analytical skills

title: Telecommunications Tech ****YOU MUST SUBMIT A RESUME AND VOICE RECORDING IN ORDER TO BE CONSIDERED FOR A POSITION****
description:
We are a leading telecommunications solutions provider dedicated to delivering cutting-edge communication technologies to businesses of all sizes. We pride ourselves on providing exceptional service and innovative solutions to our clients, and we are looking for a talented Telecommunications Phone System Technician to join our team.



Position Overview:

As a Telecommunications Phone System Technician, you will play a crucial role in designing, implementing, and maintaining telecommunications systems for our clients. We are seeking an experienced technician with a strong background in legacy systems like Nortel, Avaya, and NEC, as well as expertise in modern UCaaS (Unified Communications as a Service) solutions and VoIP phone systems such as RingCentral, 8x8, 3CX, and Nextiva.



Responsibilities:



Install, configure, and maintain legacy phone systems like Nortel, Avaya, and NEC.

Design and implement UCaaS solutions to meet client requirements.

Configure and troubleshoot VoIP phone systems, including RingCentral, 8x8, 3CX, and Nextiva.

Perform system upgrades, patches, and maintenance tasks.

Provide technical support and assistance to clients, both remotely and on-site.

Collaborate with clients to understand their telecommunication needs and recommend solutions.

Assist in the training of end-users on telecommunication systems.

Keep up-to-date with industry trends and emerging technologies in telecommunications.

Qualifications:



Minimum of 3 years of hands-on experience in telecommunications.

Proficiency in legacy phone systems such as Nortel, Avaya, and NEC EC.

Strong knowledge of UCaaS solutions and VoIP phone systems, including RingCentral, 8x8, 3CX, and Nextiva.

Excellent troubleshooting and problem-solving skills.

Strong communication and interpersonal skills.

Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

Previous experience with 8x8, RingCentral, Nextiva, or Dialpad is a strong plus.

Industry certifications (e.g., CCNA, CCNP, UCaaS certifications) are a bonus.



Why Join?



Competitive salary and benefits package.

Opportunities for professional growth and development.

Collaborative and supportive team environment.

Exposure to cutting-edge telecommunications technologies.

Chance to work with a diverse range of clients and industries.

Employee recognition and appreciation programs.

If you are a dedicated Telecommunications Phone System Technician with experience in legacy systems and modern UCaaS/VoIP solutions, we encourage you to apply. Join our team and help us shape the future of business communication.

title: Senior Graphic Designer
description:
Position Overview

Your creativity and expertise will contribute to enhancing client brand identities, marketing materials, and overall visual communication.

mbers to understand design requirements and deliver compelling visual solutions.

title: Estimator – Modular Homes
description:
We’re looking for an Estimator to support our growing modular homes business. This role suits someone who is comfortable working independently, using drawings and best-practice construction knowledge to build accurate cost estimates for modular homes, worker accommodation and custom designs.

You’ll work closely with our designer and operations team, using drawings, previous projects and supplier price lists to determine true build cost — including clear separation of labour and materials. While we’ll provide support, systems and pricing references (including supplier lists and historic plans), you’ll be expected to take ownership of your estimates and apply sound judgement.

Australian construction experience is preferred, along with the confidence to price both standard designs and special requests.



Key Responsibilities

Prepare accurate cost estimates for modular homes, worker accommodation and custom builds

Independently estimate from drawings, specifications and design information

Break down costs clearly into labour vs materials

Use supplier pricing (e.g. Bunnings product lists, trade suppliers) and internal rate schedules to determine build cost

Review and use historic plans and previous projects as estimating references

Work closely with the designer to ensure estimates align with design intent, constructability and efficiency

Price variations, revisions and client-specific design changes

Identify opportunities to improve productivity or reduce costs through design or construction methods, and confidently raise these with the team

Assist with pricing of non-standard requests (initially focusing on basic inclusions such as bathrooms, kitchens and fixtures)



About You

Experience or strong exposure to Australian construction methods, materials and pricing

Confident reading and interpreting drawings to produce estimates independently

Comfortable making judgement calls using best knowledge, not just fixed templates

Strong attention to detail and ability to structure clear cost breakdowns

Confident with numbers and spreadsheets

Good communicator — able to collaborate closely with designers, suppliers and operations

title: Senior HubSpot Sales Operations Manager (CRM Pipelines & Automation)
description:
IMPORTANT – Please Read Before Applying



This is NOT a general virtual assistant role.



We are only interested in applicants with real, hands-on HubSpot CRM experience supporting active sales teams and managing pipelines daily.



If your experience is mainly social media, admin support, or
 marketing, this role will not be a fit.



—-



About The Role



The Door Centre Galway is a fast-growing Irish showroom and joinery business receiving a high daily volume of enquiries through Meta ads, WhatsApp, phone, and website leads.



We are hiring a full-time HubSpot Sales Operations Manager to take ownership of our CRM, lead flow, automation, and sales coordination so our showroom closers can focus on selling.



You will act as the operational controller behind our sales system.



—-



Core Responsibilities



HubSpot CRM Ownership

 • Manage HubSpot daily as the central sales operations platform

 • Maintain pipelines, deal stages, and ownership rules

 • Monitor incoming leads and ensure fast first contact

 • Maintain high data quality and structured CRM processes

 • Prevent duplicate contacts and stale deals



Lead Flow & Coordination

 • Review incoming leads fro
ta ads, website forms, WhatsApp, and calls

 • Send approved WhatsApp/email first-touch messages

 • Qualify enquiries (homeowner vs builder/trade)

 • Assign leads to the correct sales closer

 • Ensure follow-ups are scheduled and completed



Automation & Workflow Management

 • Build and maintain HubSpot workflows, sequences, and task automation

 • Improve response speed and conversion processes

 • Support WhatsApp integration within HubSpot

 • Suggest improvements to our sales systems



Sales Operations Support

 • Identify stalled deals and notify the sales team

 • Track pipeline health and activity

 • Provide simple weekly reporting to management



—-



What This Role Is NOT

 • You will NOT be responsible for closing sales

 • You will NOT negotiate pricing or speak technically about products

 • You will NOT run marketing campaigns or social media



Your focus is CRM operations, lead coordination, and sales structure.



—-



Required Experience (Non-Negotiable)

 • Proven hands-on experience managing HubSpot for a sales-driven business

 • Strong understanding of Deals, Contacts, Companies, Pipelines, and Workflows

 • Experience supporting or coordinating active sales teams

 • Ability to manage high lead volumes daily

 • Excellent written English communication skills

 • Able to work independently and take ownership



—-



Preferred Experience

 • WhatsApp integration within a CRM

 • Sales Operations / Revenue Operations background

 • Experience in construction, home improvement, retail, or trade environments



—-



Working Style We Expect

 • Highly organised and process-driven

 • Confident managing systems without constant supervision

 • Ownership mindset — not just task-based

 • Comfortable working aligned with Irish business hours



—-



Compensation



Full-time remote position with competitive salary based on proven HubSpot Sales Operations experience.



Expected range: ph90,000 – ph150,000 per month depending on seniority and hands-on HubSpot expertise.



This is a long-term role with a growing Irish business — not a short-term VA position.



—-



Application Instructions (Important)



To be considered, please include:

 1. A short Loom/video introduction explaining your HubSpot experience.

 2. Examples of pipelines, workflows, or automation you have personally built.

 3. Confirmation you can work aligned to Irish business hours.

 4. Start your application with the word PIPELINE so we know you have read the full job description.



Applications that do not follow these instructions will not be reviewed.

title: HR Generalist
description:
Join Our Remote Accounting Team!

We are a fast-growing, boutique outsourced accounting firm supporting high-growth e-commerce and service-based businesses. We’ve been behind the scenes helping some of the most exciting DTC brands scale with confidence through expert bookkeeping, financial systems, and strategic insights.



We are a remote-first company with a collaborative, client-first culture — and we’re looking for exceptional talent to grow with us.



About the Role

We are looking for a hands-on HR Generalist who thrives in a startup environment and is excited to help build the HR function from the ground up. This role goes beyond day-to-day HR support — you will play a key role in setting up foundational HR processes, shaping people practices, and supporting the growth of our teams as the company scales.



As a young and fast-growing company, growth opportunities are significant. You will have the chance to help build teams, influence culture, and design systems that will evolve alongside the business. While the team currently operates in a distributed setup, the role is designed to support both remote and future on-site tea
mbers.



You will work closely with the HR and Talent Acquisition Manager to establish strong HR frameworks, ensure compliance, and deliver a positive tea
mber experience across the U.S. and the Philippines.



Your Responsibilities

** Recruitment & Talent Acquisition

- Manage full-cycle recruitment especially for finance and accounting roles, including Bookkeepers, Senior Bookkeepers, Accountants, and related positions.

- Source, screen, and interview candidates across the U.S. and the Philippines.

- Partner with hiring managers to clarify role needs and support workforce planning as teams grow.

- Build and continuously improve recruitment processes suitable for a startup environment.

- Coordinate interviews, reference checks, and offer processes.

- Maintain the applicant tracking system and ensure a smooth, professional candidate experience.



**HR Setup, Processes & Administration

- Help build and formalize HR processes, policies, and documentation from the ground up.

- Manage onboarding and offboarding processes, ensuring accuracy, compliance, and a strong first and last experience for tea
mbers.

- Maintain and update HR records, templates, and internal guidelines as the company scales.

- Handle HR-related requests, documentation, and internal communications.



**Tea
mber Relations & Benefits Management

- Serve as the primary point of contact for tea
mber questions, concerns, and support.

- Administer benefits programs, including paid time off, leave requests, and other people-related benefits.

- Support a positive, respectful, and compliant work environment for both remote and on-site tea
mbers.



**Performance, Growth & Talent Development

- Coordinate performance review cycles and support the rollout of feedback and development frameworks.

- Partner with leaders to provide guidance on coaching, performance conversations, and growth planning.

- Support career development and internal mobility initiatives as teams expand.



**Process Improvement & HR Partnership

- Identify opportunities to streamline, automate, and improve HR workflows.

- Support HR system implementation and enhancements.

- Act as a strategic HR partner to leadership, offering people insights and recommendations as the organization grows.



Your Skills & Qualifications

- 3+ years of experience as an HR Generalist or in a similar HR role.

- Proven experience managing both contractor and employee relationships, particularly within the U.S.

- Hands-on experience in full-cycle recruitment across the U.S. and the Philippines.

- Proven success in recruiting for finance and accounting roles.

- Solid understanding of U.S. labor laws and HR compliance, including contractor-based models.

- Comfortable working in a startup or fast-growth environment where processes are being built and refined.

- Strong communication, problem-solving, and stakeholder management skills.

- Ability to manage multiple priorities in a dynamic and evolving environment.



What’s in it for You?

- 100% Remote Work – Support teams from anywhere in the Philippines

- Career Growth – Be part of a growing company with opportunities to help build teams and advance your HR career

- Competitive Pay – $8/hour + benefits as an independent contractor

- Paid Time Off – 7 days of PTO per year + paid holidays (100% extra pay if worked)

- Medical Aid Bonus – Monthly medical stipend

- Supportive Culture – Work closely with leaders in a collaborative, growth-oriented environment



If you’re excited about building, scaling, and shaping HR in a startup setting, we’d love to hear from you.

title: Executive Assistant
description:
**To apply, please upload an updated copy of your resume as well as a 2-3 minute video detailing your experience. 



Role Overview

We’re hiring an exceptional Executive Assistant to support the Chief Operating Officer of a fast-growing, multi-site services business. The COO runs the operational engine: field execution, staffing/scheduling, compliance, service quality, and cross-functional performance.

 

This role is for someone who can operate as a COO “air-traffic controller” — protecting time, closing loops, driving follow-through, and ensuring nothing critical drops across a high-volume environment.

This is not a “calendar only” role.

 

You are building leverage. You are running systems. You are the COO’s execution layer.

You will handle both professional and select personal responsibilities to reduce friction and keep the COO operating at peak effectiveness. You will be trusted with sensitive information and expected to exercise sound judgment.

 

Core Responsibilities

1) Calendar Management & Time Protection (Primary)

• Own and optimize a complex calendar across operational leadership cadence (daily/weekly/monthly).

• Schedule with intent: deep work blocks, site/branch time, leadership check-ins, buffer time, travel recovery.

• Proactively gatekeep: decline/redirect low-value meetings and clarify purpose/outcomes before booking.

• Coordinate multi-party scheduling across SLT, regional leaders, HR, finance, compliance, vendors.

• Build and maintain recurring rhythms:

o Weekly operating reviews

o KPI/scorecard meetings

o I
/escalation reviews

o Hiring/people reviews

o Site visits / branch reviews

• Maintain a rolling 2–4 week lookahead and flag conflicts early.

• Ensure every meeting has: objective, attendees, prep, agenda, materials, and next steps.

Outputs you own: weekly schedule plan, daily run-of-show, meeting cadence map.

2) Inbox Triage & Communications Command Center

• Triage COO inbox daily:

o Sort, flag, archive, respond where appropriate

o Draft replies in COO voice for approval

o Escalate only what requires COO decision

• Maintain a follow-up tracker and chase responses relentlessly.

• Coordinate responses across internal stakeholders to keep the COO out of thread chaos.

• Identify patterns in communication breakdowns and fix the system (not just the
).

• Manage sensitive/confidential communications with discretion.

Non-negotiable: nothing important goes unanswered or forgotten.

3) Follow-Ups, Action Items, and “Close-the-Loop” Execution

• Attend select meetings to capture action items, owners, deadlines (or request notes fro
eting owners and systematize).

• Maintain an operational action log:

o Decisions made

o Open items

o Due dates

o Accountability check-ins

• Proactively follow up with leaders to drive completion.

• Escalate when blockers persist and propose options, not problems.

• Ensure key commitments made by operations are documented and executed.

4) Project Coordination & Cross-Functional Ops Support

• Support COO on core operational initiatives (examples):

o Process standardization / SOP rollouts

o Onboarding improvements

o Staffing/scheduling efficiency projects

o Quality assurance and i
 tracking

o Compliance documentation workflows

o Vendor implementations (software, payroll, etc.)

• Coordinate project meetings, maintain timelines, track deliverables.

• Prepare brief status updates (1-pagers) so COO can see the whole board quickly.

• Track dependencies across HR, Finance, Compliance, Clinical, Recruiting, Scheduling.

This is coordination + pressure-testing, not “project management theater.”

5) Prep Materials, Briefing Packs & Meeting Excellence

• Create and distribute briefing packets in advance:

o KPI snapshots / dashboards (from ops analytics/CFO team)

o Agenda and desired outcomes

o Key context and risks

o Prior meeting notes and unresolved items

• Ensure the COO walks into every meeting prepared:

o correct documents

o latest numbers

o known landmines

o decision points highlighted

• Organize, version-control, and file meeting materials cleanly.

6) Travel & Logistics (White-Glove, Efficient)

• Plan and manage business travel:

o flights, hotels, car services, site visit routing

o itineraries with confirmations and contingency plans

• Build travel to maximize productivity:

o cluster meetings by geography

o add buffers for delays

o ensure time for prep and follow-ups

• Coordinate occasional personal/family travel as requested.

• Handle last-minute changes without drama.

• Maintain loyalty accounts, preferences, and travel profiles.

7) Vendor & External Stakeholder Communication

• Act as coordinator for operational vendors and partners:

o scheduling calls

o collecting proposals

o routing contracts for review/signature

o tracking deliverables and renewals

• Manage vendor communications professionally and promptly.

• Track contracts, renewal dates, and service issues.

• Ensure COO has clean decision memos: options, pricing, recommendation.

8) Personal Responsibilities (Selective, High-Impact)

To protect COO focus, this role includes targeted personal support, such as:

• Manage personal calendar integration.

• Coordinate family schedules and logistics.

• Schedule medical/dental appointments.

• Coordinate household vendors (maintenance, contractors, services).

• Manage gifting (holidays, birthdays, business relationships).

• Assist with special projects (events, trips, milestone celebrations).

• Maintain confidential personal documentation.

• Track key dates (anniversaries, deadlines, renewals).

• Ensure personal finances/admin tasks stay organized.

Scope is reasonable, but the goal is the same: eliminate friction.

Required Qualifications

• 5+ years supporting a senior executive (COO/CEO/President) in a high-tempo environment.

• Mastery of Outlook (calendar + inbox systems).

• Strong written communication and executive judgment.

• Proven ability to manage competing priorities without dropping details.

• Experience coordinating projects, deadlines, and stakeholders across departments.

• Absolute discretion with confidential information.

• Calm under pressure; high ownership; low ego.

Preferred

• Experience in healthcare services, home care, staffing-heavy businesses, multi-site operations, or regulated industries.

• Familiarity with Teams, SharePoint/OneDrive, Asana/Notion/ClickUp, CRM tools.

• Comfort working with data/KPI summaries (you don’t need to be an analyst, but you must be fluent).

Traits That Matter Here (Non-Negotiable)

• Proactive to the point of annoying (in a good way).

• Detail-obsessed but not precious.

• Fast and accurate.

• Strong backbone with tact.

Communication with tea
mbers via Slack

s on open estimates

title: Load Validation Specialist
description:
About Us

GH Logistics is a growing freight brokerage and asset based logistics company specializing in dry van and refrigerated freight, and as we scale nationally, we are hiring a detail driven Load Validation Specialist to serve as the final financial risk control gatekeeper before loads move to Finance and factoring, ensuring revenue integrity, billing accuracy, dispute prevention, and strict SOP compliance.



Role Overview

This role is the final operational owner of every load before invoicing and factoring submission. Your responsibility is to independently take loads to Complete Status, meaning fully documented, financially accurate, dispute free, and invoice ready within 24 - 48 hours of delivery. Your work directly protects carrier pay accuracy, customer billing integrity, revenue recognition, dispute prevention, Triumph factoring compliance, and overall Finance workflow efficiency.



What You’ll Be Doing

• Validate all loads before final status (Completed, Cancelled, or TONU)

• Ensure every load reaches complete status (fully documented, financially accurate, and dispute free)

• Review and correct load statuses in TMS 

• Enforce complete documentation (BOL, POD, white slips, rate confirmations, accessorials)

• Upload and verify documents in both TMS and ELD systems

• Confirm financial accuracy (rates, TONU logic, fines, accessorial charges, FSC)

• Own and investigate carrier disputes before escalation

• Apply correct TONU vs Cancel determinations

• Ensure 100% of loads contain clear, structured, audit-ready notes

• Maintain system hygiene across TMS and ELD systems

• Follow daily quality control triage and execution workflow

• Escalate only with documented evidence and recommended resolution

• Prevent incomplete or inaccurate loads from reaching Finance

• Prepare validated loads for factoring submission in accordance with factoring company requirements



What Success Looks Like

• 95%+ of loads reach Finance without rework

• 0 missing white slips at billing

• 0 financial math corrections from Finance

• No incomplete loads reach invoicing

• Disputes resolved without unnecessary escalation

• All loads invoice ready within 48 hours

• Factoring submissions meet factoring company compliance standards



Required Skills & Qualifications

• Experience in US freight brokerage, load auditing, QA, or operations control

• Understanding of dry van & refrigerated freight

• Knowledge of TONU logic, rate confirmations, accessorials, and FSC

• Familiarity with TMS, ELD systems, GPS tracking tools

• Strong documentation discipline and audit mindset

• Ability to enforce SOP without shortcuts

• High attention to financial accuracy

• Strong written and verbal English

• Minimum 50 WPM typing speed

• Comfortable working in a structured remote environment

• Comfortable being accountable as the final validation owner



Work Setup & Schedule

• Full Time | 7:00 AM – 5:00 PM CST (San Antonio time)

• Must work U.S. business hours

• Collaborative Zoom based work environment (open camera & unmute mic)

• Time tracking tools used to support accountability



Why Join GH Logistics?

• SOP driven operational systems

• High impact financial risk control role

• Direct involvement in revenue protection and factoring compliance

• Performance based growth opportunities

• Structured training and certification path



If you take pride in closing operational loops, enforcing standards, protecting revenue accuracy, and ensuring loads are audit ready and factoring-compliant, we would like to hear from you.



Apply Here: 
 



Visit us:

title: Video Editing & Graphic Design Agency
description:
We're looking for a TEAM or AGENCY — not individual freelancers.



We run a US-based digital marketing agency serving 30+ clients (and growing) in the healthcare/wellness space. We need a reliable sub-contractor agency that can handle high-volume ad creative production on an ongoing basis.



What We Need:

We need 2-3 new ad creatives per client per week across our roster of 30+ clients. This includes a mix of:



Short-form video ads (15-60 seconds) for
 and Instagram

Static image ads and carousel designs

Creative variations and iterations for A/B testing

Reformatting across placements (Feed, Stories, Reels)



This is a high-volume operation. We estimate 60-90+ pieces of creative per week, which is why we specifically need an agency or team with multiple editors and designers — not a solo freelancer.



What We're Looking For:



An established team or agency with at least 3-5 members (designers + video editors)

Proven experience producing direct-response ad creatives for
/Instagram

Ability to handle high volume with fast turnaround (48-72 hours per batch)

Experience with healthcare, wellness, or local service businesses is a strong plus

Familiarity with what performs well on Meta ad platforms (hook-driven content, UGC-style edits, pattern interrupts, etc.)

Proficiency in tools like Adobe Creative Suite, CapCut, Canva Pro, After Effects, or similar

Strong communication and project management (we use 
 and Google Drive)

Willingness to follow brand guidelines and templates across multiple client accounts



What You'll Get From Us:



Long-term, consistent work with a growing agency

Clear creative briefs, brand assets, and templates for each client

A structured workflow — we don't micromanage, we systemize

Prompt payment on agreed schedule

Opportunity to grow with us as we scale



Paid Test Project Required:



Before committing to a full engagement, we require a paid test project. We'll provide a creative brief, brand assets, and direction for one client — your team will produce 5 ad creatives (mix of video and static). This lets both sides evaluate the fit before scaling up to full volume.



To Apply, Please Include:



A brief intro about your team — how many people, what roles, and how long you've been operating

Portfolio samples of ad creatives you've produced (especially video ads for
/Instagram)

Your estimated monthly rate for this volume of work (60-90+ creatives/week)

Your rate for the paid test project (5 creatives)

Your typical turnaround time per batch of creatives

Any experience with healthcare or wellness brands



Please DO NOT apply if you are a solo freelancer. We respect your skills, but this role requires the capacity of a full team. We need redundancy, speed, and the ability to scale alongside us.



We're looking to start immediately and build a long-term partnership. If your team can deliver quality at volume — let's talk.

title: Carrier Sales Representative
description:
GH Logistics is a growing freight brokerage and asset-based logistics company specializing in dry van and reefer freight. Our strength comes from reliable carrier partnerships, disciplined execution, and scalable capacity across the U.S.



As our network continues to expand, we’re looking for a Carrier Sales Representative to help us build strong, long-term relationships with carriers and support clean, on-time freight execution. If you enjoy structured outbound work, building partnerships, and working in a fast-paced logistics environment this role offers clear expectations, measurable growth, and career advancement.



Role Overview

This role combines carrier network expansion and load coverage execution.



Carrier Development (Network Growth)

You will be responsible for:

• Reach out to 20-50 carriers daily to introduce GH Logistics

• Verify carriers for insurance, authority, safety, and compliance

• Complete carrier onboarding and setup documentation

• Educate carriers on our lanes and freight opportunities

• Position carriers for repeat, long-term business, not one time loads

• Create at least 1 group chat per onboarded carrier daily

• Send mass
s to carrier lists to support load coverage

• Maintain organized activity tracking and communication logs



Carrier Sales (Coverage & Execution)

• Cover shipments using GH approved carriers

• Source capacity through calls, load boards, and existing contacts

• Book at least 1 load through approved carriers

• Secure at least 1 dedicated lane per week through repeat carrier usage

• Manage carrier communication through structured group chats

• Follow up to create recurring lane opportunities

• Coordinate with internal teams to ensure smooth execution

• Update and maintain tracking spreadsheets daily with accurate activity data



What Success Looks Like

• Consistent 20-50 calls daily

• At least 5 quality carriers onboarded and activated regularly

• Carriers are fully set up, connected, and positioned for repeat freight

• Loads covered on time with clean communication

• Communication is centralized, documented, and reliable

• Carriers move from onboarding to activation to recurring usage



Who We’re Looking For

• Have experience in Carrier Sales, Dispatch, Freight Brokerage, or Trucking Operations

• Comfortable making 20 - 50 outbound calls per day

• Highly organized, tech savvy, and able to manage multiple spreadsheets and group chats

• Type at least 50 WPM

• Thrives in a fast paced and high urgency freight environment

• Communicate professionally via phone, chat, and

• Performance driven and KPI oriented

• Capable of leading structured carrier conversations and daily meetings

• Follows instructions consistently and executes with precision

• Team oriented, coachable, and open to feedback without ego



Schedule & Work Setup

• Full Time | Monday Friday

• 7:00 AM – 5:00 PM CST (San Antonio time)

• Must work U.S. business hours

• Collaborative Zoom based work environment (with camera open and unmuted audio)

• Time tracking software used for accountability and performance support



Compensation & Growth

• Starting Base: $8/hour (Up to $10/hour inclusive of performance incentives)

• Performance Incentives: Based on carrier onboarding, activation, and load execution

• Career Path: Carrier Development to Senior Carrier Rep to Account Manager. We promote based on performance and consistency.



Why Join GH Logistics?

• Structured systems and clear expectations

• Hands on leadership and direct feedback

• Defined KPIs and measurable growth

• Opportunity to grow within a scaling freight brokerage

• Performance based advancement



If you’re looking for a role where effort is recognized and growth is tied to output, we’d love to hear from you.

title: Customer Service Representative Pest Control Company
description:
ONLY APPLY IF YOU HAVE PEST CONTROL / FIELDROUTES CRM EXPERIENCE!



$
per month PLUS commissions on sales and bonuses!



We are a growing pest control company looking for a dependable and friendly Customer Service Representative (CSR) to join our team. Please only apply if you have experience in the pest control industry and are familiar with FieldRoutes software. We are looking for someone who communicates clearly, is comfortable on the phone, and is confident in helping customers and supporting our technicians.



Key Responsibilities:

Handle inbound calls from current and new customers

Make outbound calls to schedule services, follow-ups, and reminders

Take sales calls and confidently upsell additional services when appropriate

Provide friendly, professional customer support and problem-solving

Schedule routes and appointments accurately in FieldRoutes

Assist the team and technicians with daily service coordination

Complete required reporting and tracking forms consistently and accurately

Maintain a positive, solution-focused attitude with both customers and coworkers

Assist with putting reports and general admin duties



What We’re Looking For:

FieldRoutes experience is strongly preferred

Previous pest control industry experience

Comfortable talking on the phone and upselling

Strong organization and attention to detail

Reliable, punctual, and able to work independently once trained

Team player with a positive attitude





Please include a recording with your work experience.  In this recording we also want you to read the script below.



"The initial visit we do is what we call our “flush-out service.” It’s normal for us to treat the inside on that first visit, our technician will put down a fine mist right along the baseboards where bugs like to travel and our products are pet and people friendly so you can stay in the house while we’re there.

Then: We’ll move to the outside, where we focus on putting up barriers around the main house and yard so new pests can’t get back inside. We treat around the perimeter of the home and also focus on hotspots in the yard like cracks, crevices, bushes and sprinkler boxes. We also service around the block fence - and something unique to us is that we actually inject our product right into the block fence columns where scorpions like to nest and breed - this puts up a great barrier between you and neighbors who may not be doing anything for pest control."

title: Do you love making people feel cared for? Support our CEOs as an Executive Personal Assistant!
description:
Title: Executive Personal Assistant



Important: Make sure to read the full listing for application instructions.



Do you love making people feel cared for? Are you the one who remembers everyone’s birthdays, plans amazing gatherings, makes fun plans, and brings warmth into the lives of those around you?



This is NOT your typical assistant job. It’s deeply personal. You’ll work with a kind but intense U.S.-based pair of brothers (proven entrepreneurs working as Co-CEOs of the same business) to support their lives, not the company they are building. From keeping friendships alive and planning meaningful experiences to sending thoughtful gifts and helping them stay on track with personal goals, you’ll be part organizer, part cheerleader, part coach. If you’ve ever been called the “mom” of your group and you’re looking for a decades-long position, this might be your dream job.



Your Role

* Build trust by executing on tasks and communicating clearly, which will lead to taking on more responsibility, which will then lead to increases in pay.

* Keep relationships thriving by managing a personal CRM and helping stay in touch with friends and family.

* Use technology to help automate certain tasks that are repetitive.

* Track habits, support routines, and act as an accountability partner for personal goals.

* Pick out thoughtful, creative gifts for birthdays and other special 
nts.

* Research products, tools, and ideas to make life easier, better, or more fun.

* Plan and book unforgettable travel, great hotels, and the perfect dinner spots.

What’s In It for You

* Remote Flexibility: Work from the comfort of your home and gain flexibility with hours once trust is built.



Desired Attributes

* High attention to detail and organizational skills

* Minimum 50 Mbps Internet Speed

* Designated office space in your home



To apply and ensure your application is considered, do all of the following two steps:

2. Fill out this form:

3.  Add the Letters "PA" in the "What's your full name" field [E.g. PA - John Doe], so we know what role you are applying for.

title: Evidence Analyst
description:
Are you a detail-oriented, tenacious investigator who can find the needle while others are still searching for the haystack? If so, you may be ready to join 
, an industry-leading digital authentication Certificate Authority.




 is one of the few publicly trusted Certificate Authorities (CAs) that issues SSL/TLS, S/
, Code Signing, Document Signing, Client Authentication, and IoT certificates. As a voting member of the CA/Browser Forum (CA/B Forum), we are committed to maintaining the highest standards of trust, security, and compliance in the industry.



We are currently expanding our team of talented Evidence Analysts who support applicants in gathering and validating the documentation required for certificate issuance. This role requires strong attention to detail, analytical thinking, and a commitment to accuracy.



Key Responsibilities:



- Review and process new and existing customer orders across all supported certificate types.

- Research and verify evidence from public sources related to Legal Entities, their legal representatives, and registered/government/common trademarks.

- Prepare orders for callback and perform callbacks as required to verify their authenticity.

- Collaborate with customers to obtain required documentation and coordinate callback scheduling.

- Provide timely, professional support throughout the end-to-end validation process.






 is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace across the globe. We value diversity in all its forms and strive to maintain an environment where every employee is respected, supported, and protected from discrimination.

title: TikTok + Snapchat Media Buyer (Ecommerce, SE/NO) | Remote | $400/month + Profit Share
description:
About the role:



We are looking for a highly skilled Performance Media Buyer to take full ownership of our TikTok Ads and Snapchat Ads across multiple ecommerce brands selling in Sweden and Norway.



This is a hands-on role focused on profitability and scaling. You will manage the accounts day-to-day, build a structured testing system, and collaborate with our creative team to continuously improve performance.



What you will do



Launch, manage, and optimize TikTok and Snapchat campaigns (prospecting, retargeting, scaling)



Build and maintain a clean account structure that supports consistent testing and scaling



Daily optimization: budgets, bidding, audiences, placements, creatives, and pacing



Create and execute a clear creative testing plan (what to test, why, how to measure, what to scale)



Ensure tracking is set up correctly (pixel/events, attribution logic, UTMs, Shopify alignment)



Identify winning angles, audiences, and creatives, then scale while maintaining CPA and ROAS targets



Weekly reporting with insights and action steps (not just screenshots and numbers)



Requirements (must-have)



Proven experience managing and scaling TikTok Ads and Snapchat Ads for ecommerce



Strong understanding of direct-response performance marketing (CPA, ROAS, MER, LTV thinking)



Data-driven decision making and confident with testing frameworks



Ability to show real past results and explain what you did to achieve them



Strong communication and ownership mentality (you run the channel, not just “assist”)



Nice to have



Experience advertising to Nordic markets (Sweden, Norway) or Europe



Strong creative strategy instincts and ability to give clear feedback to editors/UGC creators



Shopify, GA4, pixel/event troubleshooting experience



Compensation



Base pay: $500/month



Performance-based profit share: A percentage of the profit generated from TikTok and Snapchat paid at the end of each month

(We will define the profit-share calculation clearly before you start.)



Working setup



Remote role



We prefer some overlap with Stockholm time (CET/CEST) for faster communication



How to apply



Please send:



A short intro and your relevant TikTok + Snapchat ecommerce experience



2 to 3 mini case studies including: spend, CPA, ROAS, revenue, and what you did to improve results



The markets/countries you have managed



Your availability (hours per week) and when you can start



Bonus: a short Loom (3 to 5 minutes) explaining how you would structure a 30-day test-and-scale plan for a new ecommerce brand



Screening question (mandatory)



In 5 to 10 bullet points, describe your exact weekly process for:



testing new creatives



d
 winners



scaling budgets



preventing creative fatigue



We are only hiring someone who can demonstrate real performance. If you are strong, this can become a long-term collaboration with more responsibility and higher upside.

title: B2B OUTREACH SPECIALIST
description:
Apexium is an AI automation platform that helps businesses scale through intelligent workflow automation and done-for-you implementation services. We offer a marketplace of 50+ AI-powered workflows (content automation, lead generation, e-commerce tools, real estate solutions, and more) alongside premium managed services where we build custom automation systems for businesses. Our clients include content creators, e-commerce businesses, real estate professionals, marketing agencies, and service-based companies looking to automate their operations and increase revenue.

The Role

We are looking for a driven and resourceful B2B Outreach Specialist to identify businesses that would benefit from our AI automation services and book qualified discovery calls with our sales team. You will be the first point of contact for potential clients. Your job is to find the right businesses, deliver our messaging, generate interest, and get them on a call with a separate tea
mber who handles the sales conversation.

This is not a cold-calling position. This is strategic outreach via
, LinkedIn, social media DMs, and other digital channels.

Responsibilities

Prospecting and Lead Research:



Identify and build targeted lists of businesses that fit our ideal customer profile across key niches including content creators, e-commerce sellers, real estate agents and investors, marketing agencies, coaches, consultants, and local service businesses.



Outreach Execution:



Send 100 to 300+ personalized outreach messages per week via
, LinkedIn, Instagram DMs, and other relevant platforms using our provided scripts and messaging frameworks.



Lead Qualification:



Engage with prospects who respond, answer initial questions about our services, and qualify them based on their needs, budget, and fit before booking a discovery call.



Discovery Call Booking:



Schedule qualified prospects for discovery calls with a separate sales tea
mber. Ensure prospects show up by sending confirmations and reminders.



CRM Management:



Log all outreach activity, conversations, and lead statuses in our CRM system (GoHighLevel). Keep records accurate and up to date.



Niche Research:



Stay current on the industries we serve. Understand common pain points in each niche so you can tailor your outreach and speak intelligently about how automation solves their problems.



Reporting:



Provide weekly reports on outreach volume, response rates, calls booked, and conversion metrics. Identify what is working and suggest improvements.



Script Refinement:



Collaborate with leadership to test and refine outreach scripts based on real-world responses and results.



Ideal Candidate



2+ years of experience in B2B outreach, lead generation, appointment setting, or business development.

Proven track record of booking qualified meetings or calls through cold outreach 
, LinkedIn, DMs).

Excellent written English. Your outreach messages will be going to business owners in the US, UK, Canada, and Australia. Grammar, tone, and professionalism must be on point.

Familiarity with outreach tools such as 
, 
, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, PhantomBuster, Instantly, or similar platforms.

CRM experience. Comfortable working in CRM systems to manage pipelines and track leads. Experience with GoHighLevel is a plus.

Highly proficient with AI tools. You must be comfortable using AI in your daily workflow — whether that is ChatGPT, Claude, or other AI assistants for research, copywriting, lead list building, personalization, and workflow optimization. We are an AI automation company, and we expect our team to use AI as a core part of how they work. If you are not already using AI tools regularly, this role is not for you.

Understanding of AI, SaaS, and automation. You should be able to explain the value of business automation in simple, compelling terms to business owners. You do not need to be a developer, but you need to understand what AI workflows do and why they matter.

Self-starter mentality. You can manage your own time, hit daily targets, and work independently without constant oversight.

Organized and detail-oriented. You will be managing hundreds of prospects at various stages. Nothing should fall through the cracks.



Target Industries You Will Be Reaching Out To



Content creators and digital media companies

E-commerce and Shopify store owners

Real estate agents, brokerages, and investors

Marketing agencies and consultants

Coaches, course creators, and online educators

Local service businesses (dental, legal, fitness, home services)

Freelancers and solopreneurs looking to scale



What We Provide



Proven outreach scripts and messaging frameworks

Access to our CRM and lead management tools

Training on our products, services, and value propositions

A dedicated sales tea
mber to handle the discovery calls you book

Clear KPIs and performance benchmarks so you always know where you stand



KPIs and Performance Metrics



Outreach volume: 100 to 300+ messages per week

Response rate targets

Qualified discovery calls booked per week

Show-up rate for booked calls

Pipeline value generated



How to Apply

Please include the following in your application:



A brief summary of your B2B outreach or lead generation experience.

Examples of industries or niches you have prospected in previously.

The outreach tools and CRM systems you have used.

Your availability and preferred working hours.

Any experience with AI, SaaS, automation, or tech-related products.

Which AI tools you currently use in your work and how you use them — be specific.



We are looking for someone who is hungry, organized, and understands that the quality of outreach matters just as much as the quantity. If you can find the right businesses, deliver a compelling message, and get them on a call, we want to hear from you. To confirm you read the entire job posting please start your application with the word "Crab".

title: Outbound Enrollment Closer – Career Certification Programs (Remote, EST)
description:
Outbound Enrollment Closer – Career Certification Programs (Remote, EST)



This is not customer service.

This is not inbound order-taking.



This is a phone-driven, outbound enrollment closer role for professionals who know how to control a consult, qualify fast, overcome objections, and close.



We are a U.S.-based online career school enrolling students into IT and Project Management certification programs (CompTIA, PMP, and related tracks). We provide warm leads. You bring the discipline, urgency, and closing skill.



What You’ll Be Doing (Daily Reality)
