Run structured, consultative enrollment calls (needs analysis ? recommendation ? close)



Control the call, set next steps, and ask for the enrollment



Handle objections around price, time, confidence, and urgency



Follow up relentlessly until the prospect converts or disqualifies



Log activity and outcomes accurately in CRM



Hit daily activity targets and monthly enrollment goals



Improve close rates through coaching, scripts, and call reviews



If you don’t like calling, this role will break you.



Who This Role Is For



Proven outbound / inside sales closers



Comfortable dialing daily and living on the phone



Strong command of English with clear U.S. cultural fluency



Confident asking direct questions and pushing for decisions



Competitive, coachable, metrics-driven



Organized and accountable without supervision



Experience selling education, training, coaching, or professional services is a major plus



Familiarity with certifications (CompTIA, PMP) helps—but closing ability matters more



Bachelor’s degree required



Who Should NOT Apply



Anyone who needs inbound-only leads



Anyone uncomfortable asking for money



Anyone who avoids objection handling



Anyone who wants a “soft” admissions role



Anyone who disappears when targets tighten



Schedule



Monday–Friday



10:00 AM – 6:30 PM EST



Compensation



Base pay: $1,200–$1,600 USD per month



Performance-based advancement and leadership path



Long-term role with stability and growth for performers



(Top performers move fast. Average performers don’t last.)



What You Get



Warm leads with real intent



Clear scripts, frameworks, and coaching



No gimmicks, no fake promises—just real programs that work



A sales culture that rewards results



Bottom Line



If you can:



Control a sales conversation



Build urgency without lying



Close consistently



Take coaching and improve



You will win here.



If not—this role will expose you quickly.

title: Digital Systems Manager
description:
Digital Systems Manager | Men's Health Tech Build & Launch

HIGHR – Remote Role

Part time - This role will progress to FULL TIME post launch. 



We’re HIGHR Health - a  digital health clinic with a focus on longevity & performance medicine. We are here to elevate health care in Australia - delivering real results through personalised telehealth, performance protocols, and proactive medicine. We operate at the intersection of cutting-edge diagnostics, longevity medicine, and extraordinary service. 



Our mission is to help men regain their edge, optimise their health, and live fuller, more meaningful lives. Using technology to carve a better way to better health, for men, driving individual progress with innovative process. We’re moving fast, thinking big, and set to make waves in the market.



Our national launch is imminent. We need someone to own and operate our entire tech stack so marketing, clinical ops, and logistics function as one system at scale.



The Role:



You'll be the internal operator of our complete digital operating system:



HubSpot (CRM, workflows, lifecycle automation, iteration, optimisation)

Patient Management Software (for secure clinical data separation)

Front end Website (wordpress)

Backend 3rd party providers eg; pathology & delivery partners

All integrations and data flows between systems



Important note: We have third party experts who  are building the necessary middleware and will handle the initial setup. You will be supporting & assisting these teams during build to then maintain, optimise, and control everything after that. 



In short, you don’t need to know exactly how to build the integrations (though you may), but you definitely need to know enough to be able to represent the brand and understand the technical nature of what we are building.



You'll Manage:



System operations across the business:

Design and maintain complex HubSpot workflows

Manage integrations (front end website through to parcel deliveries and all steps in between)

Ensure data integrity and hygiene,, backups,

Maintain privacy, access control, audit trails, and data handling aligned with Australian Privacy Act and healthcare operational requirements (with guidance from leadership/clinical governance)

Debug failures fast

Support rapid website/funnel iteration with marketing team

Translate business intent into system logic

Act as liaison between developers, SaaS vendors, clinical systems, operations



Must Have:



Operated a multi-system SaaS, ecom or healthtech stack (not just administered)

Strong HubSpot experience—complex workflows, lifecycle logic, not basic CRM use

Integration literacy: APIs, webhooks, middleware concepts

Operator mindset: optimisation > administration

Comfortable with AI tools and finding optimal solutions to drive business goals vs. being tied to any particular purist ideology



Nice to Have:



Subscription/lifecycle business exposure

Healthcare or regulated environment experience

Scale-up or early-stage environment experience

Light scripting or automation capability

What success looks like in stage one (first 6 months):

Supporting the team to build out the tech stack pre-launch

Liaising with 3rd parties on their input for build

Successful sandbox testing period before go live

Spotting and solving potential failure points prior to launch go live

Being instrumental in a successful public launch

Rapid iteration and stack management post launch 



Nice benefits of our culture:



Direct report to founding partner/Head of Operations

Meaningful ownership of a national health platform being built to scale

Work alongside a High-performing team doing high-impact work

See meaningful  results daily without carrying the responsibility of the strategy

Definite opportunity for career progression for the right person



Who This Isn't For:



People who just want to "maintain the stack" without caring about business outcomes

Anyone unwilling to support a high-performing team environment



Why HIGHR Health?



We’re building something ambitious, meaningful, and beautifully branded - You’ll help build it from the inside, with input, trust, and exposure from day one.

We value growth, ambition and loyalty. There is scope for this role to expand and offer career growth opportunities for the right person. 



Your founding team:



While you might not find much online about HIGHR (yet), Having founded and run multiple businesses in a variety of industries, this project is set to be the next big leap in all of our collective careers.

We look forward to meeting you and sharing our story, hearing yours and sharing this vision!

title: AFFILIATE AND CREATOR OUTREACH SPECIALIST
description:
Apexium is an AI automation platform that helps businesses and creators scale through intelligent workflow automation. We offer a marketplace of 50+ AI-powered workflows (content automation, lead generation, e-commerce tools, real estate solutions, and more) alongside premium done-for-you implementation services. Our affiliate program offers creators recurring commissions and CPM-based payouts for content they produce promoting our platform.

The Role

We are looking for an experienced Affiliate and Creator Outreach Specialist to build and manage our affiliate program by identifying, recruiting, onboarding, and supporting micro-influencers and content creators who will promote Apexium to their audiences. You will find creators in our target niches, pitch our affiliate program, get them signed up and producing content, and then manage the ongoing relationship — including tracking their video performance for CPM-based payouts.

This role is part recruiter, part relationship manager, part data tracker. You need to be someone who understands the creator economy, knows how to identify high-potential micro-influencers, and can manage multiple affiliate relationships at scale.

Responsibilities

Affiliate Recruitment:

Creator Identification:



Research and identify micro-influencers (5K to 100K followers) on TikTok, Instagram, YouTube, and X 
) who create content in relevant niches including AI tools, side hustles, passive income, content creation, business automation, e-commerce, and entrepreneurship.



Outreach Execution:



Send 50 to 100+ personalized outreach messages per week to potential affiliate partners via Instagram DMs,
, TikTok messages, YouTube comments, and other channels using our provided scripts and messaging frameworks.



Pitch and Persuasion:



Clearly communicate the value of our affiliate program — including our commission structure (recurring commissions on referral signups) and CPM-based payouts for content they create about Apexium. Handle objections and answer questions about the program.



Onboarding:



Walk new affiliates through the signup process, ensure they have access to our affiliate content library (pre-made videos, scripts, graphics, promotional assets), and confirm they understand how tracking, commissions, and payouts work.



Affiliate Management:

Ongoing Check-Ins:



Conduct periodic check-ins with active affiliates (weekly or biweekly depending on activity level) to maintain the relationship, answer questions, provide new content assets, and keep them motivated and producing.



Content Tracking:



Monitor and track videos and content that affiliates produce for Apexium. Record view counts, engagement metrics, and calculate CPM-based payouts (for example, a set dollar amount per 1,000 views on videos they create for us).



Payout Tracking and Reporting:



Maintain accurate records of each affiliate's content performance, view counts, referral signups, and earned commissions. Prepare payout reports for leadership review.



Performance Analysis:



Identify top-performing affiliates and recommend strategies to deepen those relationships. Flag underperforming affiliates and develop re-engagement strategies.



Asset Distribution:



Ensure affiliates always have fresh, up-to-date promotional materials including video clips, product demos, scripts, talking points, and graphics.



CRM Management:



Log all affiliate interactions, statuses, and performance data in our CRM system (GoHighLevel). Keep records accurate and organized.



Ideal Candidate



2+ years of experience in affiliate marketing, influencer outreach, creator partnerships, or a related field.

Strong understanding of the creator economy. You know how TikTok, Instagram Reels, YouTube Shorts, and long-form YouTube content work. You understand what motivates creators and how affiliate programs function.

Experience identifying and vetting micro-influencers. You can look at a creator's profile and quickly assess whether they are a good fit based on follower count, engagement rate, content quality, niche alignment, and audience demographics.

Excellent written English. Your outreach messages will be going to creators in the US, UK, Canada, and Australia. Communication must be professional yet personable — creators respond to authenticity, not corporate-speak.

Organized and data-driven. You will be managing dozens of affiliate relationships simultaneously while tracking content performance and payout calculations. Attention to detail is critical.

Familiarity with analytics tools. Comfortable pulling view counts, engagement metrics, and performance data from TikTok, Instagram, YouTube, and affiliate dashboards.

Experience with outreach and research tools such as PhantomBuster, Apify, 
, 
, or similar platforms for sourcing creator contacts.

CRM experience. Comfortable working in CRM systems to manage relationships and track activity. Experience with GoHighLevel is a plus.

Highly proficient with AI tools. You must be comfortable using AI in your daily workflow — whether that is ChatGPT, Claude, or other AI assistants for research, content analysis, outreach personalization, data tracking, and workflow optimization. We are an AI automation company, and we expect our team to use AI as a core part of how they work. If you are not already using AI tools regularly, this role is not for you.

Understanding of AI, SaaS, and automation. You should be able to explain what Apexium does in simple, compelling terms to creators who may not be technical. You need to understand what AI workflows are and why they matter so you can pitch them effectively.

Self-starter mentality. You can manage your own pipeline, hit recruitment targets, and maintain affiliate relationships without constant oversight.



Target Creator Niches



AI tools and automation

Side hustles and passive income

Content creation and faceless channels

Business automation and productivity

E-commerce and Shopify

Entrepreneurship and online business

Digital marketing and agency life

Real estate investing



Affiliate Program Details You Will Be Pitching



Recurring Commissions: Percentage-based recurring commission on every referral signup for the lifetime of that customer.

CPM Payouts: Creators earn a set dollar amount per 1,000 qualified views on videos they produce promoting Apexium (specific rate discussed during onboarding).

Content Library Access: Affiliates receive pre-made promotional videos, scripts, graphics, and demo footage to make content creation easy.

Tiered Commission Structure: Higher-performing affiliates unlock increased commission rates and bonuses.



What We Provide



Proven outreach scripts and messaging templates for creator recruitment

Access to our CRM and affiliate management tools

A complete affiliate content library with videos, scripts, and promotional assets

Training on our products, services, and affiliate program structure

Clear KPIs and performance benchmarks

CPM rate cards and payout calculation guidelines



KPIs and Performance Metrics



Creator outreach volume: 50 to 100+ messages per week

New affiliates recruited and onboarded per month

Number of active affiliates producing content each month

Total content pieces produced by affiliate network per month

Accuracy and timeliness of CPM tracking and payout reporting

Affiliate retention rate (percentage of affiliates still active after 90 days)



How to Apply

Please include the following in your application:



A brief summary of your experience in affiliate marketing, influencer outreach, or creator partnerships.

Examples of affiliate programs or creator campaigns you have managed, including any metrics or results you can share.

The platforms and tools you have used for influencer research and outreach.

Your familiarity with tracking content performance metrics (views, engagement, CPM calculations).

Your availability and preferred working hours.

Any experience with AI, SaaS, automation, or tech-related products.

Which AI tools you currently use in your work and how you use them — be specific. 

To confirm you read the entire job posting please start your application with the word "Crab"

title: Contract Admin
description:
The Role



As a Contract Administrator, you will hold a key position in our project team. You will be responsible for the end-to-end administration of contracts, ensuring financial accuracy through variation management and progress claims, and providing critical support to our Project Managers and Estimators.



Key Responsibilities



**Review, interpret, and administer head contracts, subcontracts, and supplier agreements.

**Manage variations, monthly progress claims, payment schedules, and three-way match purchase order processing.

**Work closely with Project Managers on cost tracking, forecasting, and the preparation of variation submissions.

**Track contract milestones and deliverables while maintaining accurate records of all contractual correspondence.

**Assist the Estimating team with tendering and bid submissions to support future growth.



Skills & Experience



**Proven background in contract administration roles, ideally within the HVAC or mechanical services industry.

**Competent in using modern software and apps with a high level of attention to detail.

**A strong team player with excellent communication skills.

**Ability to multitask and manage conflicting priorities in a fast-paced project environment.



Why Join Us?

**Australia-based company, day shift

**As part of a growing organisation, you will have opportunities to learn, grow, and develop new skills in a supportive environment.

**This is a dynamic and varied role, so you won’t ever be bored. Every day will bring new challenges and opportunities to learn.

title: ADVANCED N8N WORKFLOW SPECIALIST
description:
Apexium is an AI automation platform that helps businesses scale through intelligent workflow automation. We offer a marketplace of 50+ AI-powered n8n workflows and premium done-for-you implementation services. Our workflows span content automation, lead generation, e-commerce tools, real estate solutions, and multi-API integrations using Claude, OpenAI, ElevenLabs, RunwayML, Midjourney, and more. We need someone who can build complex, production-grade workflows fast and maintain them at scale.

The Role

We are looking for an advanced n8n workflow specialist who can build highly complex automation workflows quickly and at a professional level. Speed and quality are both non-negotiable. This is not a junior or learning position. You need to already be deeply experienced with n8n and capable of building multi-step, multi-API workflows with minimal hand-holding. If you cannot deliver production-ready workflows efficiently, this role is not for you.

You will be responsible for three core functions:



Building custom n8n workflows for our done-for-you clients based on their specific business needs and requirements, including setting up and configuring GoHighLevel sub-accounts and integrating them with custom workflows.

Troubleshooting and fixing workflow issues that are escalated to you by our customer service team when members report problems with existing workflows.

Maintaining and updating our existing workflow library — pushing improvements, fixing bugs, updating API integrations, and keeping everything running smoothly as APIs and platforms evolve.



Responsibilities

Custom Workflow Development:



Build custom n8n workflows for done-for-you clients based on specifications and requirements provided by the sales team after discovery calls.

Translate business requirements into functional automation systems. You need to understand what the client is trying to accomplish and engineer the right solution.

Integrate multiple APIs and services within single workflows including AI models (Claude, OpenAI, ElevenLabs, Midjourney, Runway), CRMs (GoHighLevel), social media platforms, e-commerce tools, databases, webhooks, and custom HTTP endpoints.

Build workflows that are clean, well-organized, properly documented with annotations, and easy for other tea
mbers to understand and maintain.

Deliver completed workflows within agreed-upon timelines. Turnaround expectations will be set per project, and you will be expected to meet them consistently.

Test workflows thoroughly before delivery. Handle edge cases, error scenarios, rate limits, and failure states. Workflows must be production-ready, not prototypes.



Troubleshooting and Support Escalations:



Receive workflow issue tickets routed to you by our customer service team when a member reports a problem with an existing workflow.

Diagnose the root cause of the issue — whether it is a configuration error, API change, credential problem, logic flaw, or something outside the scope of our support.

Fix issues that fall within the scope of our support and communicate the resolution clearly so customer service can relay it back to the member.

Identify issues that are outside scope (user error, third-party API outages, credential misconfigurations on the member's end) and document them clearly for customer service to communicate back.

Maintain a fast response time on escalated tickets. Members should not be waiting days for a workflow fix.



Workflow Library Maintenance:



Monitor and maintain our existing library of 50+ marketplace workflows.

Push updates when APIs change, endpoints deprecate, or platforms update their authentication methods.

Improve existing workflows based on member feedback, performance data, and new capabilities from API providers.

Document all changes and updates so the team stays informed on what has been modified and why.

Proactively identify workflows that may be at risk of breaking due to upcoming API changes and address them before they become member-facing issues.



Required Technical Skills



Expert-level n8n proficiency. You must be able to build complex multi-node workflows from scratch including conditional logic, loops, error handling, sub-workflows, webhook triggers, cron scheduling, data transformation, and multi-branch execution paths. This is the core of the job.

Strong API integration experience. You must be comfortable working with REST APIs, handling authentication (OAuth 2.0, API keys, JWT, custom headers), parsing JSON responses, managing rate limits, and chaining multiple API calls within a single workflow.

Highly proficient with Claude Code in VS Code. You must be able to use Claude Code within VS Code as your primary development environment for building and fixing n8n workflows. This means using Claude Code to rapidly generate workflow JSON, write and debug custom code nodes, troubleshoot broken workflows, refactor existing workflow logic, and accelerate every part of the build and maintenance process. We use AI to build AI. If you are not already using Claude Code in VS Code with n8n daily to move faster, you will not keep up with the pace we require.

Proficient with AI tools and APIs broadly. Beyond Claude, you should be comfortable working with OpenAI, ElevenLabs, Midjourney, RunwayML, and other AI service APIs. You should understand how to integrate AI model outputs into workflow logic, handle streaming responses, manage token limits, and optimize API costs.

JavaScript and Python proficiency. Many n8n workflows require custom code nodes (Function nodes, Code nodes). You need to be able to write clean, efficient code for data transformation, custom logic, API handling, and error management within n8n's code execution environment.

Webhook and HTTP request expertise. You must be comfortable building and consuming webhooks, configuring HTTP request nodes with dynamic headers and body payloads, handling pagination, and managing asynchronous callback patterns.

Database and data handling. Experience working with databases (PostgreSQL, MySQL, Google Sheets, Airtable) within n8n workflows for reading, writing, updating, and querying data.

GoHighLevel proficiency required. You must be experienced with GoHighLevel including setting up and configuring sub-accounts, building automation workflows within GHL, managing CRM pipelines, creating funnels, configuring calendar booking systems, setting up communication channels (SMS,
, voi
 drops), and connecting GHL to n8n workflows via API and webhooks. Many of our done-for-you clients receive a white-labeled GHL sub-account as part of their service, and you will be responsible for setting those up and integrating them with custom n8n workflows.

Error handling and reliability engineering. You must build workflows that handle failures gracefully — retry logic, fallback paths, error notifications, and logging. Workflows that break silently are unacceptable.



Ideal Candidate



3+ years of hands-on experience building n8n workflows in a professional or client-facing environment. Personal hobby projects do not count. We need someone who has built and delivered workflows for real businesses.

Proven ability to build complex workflows fast. Speed matters. We need someone who can take a set of requirements and deliver a working, tested workflow in hours or days, not weeks. If you work slowly or need extensive guidance on every project, this role is not for you.

Deep understanding of automation architecture. You think in systems. You can look at a business process and immediately map out how to automate it — what triggers, what steps, what APIs, what error handling, what edge cases.

Self-starter who requires minimal oversight. You will receive project specs and be expected to execute independently. You should be able to make smart decisions about implementation details without needing approval on every small choice.

Strong problem-solving and debugging skills. When a workflow breaks, you need to be able to trace the issue, identify the root cause, and fix it quickly. You should be comfortable reading API documentation, analyzing error logs, and testing in isolation.

Excellent documentation habits. Every workflow you build and every fix you implement should be documented clearly — annotations within the workflow, external documentation for the team, and clear notes for customer service.

Comfortable working under pressure. Client deadlines, escalated support tickets, and urgent workflow fixes are part of the job. You need to manage your time and priorities effectively.

Excellent written English. You will be communicating with tea
mbers and occasionally with clients about technical issues. Your written communication must be clear, professional, and easy to understand.



What We Provide



Access to our full n8n infrastructure and workflow library

API credentials and service accounts for development and testing

Clear project specifications and requirements documentation for each custom build

A customer service team that handles front-line member communication so you can focus on the technical work

Collaboration with leadership on workflow strategy and roadmap

Clear KPIs and performance benchmarks



KPIs and Performance Metrics



Custom workflow delivery speed and adherence to deadlines

Workflow quality (minimal revisions needed after delivery, no production failures)

Support ticket resolution time (time from escalation to fix)

Workflow library uptime and proactive maintenance

Documentation completeness and quality

Client and member satisfaction scores related to workflow delivery and support



How to Apply

Please include the following in your application:



A detailed summary of your n8n experience — how long you have been using it, the types of workflows you have built, and the complexity level of your work.

Two to three examples of complex n8n workflows you have built. Describe what each one does, which APIs and services it integrates, and what challenges you solved. Screenshots or video walkthroughs are strongly encouraged.

Your experience with AI APIs — specifically Claude, OpenAI, ElevenLabs, or similar services. Describe how you have integrated these into workflows.

Your experience using Claude Code in VS Code to build and fix n8n workflows. Describe your workflow — how do you use Claude Code in your development process to build faster and troubleshoot issues?

The programming languages you are comfortable with and how you use custom code within n8n workflows.

Your approach to error handling and workflow reliability — how do you ensure workflows do not break in production?

Your experience with GoHighLevel — describe your experience setting up sub-accounts, building automations, configuring pipelines, and integrating GHL with external tools and workflows.

Your availability and preferred working hours.

Your expected salary range.



We are not looking for someone who is still learning n8n. We need a specialist who already operates at an advanced level, uses AI tools to accelerate their work, and can deliver high-quality workflows at the speed our business requires. If that describes you, we want to hear from you.

To confirm you have read the entire job posting please start your application with the word "Crab"

title: Strategic Cold Email Specialist - Campaign Optimization & AI Integration
description:
Role overview

We’re hiring a high-agency Virtual Assistant to own end-to-end cold
 fulfillment for boutique, high-value clients. This is a delivery-first role: you will independently build campaigns from client brief ? live campaign ? optimization, own deliverability and technical reliability, and document SOPs so the owner can step away from day-to-day fulfillment.



Key responsibilities

• Full campaign ownership: intake, client research, ICP definition, lead sourcing, copywriting, workflow build, launch, and optimization.

• Lead sourcing & “5 arbitrages”: identify market geography, lead source, generational targeting, personal brand leverage, and timing to find best-fit prospects. Use Sales Navigator, Apify, custom directories, Google Maps, and other sources.

• Build & maintain automation: create 
 (or n8n) workflows that chain scraping ? enrichment ? AI personalization (Claude/GPT) ? Instantly.ai (sending) ? auto-responders. Train prompts/models for consistent tone.

• AI-driven personalization: use Claude/ChatGPT + structured prompts and examples to generate industry-specific, non-AI-sounding copy at scale. Manage prompt engineering and JSON handling inside 
.

• Deliverability & domain management: domain warmup, sender identities, multi-domain A/B testing, bounce mitigation, NeverBounce validation, and troubleshooting flagged domains.

• Monitoring & optimization: daily checks (reply rates, opens, bounce, domain health), weekly optimizations, A/B tests on subject lines/senders/angles, and proactive fixes.

• Auto-responder & qualification flows: configure AI-assisted reply qualification and automated Calendly booking when qualified.

• SOPs & documentation: produce repeatable playbooks (lead sourcing, copy frameworks by vertical, 
 module templates, campaign optimization playbook, troubleshooting guide).

• Client reporting & communication: weekly performance notes, meeting-ready summaries, and ad-hoc troubleshooting updates.



Required qualifications

• Proven experience building and running cold
 / outbound campaigns end-to-end (not just executing parts).

• Hands-on with: 
 (or comparable automation), Apify (or scraping tools), Sales Navigator, Instantly.ai (or Smartlead), NeverBounce, Claude, and ChatGPT.

• Demonstrable ability to write industry-specific, outcome-focused copy (biotech, recruiting, wealth mgmt., logistics, etc.).

• Experience setting up and troubleshooting multi-domain sending, warmups, and deliverability issues.

• Strong prompt engineering & workflow design skills (training models via 
 JSON prompts).

• Highly organized, proactive, and able to own outcomes with minimal oversight.

• Excellent written & spoken English.



Strong preference/pluses

• Agency or startup experience where you built systems from scratch.

• Proven track record of delivering 15–20 qualified intros in 90 days (or similar meeting-intro guarantees) for clients.

• Experience documenting SOPs and running R&D on new tools.

• Comfortable with advanced scraping sources (government filings, conference lists, directories).

Performance expectations & success metrics

• Consistently hit agreed reply/qualification benchmarks.

• Maintain healthy domain metrics and >3% target reply rates.

• Deliver clear SOPs and handover-ready documentation within the first 60–90 days.

• Owner should be able to step away from day-to-day fulfillment after 90 days.



Compensation & benefits

Competitive base pay + performance-based bonuses.

Fully remote with EST schedule.

Professional growth: training, career advancement, and real ownership of fulfillment responsibilities.

Paid Time Off for major U.S. holidays.

title: SaaS Marketing Platform Specialist — GoHighLevel (White-Label Business)
description:
We are building a white-label SaaS business that resells an all-in-one marketing platform (GoHighLevel) to local service businesses in the US, Australia, and UK. Think of it as selling a branded version of a CRM, booking system,
/SMS marketing tool, and review management platform — all under our own brand.

This is NOT a one-off gig. This is a long-term role with a clear growth path. You will start at 20 hours/week and grow into a full-time position within 60–90 days as the business scales. Pay increases are tied to measurable performance, not time served.

Your compensation will grow like this:



Start: $4–$5/hour, 20 hours/week

Month 2–3: $5–$6/hour, 25–30 hours/week (based on performance)

Month 3+: $6–$7/hour, full-time (based on client acquisition results)

Ongoing: $25 USD bonus for every new client you acquire through outreach



What You Will Be Doing

This role has two core functions:

1. Client Acquisition (60% of your time initially)



Research and build prospect lists of local service businesses (dentists, med spas, cleaning companies, gyms, etc.) using Google Maps, LinkedIn, and web searches

Run cold
 outreach campaigns using Instantly.ai or Smartlead

Personalize and send outreach sequences (templates provided)

Follow up with interested prospects via

Record and send short Loom video demos (2–3 minutes) showing prospects how the platform would work for their business

Manage the prospect pipeline in a Google Sheet and track all outreach activity

You will NOT be doing phone sales calls — everything is
-based and video-based



2. Platform Setup & Client Management (40% of your time initially, growing over time)

Set up and configure GoHighLevel sub-accounts for new clients using pre-built industry templates (called "Snapshots")

Customize each client's account: upload their logo, set brand colors, configure calendars, build pipelines, activate automations

Test all automations before client goes live

Send onboarding
s and training materials to new clients

Provide basic ongoing client support 
-based)

Generate and send monthly performance reports to clients

Monitor platform health: check automations, Twilio/Mailgun usage, and flag issues



Who We Are Looking For

REQUIRED:

Strong written English — you will be writing professional
s to business owners in the US, UK and Australia. Grammar and tone must be polished.

Experience with cold
 outreach or lead generation (even personal projects count)

Comfortable learning new software quickly — GoHighLevel training will be provided, but you need to be someone who can watch a tutorial and execute without hand-holding

Reliable internet connection and a quiet workspace

Available to overlap with Australian or US business hours for at least 2–3 hours daily

Self-starter who can work independently with minimal supervision — you will receive weekly priorities and daily check-ins, not micromanagement



STRONGLY PREFERRED (not required but will put you ahead):

Experience with GoHighLevel specifically

Experience with CRMs (HubSpot, Salesforce, Zoho, etc.)

Experience with Instantly.ai, Smartlead, Lemlist, or similar cold
 tools

Experience with Twilio, Mailgun, or similar communication APIs

Experience with Canva for basic design work

Experience with Loom for recording video walkthroughs



NOT SUITABLE:

If you are looking for a job where you are told exactly what to do every minute of every day, this is not the right fit. This role requires initiative.

If you are currently working 3+ other jobs and this would be something you do "on the side" with leftover energy, please do not apply. This role needs focus and quality, not just hours logged.

If you cannot commit to growing into a full-time role within 90 days, this is not the right fit.



What You Get

A long-term position, not a short-term gig — this business is being built for years, not months

Clear growth path from part-time to full-time with pay increases tied to real results

$25 USD bonus for every new client you personally bring in through outreach. Get 10 new clients in a month and you will receive $250 USD plus your monthly wage.

Full training on GoHighLevel (you will complete the official certification as part of onboarding)

A role where your work directly impacts business growth — you are not a task monkey, you are a core tea
mber

Flexible scheduling within the required overlap hours

Direct communication with the business owner — no layers of bureaucracy and you won't have to speak with the other departments in the business.



Tools You Will Use

GoHighLevel (core platform — training provided)

Instantly.ai or Smartlead (cold
)

Google Workspace (Sheets, Docs, Gmail)

Loom or similar (video recording)

Slack or WhatsApp (daily communication)

Canva (basic design)

Twilio and Mailgun (communication APIs — training provided)



How to Apply

I read every application carefully and I am looking for specific qualities. To show that you have read this entire posting and that you pay attention to detail, please do ALL THREE of the following in your application:



Start your application with the words "Platform Ready" — this tells me you read to the end.

In 2–3 sentences, describe a time you had to learn a new software tool or platform on your own (not in school, not in formal training — on your own initiative). What was the tool, why did you learn it, and how long did it take you to become comfortable with it?

Write a sample cold
 (3–5 sentences) introducing a marketing platform to a fictional dentist named Dr. Sarah Chen who runs a practice called "Bright Smile Dental" in Austin, Texas. This does not need to be perfect — I want to see your natural writing ability and tone.



Applications that do not include all three of these items will not be considered. I am not looking for the most experienced person — I am looking for the most resourceful, detail-oriented, and reliable person.



Timeline:

Applications reviewed within 3–5 days of posting

Top candidates will receive a paid test task ($20 USD)

Shortlisted candidates will have a brief Zoom or Loom interview

Start date: As soon as the right person is found

2-week paid trial period before confirming ongoing engagement

title: Video Contributor(Iphone 11 or newer and head mount)
description:
This project focuses on collecting first-person (POV) video to train AI and robotics models. As a contributor, you will record POV footage of your everyday household and work activities using a head-mounted iPhone and our specific recording application.

Contributors from any country are welcome to participate. You must already have or be willing to purchase an iPhone 11 or newer and a head-mount for it.



Recording should be done with a head mount—?neck and chest mounts are not acceptable.

Each video you upload must be of a specific task, and NOT a mix of tasks. For example, one video upload should not have you doing both cooking and laundry. Instead, you should record separate videos of cooking and then doing the laundry, and upload both separately.

Ideally, you should record a mix of tasks between 15-30 minutes long.

The space where you record your video should have excellent lighting.

Keep the camera steady with minimal shaking.

All submitted footage must exclude any other individuals' faces unless they directly consent. Additionally, no third party music is permitted in the footage to avoid copyright violations.

No children should appear in the submitted footage.

Minimize external noise during the recording–especially talking–so the audio of the task can be captured clearly and keep the camera as steady as possible throughout the recording.

Complete each task from start to finish without walking away or leaving to do another task or take a break.

Tasks should be performed while either standing up, sitting on a chair/stool, not while sitting on the ground.

Perform all activities in a controlled, slow manner.

title: Digital Marketer - Newsletters, Image Database & Website
description:
We are a travel company designing holidays in Australia. We need an experienced digital marketer to help us with uploading images into our database and adjusting hotel and tour descriptions.

Furthermore, we need help creating our newsletter, which will display news about hotels and tours - basically very similar content to our database.

We are looking for help about 2 days per week. Can be 2 full days or same amount of hours spread across more days.



Tasks:

- Uploading images into our database

- Adjusting hotel and tour descriptions into our wording, then upload into our database (we are okay with the use of ChatGPT if you like working with it)

- Control existing descriptions and check for correctness, correct if necessary

- update existing images if they are no longer showing the current state of the product

- request new images with suppliers and ask them to check our current description

- Creating our newsletter with input from the manager which news to feature



Requirements:

- qualification

- experience working with software

- ability to choose pretty and meaningful images over not so pretty ones

- understanding of Office Word

- experience working with Mailchimp

- ideally experience with Photoshop or similar

- ideally experience with updating websites / website programming

- experience with marketing, ideally in the tourism industry 

- good attention to detail

- good
 manners



Regarding work hours, we are happy to agree to days and times that fit with your other work or private arrangements.

We are a small, family-run business and our main focus is a stable team that is beneficial to everyone involved.

title: Pinterest & Instagram Content Creator (Amazon Affiliate Marketing)
description:
We are seeking a creative, detail-oriented Pinterest and Instagram Content Creator to support our growing Amazon affiliate brand. This role is responsible for designing and publishing daily Pinterest pins and Instagram content that promotes curated Amazon products while maintaining a cohesive, branded aesthetic.



The ideal candidate understands visual marketing, trends on Pinterest and Instagram, and how to create scroll-stopping content that drives clicks and conversions.



Key Responsibilities:



Create and design daily Pinterest pins optimized for traffic and affiliate conversions

Develop engaging Instagram content (posts, reels, stories, carousels) promoting Amazon products

Maintain a consistent, on-brand visual aesthetic across platforms

Write compelling captions with strong calls to action

Conduct light product and trend research to identify high-performing items

Format content with SEO-friendly keywords and hashtags

Schedule and publish content (if applicable)

Track basic performance metrics and adjust creative accordingly



Qualifications:

Experience creating content for Pinterest and Instagram

Strong graphic design skills (Canva, Adobe, or similar tools)

Understanding of affiliate marketing and conversion-focused content

Knowledge of Pinterest SEO and Instagram hashtags

Ability to follow brand guidelines and maintain visual consistency

Strong communication and ability to meet daily deadlines



Bonus Skills (Preferred but Not Required):

Experience with Amazon Affiliate programs

Basic analytics knowledge (Pinterest Analytics, Instagram Insights)

Short-form video editing (Reels)

UGC-style content creation

title: Full-Time Facebook Ad Video Editor
description:
Important – Who This Is NOT For

As much as we value growth and potential, this role is not for:

* Editors without direct experience creating
/Meta video ads

* Editors who have only worked on YouTube, cinematic, or organic content

* Freelancers without experience editing for Shopify or DTC brands

* Editors unfamiliar with performance-driven ad structure

* Those without hands-on experience using b-roll overlays, hooks, pattern interrupts, and direct response pacing



**If you do not have at least 1+ year of direct experience editing paid Meta ads, this role is not a fit and your application will not be considered**



If you do, continue reading.



Who We’re Looking For



We are hiring a full-time
 Ad Video Editor with proven experience editing high-converting ads for Meta ads.



You Have:

* Minimum 1+ year of direct experience editing paid Meta ads

* Experience working with Shopify e-commerce brands

* Strong understanding of direct response advertising

* Proven ability to structure:

    * Scroll-stopping hooks

    * Clear problem/solution flow

    * Strong CTAs

* Experience layering b-roll overlays, captions, motion graphics, and pattern interrupts

* Knowledge of what makes ads convert (retention, pacing, visual hierarchy)





Day-to-Day Responsibilities

* Edit 2
/Meta ad creatives per day

* Daily communication w/ strategists and team

* Source and layer b-roll overlays to increase retention

* Add dynamic captions, graphics, and motion elements

* Create multiple hook variations from the same footage

* Review performance data and iterate creatives accordingly

* Maintain organized file structures and version control

* Deliver edits on schedule without sacrificing quality



Skills Verification (Required Before First Interview)

To ensure alignment and verify capabilities, all shortlisted applicants must complete a before the first interview.

You will be provided:

* Raw footage

* Brand context

* Reference video to model editing off of

* Clear performance objective



You will be evaluated on:

* Hook strength

* Structure and pacing

* Use of b-roll overlays

* Overall direct-response effectiveness



Only candidates who meet the performance standard will move forward to interviews. When submitting your job application: Please submit your resume, Meta Ads you’ve previously edited, and your favorite soda.



Compensation & Growth

* Full-time role

* Extremely generous perrformance-based incentives

* Clear path for rate increases based on output and impact

* We operate at a high standard and reward strong performance accordingly.

* Ongoing training and performance feedback

* Opportunity to grow into senior creative leadership





 Hiring Process

1. Submit application + portfolio with proven
 ad work.

2. Once hiring manager responds, complete test edit based on provided intructions

3. Interview 1

4. Final Interview 

5. Reference Check and Offer

title: Sports Content & Growth Specialist (LiveBag)
description:
Objective: To build brand awareness for a new youth sports app by "hijacking" competitor content and managing creator outreach.



Daily Tasks:

?Content Hijacking: Scour TikTok/IG for trending youth sports clips, apply LiveBag branding/neon effects, and repost with viral hooks.



?Guerrilla Outreach: DM 20–30 local sports videographers/parents daily to invite them to the "Elite Waitlist."



?Community Engagement: Comment on 50+ posts per day from competitors (BallerTV, etc.) to divert attention to LiveBag.



Requirement: Must be a sports fan and proficient in CapCut/Canva.
